titles: Relieved: Kumaraswamy as nephew Prajwal says he'll appear before SIT
descriptions: Former Karnataka CM and JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy has reacted to his nephew Prajwal Revanna's statement that he'll appear before the SIT, saying, "It has brought us relief." Prajwal, who is accused of sexually abusing multiple women, reportedly escaped to Germany on April 27. "I [had]...requested him to return if he has respect towards karyakartas," Kumaraswamy added.

titles: Girl dies in sleep after bleeding from nose in Tamil Nadu
descriptions: A seven-year-old girl died in her sleep after suddenly starting to bleed from her nose in Tamil Nadu's Salem. Police said she went to sleep after dinner and her mother rushed her to hospital after noticing the bleeding. Police have sent her vital organs for viscera test to determine if any poisonous substances were present in the food.

titles: Man shoots DJ for denying alcohol in Ranchi bar
descriptions: A disturbing video surfaced of a man fatally shooting a DJ in a Ranchi bar after a dispute over liquor service. The shooter, among five criminals, concealed his identity with a T-shirt. The DJ, Sandeep, succumbed to his injuries despite being rushed to the hospital. Police are scrutinizing CCTV footage for identification.

titles: Were you doing disco dance with China?: Owaisi after PM's 'mujra' remark
descriptions: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi over his "Opposition performing mujra for vote bank" remark. "You talked about mujra, so Asaduddin Owaisi wants to ask you that for the last three years, China has occupied 2,000 square kilometres of Indian land, Modi ji, you aren't removing China, so were you doing disco dancing with China?" he asked.

titles: Gravely disturbed: NCW as BJP claims Balkar masturbated on call
descriptions: National Commission for Women (NCW) has said that it's "gravely disturbed" by allegations against Punjab minister Balkar Singh and called for an urgent and impartial investigation by the state police into the matter. This comes as BJP claimed that Balkar masturbated on a video call with a female job seeker. The NCW also sought a comprehensive report in three days.

titles: Indore administration removes loudspeakers, gets criticised
descriptions: Over 400 loudspeakers removed from religious sites in Indore prompted criticism from Muslim leaders. Police followed state government directive, taking down 437 loudspeakers in 48 hours. Shahar Qazi demands adherence to noise limits. Indore Collector states removal is mandated by the state, echoing the Chief Minister's order banning loudspeakers exceeding permitted volumes.

titles: K'taka farmer sells 1,800 kg mangoes via online portal in 2 months
descriptions: Gudipadu Anjaneya, a farmer from Karnataka's Raichur, has sold 1,800 kg mangoes in two months using an online portal, Local 18 Kannada reported. Anjaneya's portal was launched by Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited in collaboration with the India Post. His business has now spread to other states and he aims to formulate work relations with foreign countries.

titles: SBI alerts customers about fake messages, reward points
descriptions: SBI has alerted its crores of customers about receiving many fake messages. Customers are being warned about fake reward point redemption notifications. The bank has advised customers not to click on any link sent through SMS or WhatsApp nor download any application or file. The bank has said that it never sends links on SMS or WhatsApp.

titles: Balkar Singh laughs off questions about obscene videos
descriptions: Punjab Minister Balkar Singh laughed when questioned about the viral obscene videos by media on Monday (May 27). After laughing off the serious questions, he agreed to talk to the media, only to say he had "no comments" to make on the grave allegations against him. "I have no comments and (it's) not in my knowledge," he said.

titles: Muslims in Tamil Nadu donate land to Hindus to build a temple
descriptions: In a display of communal harmony, a group of muslims donated a piece of land to their hindu neighbours for the construction of a temple in Ootappalayam village, in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur district. Muslims donated three cents of land to their neighbours, and the market value of the land donated is said to be ₹6 lakhs.

titles: Mercedes used for driver's kidnapping after Pune Porsche crash seized by police
descriptions: Pune Police investigating the Porsche crash case have seized a Mercedes car owned by the accused minor's family and used allegedly to kidnap the driver who was being forced to take the blame for the accident. Earlier, the 17-year-old accused's grandfather was arrested for confining the driver and forced him to take blame. Two 24-year-old techies died in the crash.

titles: Fire breaks out near Neem Karoli Baba Ashram in Nainital
descriptions: A fire broke out in the hills near the Neem Karoli Baba Ashram Kainchi Dham in Nainital, Uttarakhand on Tuesday. No injuries were reported in the incident and the extent of the fire hasn't been confirmed. Visuals of the fire in the hills of the forest surfaced on social media. The cause of the fire is yet not known.

titles: How did police find Audi which flung a man in air after hitting him in Noida?
descriptions: Noida Police have seized the Audi that hit a 63-year-old man out to buy milk, tossing him in the air and killing him on the spot. The police deployed seven teams to track the car and scanned through over 150 CCTV cameras. It was found parked in a parking lot in Delhi's Kidwai Nagar with Haryana number plate, police said.

titles: No one will be spared: Maharashtra CM Shinde on Pune Porsche crash
descriptions: While reacting to the Pune Porsche crash incident, in which two engineers died after a 17-year-old crashed his vehicle into their bike, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that "no one will be spared". "No matter how rich or poor a person is, the law is equal for all...The two people who have died were also someone's children," CM Shinde added.

titles: Good bye Narendra Modi! 7 days left for fake fakir: Rahul Gandhi
descriptions: Continuing his attack on Narendra Modi-led central govt Rahul Gandhi said, "After June 4, Good Bye BJP, Good Bye Narendra Modi, Tata! Only 7 more days are left for the fake fakir who cheats the public. INDIA is getting votes - Khatakhat Khatakhat! The country will get freedom from BJP, ache din are about to come- Fatafat Fatafat!"

titles: 3 members of a family found dead in Karnataka, murder suspected
descriptions: Three members of the same family were found dead under suspicious circumstances in Hosalingapur of Koppal taluk on Tuesday. The deceased are Rajeshwari (50), her daughter Vasantha (28), and Vasantha's son Saidharmathej (5). Vasantha had been living in a rented house in Hosalingapur with her mother and son.

titles: Senior AIMIM leader Virasat Rasool Khan passes away
descriptions: Senior All India Majlis e Ittehadul Muslimeen leader and former MLA Virasat Rasool Khan, passed away due to health problems on Tuesday. He was associated with the AIMIM party for close to four decades. Virasat was first elected as a MLA from Charminar constituency in 1989. Later, he was elected from Nampally Assembly constituency in the year 2009.

titles: 169 colleges found 'suitable' by CBI to be re-examined: MP HC
descriptions: In a major decision in the Nursing College Scam, the Madhya Pradesh High Court has ordered to re-examine 169 nursing colleges found 'suitable' in the report prepared by the CBI. Recently, the same CBI officer who had been investigating the infamous Madhya Pradesh Nursing College scam for three years was arrested while accepting a bribe.

titles: Delhi Court summons Atishi over BJP 'Poaching' defamation case
descriptions: Delhi's Rouse Avenue Court has summoned AAP Minister Atishi on June 29 in a defamation case filed by BJP's Delhi media head, Praveen Shankar Kapoor. Atishi is accused of making false 'poaching' allegations. She questioned how BJP forms governments without a majority and why cases against BJP-joining leaders are closed. BJP's Bansuri Swaraj responded, saying AAP often makes false accusations.

titles: Food poisoning from Biryani in Thrissur: 1 dead, 178 hospitalised
descriptions: In Thrissur, a biryani from a local restaurant caused 178 people to fall ill, leading to one death. After symptoms like vomiting and diarrhoea emerged, authorities shut down the unhygienic restaurant and launched an investigation. Food samples suggest mayonnaise in "kuzhimanthi" might be the cause. Legal actions are forthcoming.

titles: K'taka HC upholds 5% service charge cap on app-based auto rides
descriptions: The Karnataka High Court has upheld the state government's order capping the service charge levied on app-based auto rides at 5%. The order was challenged by ride-hailing platforms Ola, Uber and Rapido. "The writ petitions stand dismissed...The aggregators would be entitled to collect service charges of up to 5% in addition to the fixed fare," the court said.

titles: 3 Delhi-NCR weather stations record max temperature of nearly 50°C
descriptions: Three weather stations in Delhi-NCR recorded a temperature of nearly 50°C on Tuesday, as per the India Metrological Department (IMD) data. While both Mungeshpur and Narela had a maximum temperature of 49.9°C, Najafgarh reported a temperature of 49.8°C. The data also showed that four other stations, Faridabad, Jafarpur, Pitampura and Pusa, reported a temperature of over 48°C.

titles: Israel's real aim in Rafah is Egypt not Hamas: Ex-Egyptian General
descriptions: A former Egyptian General in an interview has claimed that Israel's real aim in Rafah is not Hamas but Egypt itself. Retired Brigadier General Samir Ragheb's remark came after clashes between Israel and Egypt near the Rafah crossing on Monday, which resulted in the death of an Egyptian soldier. Both countries' governments said the incident was being investigated.

titles: Why will Dera chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim be in jail despite acquittal?
descriptions: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been acquitted in the murder of a manager in 2002 but will remain in jail due to convictions in two other criminal cases. He was convicted of two counts of rape in August 2017 and the murder of journalist Ram Chander Chhatrapati in 2019. He also allegedly castrated 400 male followers.

titles: Mother slaps 11-year-old son repeatedly, sits on him in Haryana, father files complaint
descriptions: A man shared a video of his wife sitting on their 11-year-old son's chest and slapping him repeatedly in Faridabad, Haryana. He lodged a police complaint against her cruel behaviour and said that she threatened to poison herself and their son when he intervened. Identified as a doctor, she's very possessive and has installed CCTVs everywhere in house, he said.

titles: India needs a strong leader with respect: S Jaishankar
descriptions: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The world is in a tense situation and the ongoing conflicts would not end so quickly." "That's why India needs a stable government, a strong and powerful leader with networking, standing and respect," he added. He further said that the electorates should wisely vote "as similar conflicts could happen on our borders".

titles: Video shows Rahul Gandhi pouring water on head mid-speech
descriptions: A video showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pouring water on his head while addressing a rally surfaced. In the video, Rahul can be seen telling people "it's too hot today" and takes a water bottle and pours it in his head. His action got a loud cheer from the crowd. On Tuesday, Rahul Gandhi campaigned in Varanasi with Akhilesh Yadav.

titles: News24 exit poll predicting AAP win in West Delhi is a deepfake
descriptions: A video purporting to show News24's Manak Gupta predicting AAP's candidate win from West Delhi in the Lok Sabha elections is fake and has been created using AI-generated voice clone of Gupta. BOOM found that the claims are false; both Manak Gupta and the verified handle of Today's Chanakya exit poll on X clarified that the video was a deepfake.

titles: Court denies Umar Khalid bail in 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case
descriptions: The Delhi Court denied Umar Khalid's bail request in the 2020 Delhi riots case under UAPA. Khalid, a former JNU student leader, has been in custody since September 2020. He asked for bail due to delays and other accused getting bail. Special Judge Sameer Bajpai rejected his request again.

titles: Senior AIMIM leader Virasat Rasool Khan passes away in Hyderabad
descriptions: Senior All India Majlis e Ittehadul Muslimeen leader and former MLA Virasat Rasool Khan, passed away due to health problems on Tuesday. He was associated with the AIMIM party for close to four decades and represented the Nampally constituency between 2009 and 2014. He is the brother of Vizarat Rasool Khan, a renowned educationist who passed away ten years ago.

titles: 'Chamchas' asking PM Modi how he eats mangoes in interviews: Rahul
descriptions: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi's recent interviews, claiming that "chamchas" are asking him how he eats mangoes, if he cuts or peels them and if he washes them. He also commented on PM Modi's 'God sent me' remark, saying, "Everyone else is biological...[PM Modi] isn't biological...upar se tapak kar aaye hai (he was dropped from the sky)."

titles: Did Rahul Gandhi say Congress wants to destroy Constitution?
descriptions: A video purporting to show Rahul Gandhi saying the Congress party wants to destroy India's democracy and the Constitution while the BJP would protect the same, is fake and has been created by altering the audio of the viral clip. BOOM found that the video has been doctored by splicing and stitching together different parts of the audio.

titles: Special task force formed in Uttarakhand after Jain monks harassed
descriptions: A video of a man harassing Digambar Jain monks in Uttarakhand goes viral, prompting police to form a Special Task Force. The culprit, a Tehri resident, faces charges under the IPC and IT Act. Monks, adhering to their faith, peacefully responded before leaving. The Uttarakhand DGP assures respect for all religions and vows strict action.

titles: Dalit sex abuse victim, whose brother was beaten to death, dies after fall from ambulance
descriptions: A Dalit woman, whose family was pressured to withdraw a sexual harassment case in MP's Sagar, died on Sunday. The woman's 18-year-old brother was beaten to death and her mother was stripped during a mob attack led by her harassers last year. Her uncle was recently beaten to death, while she died after falling from the ambulance carrying his body.

titles: We will repeal Agniveer scheme & throw it in dustbin: Rahul Gandhi
descriptions: While addressing a rally in UP, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Agniveer scheme and said, "Prime Minister Narendra Modi has turned our soldiers into labourers." Rahul said, "We are against the Agniveer scheme. We will repeal the Agniveer scheme and throw it in dustbin." He added, "The youth of the country and jawans are being disrespected by this scheme."

titles: PM Modi to meditate at Vivekanada's spot after hectic campaign
descriptions: Following the conclusion of the intense Lok Sabha 2024 election campaign on May 30, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit the iconic Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu. This visit, intended as a spiritual retreat, will see PM Modi engaging in deep meditation at the Dhyan Mandapam, where Swami Vivekananda once meditated.

titles: Big tech opposes India's EU-like antitrust proposal
descriptions: A US lobby group for tech giants like Google, Amazon, and Apple is urging India to rethink its EU-like new Digital Competition Bill. The law aims to control how big digital firms use data and treat partners. Concerns include higher user costs and less investment. The Indian government will review feedback before getting parliament's approval.

titles: Red heatwave warning issued for 7 states/UTs; IMD releases list
descriptions: The IMD has issued a red heatwave alert for Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, West Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh for the next five days. An orange heatwave alert has been issued for Vidarbha and East Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, Jammu division, Himachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Bihar, Jharkhand and Odisha have received a yellow heatwave warning from the weather department.

titles: Doctors given ₹3 lakh to alter Porsche teen's blood sample: Report
descriptions: In the Pune Porsche crash case, a peon and two doctors were arrested for allegedly manipulating the blood test report of 17-year-old accused Vedant Agarwal. According to a report by NDTV citing sources, the peon, Atul Ghatkamble, reportedly acted as a middleman, collecting a ₹3 lakh bribe from the Agarwal family intended for the two doctors.

titles: PM Modi to meditate at Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Tamil Nadu
descriptions: PM Modi will meditate at the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Tamil Nadu on May 30. He'll spend 24 hours in meditation, emulating Swami Vivekananda. The site, near Tamil saint Tiruvalluvar's statue off Kanniyakumari's coast, awaits his visit. With Lok Sabha elections ending on June 1, Modi aims for a third term. Congress in opposition, Modi preps a 100-day agenda.

titles: Popular Gurgaon influencer arrested for human trafficking
descriptions: Bobby Kataria, a social media influencer, was arrested on charges of human trafficking and fraud. Police stated that Kataria deceived two UP residents by promising them job permits for UAE and Singapore in exchange for ₹4 lakh. Instead, the men were taken to Laos and forced to work in an illegal call centre, where their passports were confiscated.

titles: CBI charges Shahjahan Sheikh with attempted murder in Sandeshkhali
descriptions: The CBI has charged suspended TMC leader Shahajahan Sheikh, his brother, and five others with conspiracy and attempted murder. This happened after a mob attacked an Enforcement Directorate team in Sandeshkhali on January 5. The charge sheet, filed in Basirhat court, is related to a ration distribution scam in West Bengal.

titles: Impersonator of Cannes Grand Prix winner Payal Kapadia viral on X
descriptions: An account impersonating Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia has gone viral on X, with many users, including a few celebrities and public figures, being misled into believing it's Kapadia's real account. BOOM found that the account does not belong to Kapadia, and has gone by several different handles before impersonating Kapadia with the username @PayalKapadial.

titles: Assam CM orders closure of schools amid weather red alert
descriptions: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced the closure of schools in districts where weather red alert has been issued, including Nagaon, Hojai, and Golaghat, on May 29. With safety as the top priority, this proactive measure aims to protect students and citizens from potential risks. Citizens are urged to stay indoors and follow government advisories for their safety.

titles: PM Modi to meditate where Swami Vivekananda meditated ahead of poll results
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi will visit the Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari and will meditate at the same place where Swami Vivekananda did meditation. He will meditate from the evening of May 30 to the evening of June 1, before the results of the Lok Sabha elections are declared. The seven-phased polls began on April 19 and will end on June 1.

titles: KCR wanted BJP's Santosh arrested to end Kavitha's ED case: Ex-DCP
descriptions: Former Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao tried to use BRS MLA "poaching case" to get BJP leader BL Santhosh arrested, former DCP P Radha Kishan Rao, an accused in the phone-tapping case, claimed in his confession statement. He alleged that KCR did so to force the BJP to "compromise" to "get rid" of the ED case against daughter K Kavitha.

titles: Old Prega News ad viral as Congress Mahalaxmi Scheme campaign
descriptions: An old video ad by Prega News, a pregnancy test kit brand has been edited and shared with the false claim that it's a new ad by the Congress party on the Mahalaxmi Scheme. BOOM found that the video shows a 2022 Women's Day ad by Prega News that has been edited to falsely claim it's a Congress campaign video.

titles: Can't say you have explored India by just visiting Taj Mahal: PM
descriptions: In an interview, PM Narendra Modi stated that there are several tourist destinations in India and just visiting the Taj Mahal doesn't amount to exploring India. "We organised the G-20 Summit across the length and breadth of the country...The purpose and thinking behind this was to make the world aware that Delhi alone doesn't represent the country," PM Modi said.

titles: What are the new driving license rules effective from June 1?
descriptions: Driving license applicants will be able to take driving tests at accredited private driving schools from June 1, 2024, with 29-hour training period (over four weeks) for light vehicles. Fine for driving without valid licenses can go up to ₹2,000, while for minors caught driving, the penalty is ₹25,000. Fees for obtaining a learner's license has been revised to ₹200.

titles: Landslides: Causes and prediction challenges
descriptions: A devastating landslide hit remote villages in Enga province, Papua New Guinea. Between 690 and 2,000 people are estimated dead, with many missing. Search and rescue efforts face difficulties due to more slides and lack of machinery. Landslides are caused by earthquakes and heavy rain, making them hard to predict and prevent.

titles: Actress Taveras speaks out after Cannes Film Festival incident
descriptions: At the Cannes Film Festival, actress Massiel Taveras clashed with a security guard while unveiling her dress's train, featuring an image of Jesus Christ. Despite the guard's attempt to stop her, Taveras succeeded and later called it 'the most powerful moment' of her life on Instagram, highlighting the viral impact of her Jesus-themed dress.

titles: Delhi court rejects Umar Khalid's bail plea in Delhi riots case
descriptions: A Delhi court rejected the bail application of former JNU student leader Umar Khalid on Tuesday. The matter is linked to the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots. He is in jail since September 2020 under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA). He requested bail on grounds of delay and sought relief on the grounds of parity with other accused in the case.

titles: IRS officer held after partner's body found hanging in his flat
descriptions: A young woman's body was discovered hanging from a noose in a luxurious Noida apartment in Sector 100 on May 26th. Saurabh Meena, an officer with the Indian Revenue Service (IRS), was taken into custody in connection with the woman's death. The deceased Shilpa Gautam worked as an HR at BHEL.

titles: I'll not sit quietly, will expose everyone: Doctor arrested in Pune Porsche case
descriptions: Dr Ajay Taware of Pune's Sassoon General Hospital, who has been arrested along with Dr Shrihari Harnol for allegedly changing the blood samples of the Pune minor boy accused in Porsche crash case, has issued a warning. "I'll not sit quietly. I've warned that I will take everyone's names," he said. Police have arrested a middleman based on Taware's statement.

titles: 6 candidates to fight against PM Modi in Varanasi, 41 had filed nominations
descriptions: Forty-one candidates initially filed nominations from Varanasi to fight against PM Narendra Modi. While one withdrew the nomination, seven applications, including PM Modi's, passed the scrutiny process. The six include Congress' Ajay Rai, BSP's Ather Jamal Lari, Yuga Thulasi Party's Kolisetty Shiva Kumar, Apna Dal (Kameravadi)'s Gagan Prakash Yadav and Independent Dinesh Kumar Yadav.

titles: International gold-medalist shooter brandishes pistol, hits taxi driver in UP
descriptions: Congress shared a video showing international gold-medallist pistol shooter Vinod Mishra brandishing a pistol and hitting a taxi driver in UP's Lucknow. The video, case of road rage following a collision in Web Mall area, showed Mishra grabbing the man's collar and hitting him in his abdomen with the pistol. "BJP government can't even keep state's capital safe," Congress said.

titles: Influencer Bobby Kataria arrested from Gurugram for human trafficking
descriptions: Social media influencer and YouTuber Balwant Kataria alias Bobby Kataria was arrested from Gurugram on Monday over charges of human trafficking. Two men from Uttar Pradesh complained that Kataria defrauded them of over ₹4 lakh in the guise of getting them employed abroad and forced them to commit cyber fraud. Kataria and others allegedly held over 150 Indian youths captive.

titles: ₹3 lakh bribe paid to doctors to change blood sample of Pune teen seized
descriptions: A peon of Sassoon General Hospital, who allegedly collected a bribe of ₹3 lakh meant for two senior doctors who replaced the Pune teen driver's blood samples with another person's samples that showed no traces of alcohol, has been arrested. The Crime Branch has seized the money. Previously, the two doctors were arrested for allegedly manipulating the blood samples.

titles: Bomb threat note found in toilet of Delhi-Varanasi IndiGo flight, passengers evacuated
descriptions: All passengers of a Delhi-Varanasi IndiGo flight were evacuated after a note with the word 'bomb' written on it was found inside the plane's toilet. Visuals shared online showed passengers getting down on the tarmac using emergency exits on flight 6E2211. The threat was discovered early on Tuesday morning and the flight is being inspected, reports said.

titles: Rahul has become burden on his mother, he's 'desh-drohi': Himanta
descriptions: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and said, "The people of the country aren't going to give a chance to Rahul." Himanta said, "Rahul cannot do anything to survive. He has become a burden on his mother." He added, "Rahul Gandhi is a 'desh-drohi' (traitor) for making remarks against the Army, which will ultimately 'demoralise' them."

titles: 6 injured after massive fire breaks out at Mumbai's Dharavi
descriptions: At least six people were injured after a massive fire broke out in Mumbai's Dharavi on Tuesday, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. Meanwhile, 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the flame. Fire is confined to wooden material and furniture, in partly ground plus upper three floored and partly ground plus four floored structure, BMC informed.

titles: Influencer Bobby Kataria arrested over 'human trafficking' charges
descriptions: Social media influencer Balwant Kataria alias Bobby Kataria was arrested on Monday for allegedly human trafficking of two Uttar Pradesh youths, police said. The case has been registered against Kataria under section 370 of the IPC at the Bajghera Police Station Gurugram. The complainants told the police that on Bobby's YouTube channel MBK, they saw an advertisement about jobs abroad.

titles: Nalgonda villagers face health hazards from local dumping yards
descriptions: Villagers in the vicinity of Telangana's Nalgonda municipality face a health risk because of the foul and nauseating smell emanating from the dumping yard as well as smoke as the waste catches fire frequently. Over 8,000 people residing in the three villages in Nalgonda Rural mandal are exposed to the pollution which is causing respiratory problems among the residents.

titles: Cyclone Remal impacts Andhra Pradesh, fish prices plummet
descriptions: Several parts of AP are reeling under severe heat wave conditions this summer. Remal caused heavy rainfall and cloudy skies. This resulted in oxygen levels falling in the freshwater fish ponds. Fish farmers are selling the produce at throwaway prices of ₹30 to ₹40 against the normal price of ₹100 to ₹120 for 1 kg.

titles: Monsoon rains pose challenge for Telangana's Kaleshwaram barrages
descriptions: The forecast of above-normal rainfall during this year’s monsoon season may be great news for the country as a whole, but for irrigation department officials in Telangana, it could bring some trepidation on how the Godavari river will behave, given that they are desperately pushing for flood protection measures at the Sundilla, Annaram and Medigadda barrages of the Kaleshwaram project.

titles: YouTuber booked for 'mocking' naked Jain monks
descriptions: A video of YouTuber Suraj Singh Parshwan has surfaced in which he can be seen mocking the Jain monks for being nude in public. The incident occurred in Uttarakhand's Chamoli. After the video of YouTuber mocking Jain monks went viral, the police filed a case against him under relevant sections of the IPC.

titles: Campus violence claims life of Patna college student
descriptions: A 22-year-old student was fatally beaten by masked assailants at Patna Law College. Identified as Harsh Raj, he succumbed to injuries at Patna Medical College and Hospital. Police are investigating, and exams at Patna University scheduled for May 28 have been canceled, with colleges closed on Tuesday.

titles: Man arrested in theft case throws slipper at magistrate in court in Rajasthan
descriptions: A man arrested in a theft case hurled his slipper at the magistrate inside a courtroom in the Bhilwara district of Rajasthan on Monday. The man was taken to the local court for hearing in the case. The accused was sent to judicial custody again and a case was being registered against him.

titles: Padma Shri awardee Hemchand to return award over Naxal threats
descriptions: Traditional medicine practitioner Hemchand Manjhi, aka 'Vaidyaraj', from Chhattisgarh has said that he'll return his Padma Shri award and will discontinue his practice due to threats from Naxalites. Naxalites claimed Manjhi helped commission an iron ore project. Denying the charges, Manjhi added, "Maoists say how I got...award from...President. I didn't demand award...I got it for my service."

titles: Drain pipe under flyover falls on vehicles in H'yana, many injured
descriptions: Several people were injured after a drain pipe under a flyover fell on vehicles in Haryana's Karnal on Monday. A video of the incident which shows a car that has been crushed by the drain pipe and a crowd of people gathered at the site has surfaced. The video also shows police personnel at the site.

titles: YouTuber harasses 'clothesless' Jain monks, faces police action
descriptions: After a video of a YouTuber harassing Jain monks for not wearing clothes went viral, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami instructed the state's police director general to investigate all the facts of the matter and take action against accused. In the purported video of the incident, the YouTuber questioned the Jain monks about how they could roam naked in Uttarakhand.

titles: Indian farmer used GPT 3.5 to understand govt subsidies: Nadella
descriptions: During a conference, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella recalled his meeting with an Indian farmer who used Open AI's GPT 3.5 to understand government farm subsidies he'd heard about on television. "It was a powerful moment for me," he said. He added that this showed the impact of a "cutting-edge model", developed in US, being used to "improve life" in India.

titles: Karnataka to cover ₹80 lakh hotel bill for PM Modi’s Mysuru stay
descriptions: Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre announced that the state government will cover the ₹80 lakh hospitality bill for Prime Minister Modi's visit to Mysuru last April. The visit, marking Project Tiger's 50th anniversary, was initially a Central government program due to the Model Code of Conduct during state elections.

titles: Woman finds fungus in pastry at popular bakery in Hyderabad
descriptions: After discovering fungus in her pastry from 5th Avenue Bakers, Preeti Biswas expressed her dismay on social media, stating, “No food joint can be trusted in Hyderabad anymore.” This incident adds to recent concerns about food safety, with raids uncovering synthetic food colors at Chicha’s Asli Hyderabadi Khana and high TDS levels in water at Paradise Food Court.

titles: Court sends 2 doctors to 3-day custody in Delhi hospital fire case
descriptions: Delhi's Karkardooma Court remanded Dr Naveen Khichi and Dr Akash to three days of police custody in connection with the fire at Baby Care New Born Hospital, which resulted in the deaths of seven infants. The police are investigating severe safety violations, including expired licenses and lack of emergency exits.

titles: No comments: Balkar after BJP claims he masturbated on video call with job seeker
descriptions: On being asked about BJP sharing a video purportedly showing him masturbating on video call with a 21-year-old female job seeker, Punjab Minister and AAP leader Balkar Singh said, "No comments and not in my knowledge." BJP claimed that the minister even forced the woman to remove her clothes. The party demanded action against him.

titles: Licenses of 6 drug distributors suspended for 30 days in Hyderabad
descriptions: The Drugs Control Administration, Telangana, suspended the licenses of six wholesalers for 30 days for illegally procuring insulin injections without purchase bills. Raids conducted in Hyderabad revealed injections sourced from New Delhi sold at over 40% discount without bills. Stocks worth ₹51.92 lakh were seized. Prosecution proceedings initiated against the wholesalers.

titles: Massive fire breaks out at Hetero Lab in Telangana's Sangareddy
descriptions: A major fire broke out at Hetero Labs Limited in Gaddapotharam, Sangareddy district, on Monday around 3 pm. No casualties were reported, but there were significant monetary damages. The fire, which started during solvent recovery in the ETP section, prompted immediate firefighting efforts by the lab and local authorities. The cause is under investigation.

titles: This should be investigated: PM Modi on Pak support for Rahul Gandhi, Kejriwal
descriptions: After being asked about Pakistani leaders giving statements in favour of Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal, PM Narendra Modi said that it was a serious matter that should be investigated. "I don't think I should comment on such topics from the position I am in," he added. Recently, Pakistani politician Chaudhry Fawad Hussain shared posts praising Kejriwal and Rahul.

titles: ₹80 lakh hotel bill of PM Modi's stay in Mysuru to be paid by Karnataka govt
descriptions: Karnataka government will pay the ₹80-lakh hospitality bill of PM Narendra Modi, who visited Mysuru in April last year. Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre said it's a tradition of the state government to host dignitaries like PM and President when they come. This comes after reports said that the hotel where the PM had stayed has threatened to take legal action.

titles: Accused Bhavesh Bhinde's police custody extended till May 29
descriptions: The court has not given any relief to Bhavesh Bhinde, the prime accused in the Ghatkopar hoarding incident. The court has extended Bhavesh Bhinde's custody till May 29. Two weeks ago, 17 people were killed when a hoarding collapsed in Mumbai's Ghatkopar. After this unfortunate incident, Mumbai Police arrested him from Udaipur, Rajasthan.

titles: Woman jumps in front of train after fight with boyfriend in UP
descriptions: On Monday, May 27, a woman in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, jumped in front of a train at Raja Ki Mandi Railway Station, arguing with her boyfriend before being struck by the Kerala Express. She was critically injured and taken to SN Medical College and Hospital. An investigation is underway to identify her.

titles: Bomb threat on Delhi-Varanasi IndiGo flight turns out to be hoax
descriptions: A bomb threat received on a Delhi-Varanasi IndiGo flight at the Indira Gandhi International Airport here on Tuesday morning turned out to be a hoax, police said. "A tissue paper, with 'bomb at 5:30' written on it, was found in the flight's lavatory following which all the staff and 176 passengers onboard were evacuated," officials said.

titles: Doctor who threw away Pune teen's blood sample was removed from post twice
descriptions: Arrested Dr Ajay Taware, who is accused of throwing away Pune teen's blood sample, was removed from the post of Medical Superintendent at Sassoon General Hospital twice. He was removed for his alleged role in the kidney transplant racket involving the Ruby Hall Clinic in 2022 and in April over a rat bite incident. The teen had crashed his Porsche.

titles: Who is influencer Bobby Kataria, arrested in human trafficking case?
descriptions: Social media influencer Balwant Kataria, aka Bobby Kataria, was arrested on Monday for allegedly trafficking two UP men under the pretext of jobs. The 38-year-old from Haryana's Gurugram was arrested in 2022 for allegedly smoking on a flight and was also booked for allegedly beating and threatening a woman. He claims to be a bodybuilder with state record for powerlifting.

titles: ‘In depression’, says Prajwal, vows to appear before SIT on 31 May
descriptions: Exactly a month after he left the country, Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna, facing multiple charges of sexually assaulting women, said on Monday, 27 May that he will appear before the SIT probing the 'false cases' against him on 31 May. He apologized to his family, saying the charges made by Congress leaders sent him into depression but trusts the judiciary.

titles: Woman mauled to death by tiger in Mysuru forest
descriptions: A 48-year-old woman is suspected to have been mauled to death by a tiger near Moorband Betta in HD Kote Taluk in Mysuru on Saturday, 25 May evening, after her mutilated body was found in the early hours of Sunday, official sources said. The tiger attacked the woman when she was rearing goats and dragged her inside the forest.

titles: IMD reports record-breaking maximum temperature of 48.8°C
descriptions: IMD reports Mungeshpur, Delhi, hit a scorching 48.8°C on May 27, setting a new record. The extreme heatwave raises concerns about health risks and underscores the urgency of addressing climate change. Residents are urged to take precautions. The data highlights the growing impact of global warming, emphasizing the need for collective action to mitigate its effects.

titles: SC denies urgent hearing for Kejriwal's bail extension plea
descriptions: The Supreme Court refused to urgently hear Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's request to extend his bail by seven days on medical grounds in the Delhi excise policy case. The bench said the Chief Justice would decide. Kejriwal needs more time for medical tests due to possible kidney issues.

titles: ₹200 crore from Centre to Kerala to tackle water-logging capital
descriptions: The Centre has offered ₹200 crore to Kerala under the Urban Mitigation Programme for Thiruvananthapuram which witnessed waterlogging during the recent pre-monsoon showers. Union Minister of State for Entrepreneurship, Skill Development, Electronics & Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar, in a post on X, urged the Left government to submit a report to the Centre by the end of this month.

titles: Karnataka will pay dues of PM's Mysuru visit last April
descriptions: Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre has said the government will bear the pending hotel bill for when PM Narendra Modi visited Mysuru in April last year to inaugurate the 'Commemoration of 50 years of Project Tiger' programme and went on a wildlife safari. The cost came to ₹6.33 crore and the stay at a hotel cost ₹80 lakh.

titles: Sony Pictures Networks India names Gaurav Banerjee as new CEO
descriptions: Sony Pictures Networks India has appointed Gaurav Banerjee as its new CEO, media networks have reported. Banerjee, who was earlier with Disney Star as Head-Content, Disney+ Hotstar & HSM Entertainment Network, will be taking over from NP Singh who announced that he was stepping down last week, reports added.

titles: What does govt data reveal about road accidents in India?
descriptions: Government data released last year reveals 4,61,312 road accidents happened in India in 2022, killing 1,68,491 people and injuring 4,43,366 persons. Out of this, 67,387 accidents were hit-and-run killing 30,486 people, the data revealed. The age group of 18-45 accounted for 66.5% of total accident deaths. Recently, a teen crashed his Porsche in Pune killing two techies.

titles: Major fire breaks out at eye hospital in Delhi's Paschim Vihar
descriptions: A major fire broke out at Eye Mantra Hospital in Delhi's Paschim Vihar on Tuesday. At least six fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the blaze. The fire broke out on the second floor of the hospital, a Delhi Fire Services official said. However, no casualties or injuries have been reported in the incident as yet.

titles: Brijesh Kumar takes charge as new Rajkot Police Commissioner after fire kills 28
descriptions: IPS officer Brijesh Kumar Jha took charge as the Rajkot Police Commissioner on Tuesday after the Gujarat government transferred Raju Bhargava after the game zone fire incident in which over 28 people were killed. The state government had also transferred Vidhi Choudhary, ACP Rajkot City and Sudhirkumar J Desai, DCP-Zone 2. Municipal commissioner Anand Patel was also transferred.

titles: Woman dies after eating biryani at restaurant, 178 others hospitalised in Thrissur
descriptions: A 56-year-old woman died and 178 others were hospitalised after eating a biryani dish at a restaurant in Kerala's Thrissur, officials said. The diners had consumed Kuzhimanthi (Yemeni-inspired dish) at the restaurant and it was sealed after the mass food poisoning incident. Mayonnaise served with the dish is suspected to have caused the food poisoning, officials added.

titles: 22-yr-old student beaten to death by masked men at Patna University
descriptions: A final year undergraduate student was beaten to death by some unidentified masked men using hockey sticks, iron, bricks and sticks on the law college campus of Patna University, police said. The incident allegedly took place when the 22-year-old student was coming out from his examination centre. Harsh Raj had intended to run in the upcoming elections for students' union.

titles: Tragic accident claims life of four-year-old girl in Bengaluru
descriptions: A heartbreaking incident occurred in the Tavarekere area off Bengaluru-Magadi Road, where a four-year-old girl lost her life and her cousin of the same age sustained severe injuries after being hit by a speeding car. The two children, accompanied by another cousin, were walking by the roadside on their way home when the tragic accident occurred.

titles: Tree falls on school bus carrying 20 students in Assam
descriptions: A large eucalyptus tree fell on a school bus carrying around 20 students early Tuesday morning, causing a serious accident near the entrance of St Ursala Higher Secondary School in Dhekiajuli. Several students were admitted to Tezpur Medical Hospital while the bus was completely damaged in the incident.

titles: Mizoram stone quarry collapse due to rain kills 10, many missing
descriptions: Ten people died, and several are missing after a stone quarry collapsed in Aizawl, Mizoram, due to heavy rains from cyclone Remal. The incident happened between Melthum and Hlimen. Rescue operations are ongoing but slowed by rain. Landslides have also cut off Aizawl from the rest of the country.

titles: Fatal collision claims three lives in Kalaburagi
descriptions: Tragedy struck in Kalaburagi as three individuals, including a minor, lost their lives in a head-on collision between a bike and a bus operated by Kalyana Karnataka Road Transport Corporation (KKSRTC) on Monday. The deceased, identified as 17-year-old Chandrakanth, 20-year-old Vishal, and 23-year-old Sameer, were all travelling on the bike. Police have registered a case.

titles: At Bengal rally, Mamata refers to Narendra Modi as 'Caretaker PM'
descriptions: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee referred to Modi as the 'caretaker PM' in a rally in the state. She said. "Modiji has every right to campaign but I am surprised to see him being referred to as the PM in his party's campaign advertisements." In her address, she claimed that BJP will not return to power for a third term.

titles: Even sarpanch can sign cheques but PM can't: PM Modi on allegation of 'using' ED & CBI
descriptions: On allegations by the Opposition of using ED and CBI to suppress them, PM Narendra Modi said they don't know that even a sarpanch can sign a cheque but the Indian PM can't. He added the PM doesn't have any such rights. "Modi government has told its officers that my government has zero tolerance towards corruption," he added.

titles: Should read Constitution: PM on Kejriwal's political arrests claim
descriptions: During an interview with ANI, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reacted to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's allegation that PM Modi decides who will go to jail. PM Modi said, "It would be better if these people read the Constitution, read the law of the country." The PM further said, "I do not need to say anything to anyone."

titles: Kangana's B'wood buzz won't work in Himachal: Vikramaditya Singh
descriptions: Kangana Ranaut's 'Bollywood buzz' won't work in Himachal Pradesh, Congress leader Vikramaditya Singh, who is contesting against the actress-politician for the Mandi Lok Sabha seat, said. He added he doesn't care about the media buzz around the BJP candidate and is focused on the issues of youth, women and infrastructure of the state.

titles: Porsche crash case: Who is Dr LN Danwade?
descriptions: A teenager who killed two people with his Porsche car was granted bail within 15 hours after the fatal crash. The bail was granted by Dr LN Danwade, one of the non-judicial members of the Juvenile Justice Board. Earlier, Danwade was working with Balagram 'SOS' Children's Village in Raigad. During his tenure, a minor girl allegedly died by suicide.

titles: Delay in extending Vande Bharat Train service to Belagavi
descriptions: For the people of Belagavi, the Vande Bharat train service has remained a distant dream. Despite a trial run up to Belagavi, regular services are yet to commence, with the South Western Railway citing various reasons for the delay. When the Vande Bharat train was announced between Bengaluru-Hubballi-Dharwad, there was a demand to extend it up to Belagavi.

titles: International Day Of Action For Women’s Health fights limitations
descriptions: The International Day of Action for Women's Health in 2024 theme is "Mobilising in Critical Times of Threats and Opportunities," focusing on empowering women to make independent decisions free from coercion and discrimination. It's essential to oppose attempts to limit women's rights, ensuring they can make free choices about their bodies, sexuality, and lives without facing coercion or violence.

titles: Ram Rahim, 4 others acquitted in 2002 Ranjit Singh murder case
descriptions: In a big relief to Dera Sacha Sauda Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, Punjab and Haryana High Court on Tuesday acquitted him and four other convicts in Ranjit murder case. In October 2021, a Special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Panchkula, Haryana, had sentenced all five accused to life imprisonment.

titles: Cyclone Remal has affected Assam, causing storms in many areas
descriptions: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma addressed Cyclone Remal's impact, expressing condolences for a student's death and injuries sustained. Urging caution, he advised residents to stay indoors due to disrupted power supply. Monitoring efforts are underway. Prompt action and cooperation are essential for safety and recovery. Government is committed to providing assistance & relief to affected communities.

titles: Accidental fire near Pune-Bengaluru national highway in Haveri
descriptions: An accidental fire occurred near the 220KV receiving station on the Pune-Bengaluru National Highway in Haveri on Tuesday. Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Ltd (KPTCL) executive engineer Kolaki confirmed that the fire did not cause any damage to the station as it broke out outside the premises.

titles: Controversy surrounds fundraising for Elephant Arjun memorial
descriptions: The construction of a memorial for the late Dasara elephant Arjun has sparked significant discussion in Hassan. Despite five months passing since Arjun's death, the Karnataka government has yet to commence the construction of the memorial. In the meantime, accusations have emerged against an individual allegedly capitalizing on this delay to collect money illegally.

titles: Ready to sacrifice relation with Naveen for Odisha's progress: PM
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi, while speaking about his relation with Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, said that when it comes to development of a state he is ready to sacrifice his relations. "After the elections, I will convince everyone that I have no enmity with anyone," he added. "In a democracy we do not have enmity," PM further said.

titles: DTC bus rams into another bus in Delhi, 2 people injured
descriptions: Two people sustained injuries after a Delhi Transport Corporation bus rammed into another stationed bus in Delhi on Tuesday morning. According to police, the accident occurred when one of the DTC buses was picking up passengers from Nauroji Nagar bus stand and another DTC bus hit it from behind. "Legal action is being taken," DCP (South West) Rohit Meena said.

titles: Dera chief Ram Rahim acquitted in murder case by HC
descriptions: Setting aside the CBI court's life imprisonment order, the Punjab and Haryana HC acquitted Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh in the Ranjit Singh murder case. Rahim and four others were acquitted by the high court. He was awarded life term by the CBI court in Panchkula in 2021 and asked to pay a fine of ₹31 lakh.

titles: Which were the hottest Indian cities on Monday?
descriptions: Rajasthan's Phalodi recorded a maximum temperature of 49.4 degrees Celsius on Monday, IMD said. Delhi's Mungeshpur was the second hottest city with a temperature of 48.8 degrees Celsius, followed by MP's Niwari (48.7°C), Punjab's Bathinda (48.4°C), UP's Jhansi (48.1°C) and Maharashtra's Nagpur (45.6°C). Gujarat's Kandla recorded 45.3°C while Himachal Pradesh's Una recorded 44°C.

titles: I've become gaali-proof: PM Modi on being called 'gandi naali ka keeda' by Oppn
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on being asked about personal attacks made on him during the election campaigns during an interview with ANI, said, "As far as Modi is concerned, after being continuously abused for the last 24 years, I have become 'gaali-proof'." "Who called me the 'maut ka saudaagar' and 'gandi naali ka keeda'?" he further said.

titles: SP MLA Rafiq Ansari arrested in 29-yr-old case after he defies 100 non-bailable warrants in UP
descriptions: Samajwadi Party's Meerut MLA Rafiq Ansari was arrested and sent to 14-day-judicial custody on Monday for not appearing before Allahabad High Court despite non-bailable warrants being issued in a 1995 case. He is accused of causing traffic jams and damaging property amid riots. Earlier, HC refused to grant him relief saying he defied 100 non-bailable warrants from 1997-2015.

titles: 5 children fall ill after consuming mushroom sambar in Karnataka
descriptions: Five children from Kittadahalli village in Shikaripura taluk fell ill after consuming mushroom sambar, an incident that came to light late on Monday. The mushrooms, locally grown, were picked and used to prepare the sambar. Following initial treatment, they were referred to Shikaripura Hospital and subsequently transferred to Megan Hospital in Shimoga for further care.

titles: SC refuses urgent hearing of Kejriwal's plea for extending bail
descriptions: Supreme Court's vacation bench on Tuesday refused to allow urgent hearing of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's plea for extension of his interim bail by seven days on medical grounds. It's appropriate if Chief Justice of India takes a call on listing of the plea, the vacation bench said. On May 10, SC granted interim bail to Kejriwal till June 1.

titles: Why is World Hunger Day observed on May 28?
descriptions: World Hunger Day is observed every year on May 28 to raise awareness about the global hunger crisis and malnutrition. The theme for this year's World Hunger Day is "Thriving Mothers. Thriving World". Notably, the global human population crossed 8 billion in 2022 and according to the United Nations, approximately 10% of the population goes to bed hungry.

titles: Prasar Bharati invites applications for MPEG-4 & MPEG-2 slots
descriptions: Prasar Bharati has invited applications for the allotment of vacant MPEG-2 and MPEG- 4 slots through the 77th and 78th online e-auctions. The allotment of the vacant slot for MPEG-2 is for the period June 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, while for the vacant slot for MPEG-4 is for the period from June 4, 2024 to March 31, 2025.

titles: Rajkot gaming zone fire accused laughs in court, says 'such things happen'
descriptions: Yuvrajsinh Solanki, a partner in Raceway Enterprise that operated the TRP game zone in Rajkot that caught fire killing at least 27 people, was laughing in court, special public prosecutor Tushar Gokani said. "This very accused seemed like he was crying...but in just a few minutes he started laughing and he said that 'these kinds of things happen'," he added.

titles: Arrests made after public threatening incident in Shivamogga
descriptions: Three individuals were apprehended in Karnataka’s Shivamogga district for allegedly threatening people on a road, with one wielding a machete in public. Sameer, one of the accused, was apprehended by local residents who subdued him, seized his weapon, and handed him over to the police. Two others, who were seen with him on a two-wheeler, were also arrested later.

titles: IMD updates southwest monsoon forecast for June-September 2024
descriptions: IMD forecasts above-normal rainfall for India's southwest monsoon season (June-September 2024), with Director General Mritunjya Mohapatra presenting the outlook. Central & South Peninsular India anticipate above-average rainfall, while Northwest India expects normal rainfall. June's forecast predicts normal to above-normal temperatures, with heatwave days likely in Northwest & Central India.

titles: Government officer in Karnataka's Shivamogga dies by suicide
descriptions: In a tragic incident, a 50-year-old government officer employed as a superintendent at the Karnataka Maharshi Valmiki Scheduled Tribe Development Corporation Ltd in Bengaluru died by suicide at his residence in Shivamogga. The deceased left a six-page note accusing senior officers of pressuring him to open a parallel bank account and divert unaccounted funds into it

titles: Srinivas Institute to develop multi-speciality hospital
descriptions: Srinivas Institute of Medical Sciences and Research Centre secured a contract to construct a 150-bed hospital on port land. The agreement, with a revenue share of 3.7%, grants the institute rights to develop and maintain the hospital for 60 years. It also includes operating and maintaining the current 32-bed hospital owned by the New Mangalore Port Authority for two years.

titles: Watch: Ex-Muslim man desecrates Quran, sparks outrage
descriptions: A viral video showing ex-Muslim Sameer, real name Siddharth Chaturvedi, desecrating the Quran has ignited widespread outrage. The video captures him placing a shoe on the Quran, tearing pages, and burning it. Both Muslim and Hindu communities are demanding his arrest. Authorities are investigating as social media users express their fury.

titles: Dakshina Kannada police launch cyber crime awareness campaign
descriptions: The Dakshina Kannada police are initiating a campaign to educate the public through short videos, aimed at raising awareness about various fraudulent practices online. SP CB Ryshyanth announced plans to release informative videos within 10 days, which will be disseminated via social media platforms to enlighten people about the deceptive techniques used by fraudsters.

titles: Fake: Dhruv Rathee on allegations by Swati Maliwal against him
descriptions: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee through his social media post, called all the allegations from AAP Rajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal, "Fake". The statement from the YouTuber came after Maliwal on Sunday alleged that she has been receiving death threats following the character assassination campaign by AAP leaders and their volunteers, alleging that the YouTuber had posted a one-sided video against her.

titles: Student beaten to death in Patna University Law campus
descriptions: A 22-year-old undergraduate student was beaten to death on Monday by seven to eight men wearing masks on the Patna Law College campus. The victim intended to run in the upcoming student union elections. The deceased has been identified by the police as 22-year-old Harsh Raj, a student at BN College, Patna University.

titles: Safety measures taken after auto-rickshaw tragedy
descriptions: Following the tragic incident where an auto-rickshaw plunged into an overflowing stormwater drain, resulting in the driver’s death, temporary precautionary measures have been swiftly implemented at the site. Sandbags, barricades, and reflector tapes have been deployed at the location to enhance safety and prevent further accidents.

titles: Stock market may fall 10-20% in a day if BJP gets less than 250 seats: Ruchir
descriptions: Investor and Rockefeller International Chairman Ruchir Sharma told India Today, "If the BJP gets less than 250 seats in the Lok Sabha elections, there will be a big knee-jerk negative reaction in the stock markets." He added, "If that black swan scenario kind of thing happens, the market will be down 10-20% in a day...in a flash."

titles: Entrepreneur shares videos of empty Pune clubs, says 'Kids not being allowed'
descriptions: Chirag Barjatya, entrepreneur and PFC Club Founder, shared videos of "empty clubs" in Pune. "The crowd that used to party the most (high school kids and college kids) are not even being allowed to enter," he wrote. "They've stopped serving alcohol in the clubs except near the bar area," he added. "How are they going to pay rent?" Barjatya asked.

titles: 10 killed, several feared trapped as stone quarry collapses in Mizoram
descriptions: At least ten people were killed while several remain trapped as a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram's Aizawl district amid heavy rain on Tuesday. A search operation has been launched to rescue the trapped people, officials said. "The search operation is being hampered by incessant rain and landslides in the area," they added.

titles: Aysha Merchant bags rank in interior design at MU
descriptions: Aysha Merchant, a student of Indian Design School, has achieved the remarkable feat of securing the 3rd rank in the Interior Design course at Mangalore University. Her accomplishment underscores her dedication, creativity, and pursuit of excellence in the field of interior design.

titles: Abhishek wore ₹8,000 t-shirt during his visit to relief camp: BJP
descriptions: BJP in West Bengal criticised TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee for allegedly wearing a ₹8,000 t-shirt during his visit to Cyclone Remal relief camps. Sharing picture comparing Abhishek's t-shirt, BJP said, "Shame on TMC for mocking the poor and aggrieved." Earlier, TMC accused BJP of being indifferent to suffering of Bengal's people and focusing on organising a drone show in Kolkata.

titles: Patna University student beaten to death with rods
descriptions: A 22-year-old, Harsh Raj, the final-year law student of BN College in Patna was beaten to death by 7-8 masked men on the college's campus. He was planning to contest the upcoming students' union elections for the post of President. He was also seen campaigning for Shambhavi Choudhary, the LJP (RV) candidate from Samastipur Lok Sabha seat.

titles: Home Guards deployed for monsoon safety at Dakshin Kannada beaches
descriptions: In a proactive measure, District Home Guard has announced the deployment of Home Guards at beaches in Dakshina Kannada (DK) from June 1, aimed at preventing casualties during the rainy season. Home Guards will be stationed at Sasihithlu, Surathkal, Someshwar, Mogaveerpatna, Ullal, Panambur, Tannirbhavi, and Fathima Beach. Two guards will be assigned to each beach, operating in two shifts

titles: Karwar market draws Goans for dried fish purchases
descriptions: Despite the Purumentachem fest in Goa witnessing low footfall at dried fish stalls, Goans are flocking to neighbouring Karwar for their dried fish needs. Traditionally, Goans procure dried fish in May to sustain through the monsoons, hence the fest’s nickname “Purumentachem fest.”

titles: Deeply saddened: PM as 2,000 die in landslide in Papua New Guinea
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday expressed his condolences after 2,000 people lost their lives in the massive landslide in Papua New Guinea. PM Modi said, "Deeply saddened by the loss of lives and damage caused by the devastating landslide in Papua New Guinea." He added that India is ready to offer all possible support and assistance to the country.

titles: India's 6 major cities experiencing worsening heat stress: Study
descriptions: A study by the Delhi-based Centre for Science and Environment has found that six cities, Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bengaluru, Kolkata and Hyderabad, are seeing worsening "heat stress" over the last two decades due to rising relative humidity and warmer nights. This is happening due to "urban heat island" effect, in which heat gets trapped due to increase in built-up area.

titles: Koraga community protests delay in land allocation
descriptions: Addressing a gathering of protesters, district convener Sridhan Nada highlighted the ongoing struggle of the Koraga community in securing land entitlements. Despite previous promises and efforts, only eight out of ten identified acres have benefited Koraga families. Nada lamented the slow progress, citing delays in surveying the allocated land in Aloor and Harkoor villages.

titles: Told Police Commissioner not to succumb to pressure: Pawar on Pune crash
descriptions: After a social activist claimed that Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar called Pune Police Commissioner after Porsche crash incident, Pawar said he called him but not to impose political pressure. "I told him the accused boy was from wealthy family and there was a chance police might be pressured. I told him not to succumb to any pressure," Pawar added.

titles: S. Jaishankar pays tribute to Veer Savarkar on his jayanti
descriptions: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar commemorated Veer Savarkar's birth anniversary, lauding his courage, patriotism, and dedication to Bharat on Tuesday. "His legacy of courage, patriotism and dedication to Bharat will keep inspiring us all." he wrote on X. Veer Savarkar, born on May 28, 1883, was a politician and activist.

titles: Case of pantograph flashing: DMRC on video of fire on metro's roof
descriptions: DMRC reacted to a video showing a minor fire emanating from a metro train's roof at Rajiv Chowk station, saying, "It's a case of pantograph flashing." It's when an external material is stuck between train's over-head equipment and its pantograph. "The affected pantograph was immediately put out of service," DMRC said, adding that the train resumed service after five minutes.

titles: Indian cities no longer cooling down at night, finds CSE study
descriptions: A new study by Delhi-based think tank Centre for Science and Environment has revealed a dangerous trend in India's biggest cities that heat waves are becoming deadlier due to a combination of rising temperatures, increasing humidity and urban expansion. The research has also uncovered a phenomenon that cities are not cooling down at night as much as during 2001-2010.

titles: ₹3 lakh paid to change blood sample of teen in Pune Porsche case
descriptions: Peon Atul Ghatkamble and two doctors were implicated in the Pune Porsche crash case for allegedly manipulating blood test. Ghatkamble facilitated ₹3 lakh bribe from suspect's family to Drs. Tawade and Harnor. Investigation reveals sample swapping to remove alcohol traces. Tragic collision kills two IT professionals. Forensic report contradicts CCTV evidence. Commissioner discloses discrepancies.

titles: Case filed against bank manager for cheating builder of ₹86 lakh
descriptions: A builder was reportedly cheated of ₹86 lakh, resulting in disruption to his layout business and alleged death threats against him. A police case has been lodged at Ullal police station against a bank manager, broker, civil contractor, and an accomplice under various sections, including Sections 341, 447, 323, 504, 506, 420, and 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

titles: 16 killed in India, Bangladesh due to Cyclone Remal
descriptions: Cyclone Remal, the first major cyclonic storm of the year, has killed 16 people across Bangladesh and India after it made landfall near the coast of the Bay of Bengal, Reuters reported. Dozens of people sustained injuries due to downpour in coastal areas of Bangladesh and West Bengal. Nearly three million people were left without electricity due to Cyclone Remal.

titles: Doctors held for altering blood report of Pune Porsche crash teen
descriptions: In the Pune Porsche crash case, a peon and two doctors were arrested for allegedly manipulating the blood test report of the 17-year-old accused. According to a report in NDTV citing sources, the peon, Atul Ghatkamble, reportedly acted as a middleman and collected a Rs 3 lakh bribe from the teen's family intended for the two doctors.

titles: Mild earthquake strikes Pithoragarh, Uttarakhand: NCS reports
descriptions: Mild tremors rattled Pithoragarh, Uttarakhand, as the National Center for Seismology reported a magnitude 3.1 earthquake. Striking at 6:43 am on May 28, the quake's epicenter was at a depth of 5 km. Fortunately, there have been no significant damages or casualties reported, underscoring the region's resilience to seismic activity.

titles: Took pics of women from Insta to target rich Indians: Cambodia job scam victim
descriptions: A Cambodia job scam victim who returned to India, said, "We had to download pictures of women from Instagram and other social media accounts." The victim added, "We used the pictures of women...and sent friend requests to Indians who looked rich." Once the targeted people accepted requests, they were called to Telegram and accounts were handed over to Chinese people.

titles: Safety inspection at gaming zones ordered in Bengaluru
descriptions: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has directed authorities to assess precautionary measures at gaming zones in Bengaluru and check adherence to prescribed safety norms, in the wake of a fire tragedy at a facility in Gujarat. Shivakumar, also in-charge of Bengaluru Development, has sent a note to Chief Commissioner of the city civic body) in this regard.

titles: Won't attend I.N.D.I.A bloc meet, I'm busy in relief work: Mamata
descriptions: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she will not attend the meeting of I.N.D.I.A bloc on June 1. She said she won't be attending the meet as there is relief work going on in state due to cyclone 'Remal'. Giving another reason, Mamata said she won't attend the meet because of last phase voting scheduled on June 1.

titles: Charred bodies of 16 victims found in corner in Rajkot gaming zone
descriptions: Charred bodies of 16 people, who died in the fire incident in Gujarat's Rajkot, were found in a corner of the gaming zone next to a burnt steel structure, according to officials. The blaze that broke out on Saturday has claimed 28 lives. The identities of at least five charred bodies have reportedly been confirmed through DNA sampling on Monday.

titles: Criminals pretending to be victims: Dhruv as Maliwal alleges threats after his video
descriptions: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee put out a cryptic post on X after Swati Maliwal alleged she received death and rape threats after he released a video against her. "Irony is that perpetrators are pretending to be victims. Everyone knows who is behind all this. They want to silence me," said Rathee. He said he was used to getting "daily death threats".

titles: Mumbai's Taj hotel, airport get bomb threat; police say 'Nothing found'
descriptions: The Mumbai Police has said that its control room received a call about bombs having been placed at The Taj Mahal Palace hotel and the airport in the city on Monday. However, the police added that they conducted a search at the locations but nothing suspicious was found. "The call originated from Uttar Pradesh," the police further said.

titles: 'General Hospital' fame Johnny Wactor shot dead by thieves
descriptions: Film 'General Hospital' fame actor Johnny Wactor has been murdered. It has been reported that 37-year-old actor was shot dead by thieves in Los Angeles (USA). He was taken to the hospital after being shot, but doctors declared him dead. No one has been arrested in this case yet.

titles: Arrested doctor in Porsche crash case says 'will expose everyone'
descriptions: Dr Ajay Taware of Pune's Sassoon Hospital, who has been arrested along with Dr Shrihari Haalnor for allegedly changing the blood samples of the minor boy in Pune Porsche crash case has issued a warning and said that he will expose everyone and "not sit quietly". A court on Monday remanded the two doctors in police custody till May 30.

titles: Rajkot City Police Commissioner transferred after gaming zone fire
descriptions: Gujarat government has issued a notification announcing the transfer of Rajkot City Police Commissioner Raju Bhargava, Additional Police Commissioner Vidhi Choudhary and DCP (Zone-2) Sudhirkumar J Desai with immediate effect. This comes after around 27 people, including children, were killed when a fire broke out at a gaming zone. IPS officer Brijesh Kumar Jha will be replacing Bhargava.

titles: Thane municipal schools score 83.84 percent in Maha SSC results
descriptions: In the SSC examination conducted in March-2024, the result of 22 secondary schools of Thane Municipal Corporation is 83.84 percent. Last year it was 70.57 percent. So, this year, the result of three secondary schools of the municipal corporation has been 100 percent. Last year one school got a 100 percent result. Municipal Commissioner Saurabh Rao congratulated all the students.

titles: Couple thrashed in public after family catches girl on date in MP
descriptions: A young couple was brutally thrashed by the girl's family in public in Deogarh village in Gwalior. The family caught the girl, who went out on a date with her boyfriend, tied them with a rope, and beat them mercilessly. Gwalior Range IG Arvind Saxena said that the entire incident will be reviewed and action will be taken accordingly.

titles: Delhi court denies bail for Kejriwal aide in Maliwal assault case
descriptions: A Delhi court denied bail to Bibhav Kumar, an aide of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, who is accused of assaulting AAP MP Swati Maliwal. Magistrate Gaurav Goyal rejected the bail, as Maliwal claimed she was receiving threats. Videos from the CM's residence show Maliwal arguing with security. A detailed order is awaited.

titles: India's rain-fed agricultural areas to get above-normal rain: IMD
descriptions: India's main monsoon areas will get more rain than usual this season, says the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Northeast India will get less rain, while central and southern regions will get more. IMD expects the monsoon to start in Kerala soon, and La Nina will bring plenty of rain by August-September.

titles: Man with no money for last rites leaves dead live-in partner on road in MP
descriptions: A 53-year-old kept his 57-year-old live-in partner's body at his home for three days and later stuffed it in a sack and abandoned it on the road as he did not have money for her last rites in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. "A post-mortem showed that she was suffering from liver-related problems and other diseases for a long time," police said.

titles: 'Manthan' to re-release after its success at Cannes
descriptions: After its success at Cannes 2024, the Film Heritage Foundation announced ticket bookings for Shyam Benegal's 'Manthan'. The restored 1976 film, funded by 5 lakh farmers, will be shown in 38 Indian cities on June 1 and 2. The restoration was carried out using the 35mm original camera negative preserved at the NFDC-National Film Archive of India.

titles: Telangana BJP leaders to campaign in Varanasi in support of Modi
descriptions: Senior BJP leaders from Telangana will take part in election campaign in Varanasi Parliament constituency where Prime Minister Narendra Modi is contesting for third consecutive time. The polling in Varanasi will be conducted in the last phase of Lok Sabha elections-2024 on June 1.

titles: Man walks 70 kms on knees for brother-in-law’s wellbeing in T'gana
descriptions: A 22-year-old person walked on his knees for over 70 kms and reached the popular Sri Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple at Inavolu in Warangal district to offer special prayers for the wellbeing of his brother-in-law Rajanikanth. Nagaraju walked 70 kms from his residence at Ambala village to the temple.

titles: Cyclone Remal kills 16, cuts power to millions in India, B'desh
descriptions: Cyclone Remal hit India and Bangladesh, killing 16 people and cutting power to millions. With winds up to 135 kmph, it caused deaths, destroyed homes, and knocked down power poles. Nearly a million people were moved to shelters. As the storm weakened, both countries worked to assess and fix the damage.

titles: How did police catch blood sample foul play by Pune teen's father?
descriptions: The blood samples of the 17-year-old boy involved in the Porsche car crash were thrown in dustbin and replaced with someone else's at Sassoon Hospital after his father bribed a doctor. The report showed no traces of alcohol. However, police had taken one more sample of the boy for DNA sampling and sent it to another hospital, which revealed manipulation.

titles: Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar's bail application dismissed in Swati Maliwal assault case
descriptions: Delhi's Tis Hazari court has dismissed the bail application of CM Arvind Kejriwal's close aide Bibhav Kumar in connection with AAP MP Swati Maliwal assault case. Maliwal, who accused Bibhav of beating her up at Kejriwal's residence, told the court that her life and her family's life would be in danger if he is granted bail.

titles: Int'l shooter arrested after Lucknow road rage video surfaces
descriptions: In a shocking incident, a man with a pistol in his hand was seen hitting a person on the road in broad daylight in UP's Lucknow. After the video went viral, police arrested Vinod Mishra, an international shooter. Vinod, who was in his SUV, lost his cool over a minor incident and started hitting the man with his pistol butt.

titles: 'Punjab Minister Balkar masturbated on video call with job seeker,' says BJP; shares proof
descriptions: BJP has accused Punjab Minister and AAP leader Balkar Singh of masturbating in front of a 21-year-old woman job seeker on a video call. Sharing a footage that purportedly shows the minister, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that Balkar also forced the woman to remove her clothes. This comes days before voting in Punjab for the Lok Sabha elections.

titles: What is heat multiplier effect?
descriptions: The heat multiplier effect is caused by land and surface concretisation in areas like Delhi-NCR, explained Akash Vashishtha, the founder-secretary of the Society for Protection of Environment and Biodiversity. He added that heat is trapped in the lower atmosphere due to extensive concretisation creating 'urban heat islands'. Further, he said vegetation on the ground can mitigate this.

titles: Parts of India likely to get relief from heatwave after 3 days: IMD
descriptions: The weather department has predicted relief from heatwave in northwest and central parts of the country. Several states, including Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, west Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat, are witnessing heatwave. The maximum temperature in Rajasthan's Phalodi reached 49.8°C on Sunday. IMD said conditions are favourable for onset of monsoon over Kerala in next 5 days.

titles: Death toll rises to 6 in WB amid destruction due to Cyclone Remal
descriptions: At least six people in West Bengal have been reported dead due to destruction caused by Cyclone Remal which made landfall in the state on Sunday night. Out of six, four people died due to electrocution, a man was crushed to death by falling concrete in Kolkata and another woman died in Sundarbans delta after a mud house collapsed.

titles: Was on trip abroad, saw allegations against me on YouTube: Prajwal
descriptions: Ex-PM Deve Gowda's grandson Prajwal Revanna, who's accused of sexually assaulting multiple women, has claimed that he was on a pre-planned foreign trip and saw the allegations against him on YouTube. The suspended JD(S) leader will appear before the SIT on May 31. He also apologised to his family and party workers for not providing "proper" information about his whereabouts.

titles: 'Hamare Baarah' makers & actors getting death threats, won't stay quiet: Annu Kapoor
descriptions: 'Hamare Baarah' actor Annu Kapoor said he and other actors and makers of the film are constantly getting death threats. He said the threats were received after film's teaser was released, adding, "If you try to disturb the peace, we won't stay quiet either." The film's makers had filed a police complaint in Mumbai on May 24 over the threats.

titles: IMD warns of heatwave conditions across multiple regions
descriptions: The IMD forecasts heatwave conditions on May 30, 2024, in parts of West Rajasthan, West Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana-Chandigarh-Delhi, East Uttar Pradesh, East Rajasthan, West Madhya Pradesh, and Chhattisgarh. Residents are advised to stay hydrated, avoid sun exposure, and follow local advisories to stay safe during the extreme heat.

titles: Another arrested for blood sample tampering in Porsche crash case
descriptions: Pune Police arrested Atul Ghatkamble, a Sassoon Hospital worker, for changing a minor's blood sample in a luxury car accident that killed two motorcyclists. Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said doctors switched the sample, causing several arrests and charges. The investigation is still ongoing.

titles: Prajwal Revanna announces return to India
descriptions: Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna, accused of sexually abusing women, announced his intention to return to India and appear before Special Investigation Team (SIT) on May 31, according to reports. In a video released, Prajwal expressed his desire to return home and refuted all allegations against him, asserting they were false. He also conveyed his apology to his family.

titles: Claim that New Delhi railway station will be closed is fake
descriptions: A viral post is circulating on social media claiming that under the redevelopment plan the New Delhi railway station will be completely closed and all the trains running from the station will be shifted to nearby stations, PIB Fact Check said. "This claim is fake," it said. "The Ministry of Railways has not taken any such decision," it added.

titles: Teacher seen marking answer sheets without reading for Reels, FIR filed in Bihar
