descriptions: Reels of a teacher in Bihar marking answer sheets without reading them carefully have gone viral on social media, leading to registration of an FIR against her. Several other teachers could be seen marking answer sheets around her. Several people reacted to the videos, with a person saying, "She doesn't care whether what is written is right or wrong."

titles: Rape accused Prajwal Revanna, who fled India, to join probe on May 31
descriptions: Prajwal Revanna, the rape-accused suspended JD(S) MP from Karnataka and former PM HD Deve Gowda's grandson, has said he will appear before the Special Investigation Team on May 31. "I was depressed and went into isolation," said Prajwal who had fled the country on April 27. There are allegations of mass sexual harassment against him.

titles: Doordarshan Kisan introduces AI anchors 'Krish' and 'Bhoomi'
descriptions: Doordarshan Kisan, the government channel dedicated to agricultural content, has unveiled its new look and introduced two new AI anchors, aptly named 'Krish' and 'Bhoomi'. The bots can reportedly speak in around 50 different languages and provide necessary information about agricultural research, weather and grain market news to farmers nationwide.

titles: Woman who accused ex-K'taka CM Yediyurappa of sexually abusing daughter dies
descriptions: A woman who accused former Karnataka CM and BJP leader BS Yediyurappa of sexually harassing her minor daughter died at a private hospital in Bengaluru on Sunday. Police said the woman was suffering from cancer and was hospitalised after complaining of breathing issues. She had alleged Yediyurappa sexually abused her daughter when they sought his help in a rape case.

titles: I didn't party with gangster Abu Salem, man in pic with me a journalist: Kangana
descriptions: Actress and BJP's Mandi candidate Kangana Ranaut on Monday refuted the claim that she once partied with gangster Abu Salem after her picture with a man surfaced on social media. Kangana took to her Instagram stories to clarify that the man seen in the picture was journalist Mark Manuel. "The picture is from a film promotion event party," she added.

titles: 'Want to give dignified funeral': Daughter of Bangladesh MP killed
descriptions: Awami League MP Anwarul Azim Anar was allegedly murdered in a Kolkata flat on May 13, with his body still missing. Anar traveled for medical treatment, but his daughter, Mumtarin Ferdoush Dorin, couldn't accompany him due to visa issues. She urges authorities to find his body. Arrests occurred in both countries, but alleged mastermind Akhtaruzzaman fled to the US.

titles: Stage breaks as Rahul, Misa & Tejashwi arrive at rally in Bihar
descriptions: A video showing a stage nearly collapsing as Congress' Rahul Gandhi, RJD's Tejashwi Yadav and other leaders arrive at an election rally in Bihar's Paliganj has surfaced online. In the video, Rahul is seen holding RJD MP Misa Bharti's hand as the stage breaks with Tejashwi behind them. The seventh phase of Lok Sabha elections will occur on June 1.

titles: IMD issues red alert for Northeast India; heavy rainfall expected
descriptions: The IMD has issued a red alert for Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura, predicting very heavy rainfall over 204.4 mm on May 27 and heavy to very heavy rainfall of 115.5-204.4 mm on May 28. Residents are advised to stay informed and take necessary precautions for safety. The anticipated heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding, waterlogging, and potential disruptions.

titles: Seven held for beating man, damaging police vehicle in Karimnagar
descriptions: Police in Telangana’s Karimnagar arrested seven people on Sunday, May 26, over the violence during a Hanuman Yatra in Karimnagar town on Saturday night. The cops said the group saw a man dancing with a knife and beat him up because they thought he was dangerous. Cops were rescuing the victim when the group objected and damaged a police vehicle.

titles: Congress accuses ministers of lies in Kerala liquor policy
descriptions: Congress on Sunday, May 26, continued its attack against the Left government in Kerala over its liquor policy. The party accused Excise Minister MB Rajesh and Tourism Minister PA Mohammed Riyas of "lying" to the public by claiming that no discussion had taken place regarding the scrapping of the "dry day" norm.

titles: Will appear before police on May 31: Prajwal Revanna
descriptions: MP Prajwal Revanna, absconding after sex tapes leaked and sexual harassment allegations were levelled against him, announced he will be present before the SIT on May 31. "Don't mistake me, on the 31st at 10 am, I will be in front of the SIT and I will cooperate. I trust the law," he said.

titles: Several states put on alert due to heatwave; list released
descriptions: The India Meteorological Department has issued yellow, orange and red alerts in several states/UTs, warning them of heatwave to severe heatwave conditions. The conditions are likely in parts of Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh on Monday and Tuesday.

titles: PM will say he was sent by God when ED will ask him about Adani after June 4: Rahul
descriptions: Congress' Rahul Gandhi said when ED will ask PM Narendra Modi about Adani after elections, he'll say he doesn't know anything and he was sent by 'parmatma'. "PM says that he doesn't take decisions, but they're taken by 'parmatma'. He says he isn't biological but a messenger of 'parmatma'," Rahul said. The election results will be announced on June 4.

titles: Video shows bullet train's undersea tunnel nearing completion
descriptions: Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a video of the undersea Additionally Driven Intermediate Tunnel (ADIT) located at Maharashtra's Ghansoli for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project as it nears completion. Sharing video of the 21 kilometres long tunnel, including 7 kilometres under sea, Vaishnaw wrote, "Big milestone achieved for undersea tunnel in Bullet train project."

titles: Rahul Gandhi holidays abroad, PM spends Diwali with jawans: Shah
descriptions: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday, May 26, said the ongoing Lok Sabha polls were a choice between Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who celebrated Diwali among Armymen, and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who “rushes abroad for vacations whenever the weather becomes uncomfortable”. He also said that unlike Gandhi, Modi worked hard to reach the top.

titles: What's the FTII case against Cannes winner Payal Kapadia?
descriptions: FTII had lodged a case against Payal Kapadia, first Indian to win Cannes' Grand Prix, after she protested against actor-politician Gajendra Chauhan's appointment as its chairman in 2015. During the protest, she and others allegedly confined the then-FTII Director in his office. A student, who was also booked, said the case is still ongoing but the prosecution never showed up.

titles: Heatwave continue in Rajasthan; No immediate relief
descriptions: Rajasthan is facing a strong heatwave with no relief soon. High temperatures and warm nights will continue for the next 2-3 days, with winds of 25-35 kmph expected. Phalodi has hit 50°C, and Jaisalmer and Barmer have seen a 7°C rise in night temperatures. No major temperature change is expected until May 29, says IMD.

titles: Woman murdered, body dragged for 300 metre in K'taka's Ramanagara
descriptions: A tragic incident unfolded in Ramanagara district as a 27-year-old woman, C Ashwini, was brutally murdered by her husband, K Ramesh. Allegedly enraged by her refusal to hand over her earnings, Ramesh committed the heinous act, tying her legs with a rope and dragging her body for almost 300 meters.

titles: President inaugurates Spiritual Empowerment for a healthy society
descriptions: President Droupadi Murmu launched the 'Spiritual Empowerment for a Clean and Healthy Society' initiative by Brahma Kumaris in New Delhi. She emphasized the importance of spiritual values for holistic well-being and societal harmony. Murmu praised the Brahma Kumaris for their global efforts in promoting spiritual values and empowering women.

titles: Karnataka woman suspected to have been mauled to death by Tiger
descriptions: A 48-year-old woman, identified as Chikki from Malada Haadi in N Begur panchayat limits, is suspected to have been mauled to death by a tiger near Moorband Betta in HD Kote Taluk. Her mutilated body was discovered in the early hours of Sunday, prompting an investigation by police and forest officials.

titles: Woman's body found in flat of IRS officer boyfriend in Noida, family alleges murder
descriptions: An IRS officer, Saurabh Meena, was arrested after the body of a woman, Shilpa Gautam, was found in his Noida flat on Saturday. Her father accused Meena of murder in his complaint. Gautam was a BHEL employee and had been dating him for three years, her father claimed. However, Meena said they met three months ago through a dating app.

titles: Hyderabad doctors save tribal teen after 4 hours of surgery
descriptions: Doctors at the Nizam’s Institute of Medical Sciences in Hyderabad performed life-saving surgery on Saturday, May 25, on a 17-year-old boy from the Gutti Koya tribe of the Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh. The operation, lasting four hours, involved delicate procedures to remove an arrow lodged dangerously between Nandu’s heart and lungs, said the doctors.

titles: I got rape & death threats after a YouTuber made video against me: Maliwal in court
descriptions: Swati Maliwal, during bail plea hearing of Bibhav Kumar on Monday, said she was called a "BJP agent" by AAP leaders. "A very big YouTuber...made a one-sided video. After that, I received rape and death threats," she said. Maliwal earlier shared screenshots of the alleged threats, saying they were exacerbated by Dhruv Rathee's video on her assault case.

titles: Goa bans swimming in waterfalls, rivers over drowning incidents
descriptions: Goa has banned swimming in waterfalls, rivers, lakes, abandoned quarries and other water bodies ahead of the monsoon season. As per the orders issued by Collectors of North and South Goa districts, many incidents of drowning have been reported and swimming in these water bodies poses a risk. Those who violate the order will face action under IPC's Section 188.

titles: Karnataka govt working to shelter militants: Pralhad Joshi
descriptions: BJP MP Pralhad Joshi on Sunday, May 26, accused the Karnataka Congress government of working towards providing “shelter to militants” in Hubballi. He also blamed the Siddaramaiah-led government for Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna, accused in multiple sexual assault cases, fleeing the country. His allegation comes days after the NIA arrested one more accused in the Rameshwaram Cafe blast case.

titles: 37 cities recorded temperatures more than 45°C on Sunday
descriptions: As many as 37 places in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Madhya Pradesh recorded maximum temperatures of 45 degrees Celsius or above on Sunday. Phalodi in Rajasthan was the hottest city in India on Sunday with a maximum temperature of 49.8°C, followed by Barmer (49°C). Himachal Pradesh's Shimla saw the hottest day of the season at 30.6°C.

titles: India achieves record wins at Para Athletics Championships 2024
descriptions: Simran Sharma secured gold in Women’s 200m T12, clocking her personal best of 24.95 seconds. In Women’s Club Throw F51, Ekta Bhyana won a gold medal with the season's best throw of 20.12m. The other gold winners are Mariyappan Thangavelu (Men’s High Jump T63), Sumit Antil (Men’s Javelin Throw F64), and Sachin Khilari (Men’s Shot Put F46).

titles: BJP's Bagga shares shocking footage of AAP minister Balkar Singh
descriptions: On Monday, BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga levelled shocking allegations against Punjab AAP Minister Balkar Singh, accusing him of indulging in a sexual activity with a woman job seeker on a video call. The shocking accusations come mere five days before Punjab goes for voting in Lok Sabha Elections 2024.

titles: Delhi couple give birth after 6 years, loses son in hospital fire
descriptions: After six long years of yearning, a couple from East Delhi welcomed a son into their home. The baby faced breathing difficulties from birth and was admitted him to Baby Care Center. A UP Police constable Pawan and his wife Bharti welcomed their daughter six days ago. The stories of other couples who lost their infants are distressing.

titles: Karnataka’s free bus ride scheme empowers women: Study
descriptions: A recent study reveals the profound social and economic impact of Karnataka’s free bus ride scheme, introduced by the Congress government in mid-2023. The study, based on a sample survey of 786 women across various districts, highlights how women are leveraging the scheme to enhance family connections and enjoy leisure outings that were once considered luxuries.

titles: 26 Delhi hospitals to reserve 2 beds each for heatstroke victims
descriptions: Delhi Health Minister Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday announced that 26 government hospitals in the national capital will have two beds each reserved for heatstroke victims. He further said that five beds will be reserved at LNJP hospital. Bharadwaj's announcement comes after IMD issued red alert for Delhi on Sunday till Wednesday.

titles: Monitor lizard spotted on 2nd floor of UP apartment building; resident heard screaming
descriptions: A monitor lizard was spotted on second floor of an apartment building in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, sparking panic among the residents. A video of the incident has also surfaced online, showing a female resident screaming and running away from the spot. Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Sitanshu Pandey, along with his team, arrived at the scene to capture the monitor lizard.

titles: Your rival isn't your enemy: SC on rejecting BJP plea against halt on anti-TMC ads
descriptions: Supreme Court on Monday rejected West Bengal BJP's plea against a Calcutta High Court order restricting publication of its ads targeting TMC in the state. The apex court called the ads "disparaging". It added, "We don't want to...promote further acrimony...This is not in the interests of the voter. Your rival is not your enemy."

titles: Bengaluru CBSE schools discuss migrants’ struggle with Kannada
descriptions: Principals from several CBSE schools in Bengaluru raised concerns about the challenges faced by migrant students in learning Kannada. At the Guru Samman Awards 2024 event, they highlighted the difficulties encountered by students, especially those from non-Kannada speaking backgrounds, in acquiring proficiency in the local language.

titles: Modi government made budget more transparent, says Sitharaman
descriptions: The last decade has witnessed a substantial improvement in the sanctity and credibility of the Union Budget, leaving past constraints and archaic practices behind, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Monday. Various historic decisions and reforms have been taken by the Union government to strengthen and bring transparency to the budgetary process and practices, Sitharaman posted on X.

titles: 'Serial killer' who stoned victims to death caught in Bengaluru
descriptions: Bengaluru Police said it has caught a 26-year-old man who stoned two people to death within seven days. Police said they have prevented 'potential serial killings' by the accused, who was identified as Vasanthapura resident Girish M. He had previously faced sexual harassment and robbery cases. He was caught after CCTV videos from location of the killings were analysed.

titles: Maliwal breaks down in court during Bibhav's bail hearing in assault case
descriptions: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal broke down in court on Monday during the bail hearing of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar, who is accused of beating her earlier this month. Kumar's counsel N Hariharan told the court how could such an incident occur at the CM's residence. He also said that Maliwal's injuries could be self-inflicted.

titles: Indian filmmakers shine at Cannes; Mahindra celebrates triumphs
descriptions: Indian cinema celebrates triumphs at Cannes 2024 as Anand Mahindra applauds Payal Kapadia's 'All We Imagine As Ligh' Grand Prix win & Anasuya Sengupta's Best Actress award for 'Shameless.' These accolades mark a significant milestone, showcasing the rising global recognition of Indian talent in filmmaking.

titles: Najafgarh Road congested following car fire incident
descriptions: Delhi commuters anticipate delays on Najafgarh Road, Uttam Nagar to Dwarka Mor, due to a car fire near Metro Pillar No. 657. Exercise patience and consider alternative routes. Stay updated with real-time traffic updates for smoother travel. Cooperation and safety are paramount during disruptions. Plan your journey accordingly to minimize inconvenience.

titles: B'luru Traffic Department proposes new system for management
descriptions: In a bid to revolutionize traffic management in Bengaluru, the city’s traffic department has put forth a groundbreaking proposal to implement a software-based system known as ‘Traffic Micro Simulation Modelling.’ If approved, Bengaluru police will become the first in the country to adopt this advanced technology, aimed at enhancing decision-making and alleviating congestion on the city’s roads.

titles: Pune teen seen driving Porsche day before he ran over techies
descriptions: The 17-year-old Pune boy who killed two techies with his Porsche was seen driving the car a day before the crash. He can be seen exiting his Porsche car from the driver's side along with a friend. The video has surfaced on social media amid claims by his family that he wasn't driving at the time of the accident.

titles: If he comes out of jail my life would be in danger: Swati on Bibhav Kumar's bail request
descriptions: During the hearing of Arvind Kejriwal's close aide Bibhav Kumar's bail plea, AAP MP Swati Maliwal said, "If he comes out, my life and my family's life would be in grave danger." Maliwal, who accused Bibhav of assaulting her at the Delhi CM's residence, claimed he's not an ordinary person and gets facilities even ministers don't get.

titles: I won't resign from AAP, it doesn't belong to 2-3 people: Maliwal
descriptions: AAP MP Swati Maliwal, who was allegedly assaulted by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar, has said that she will stay in the party because "it does not belong to two or three people". "I've given [AAP] my sweat and blood too," she added. However, she said there's no possibility of a reconciliation between her and the party leadership.

titles: SC refuses to stay HC order restraining BJP's 'slanderous' TMC ads
descriptions: The Supreme Court has refused to stay Calcutta High Court's order restraining BJP from publishing "derogatory, slanderous and disparaging" advertisements targeting TMC. "We cannot promote further acrimony. Of course, you can promote yourself," the SC said, adding that the ads will only help the BJP, not the voter. "You're magnifying the issue here. We're not inclined to interfere," it said.

titles: IMD issues heat wave alert for Northwest India
descriptions: The IMD warns of severe heat wave conditions in Northwest India and West Madhya Pradesh, and is expected to persist for three days. Relief is anticipated as conditions improve afterward. Additionally, the monsoon is likely to onset over Kerala within the next five days, bringing much-needed respite and marking a seasonal transition.

titles: What happens to assets that ED seizes during raids?
descriptions: Enforcement Directorate often seizes multiple moveable and immovable assets during raids across the country. Following the seizure, a list of all assets is added to a panchnama, which is signed by the person whose premises has been raided. While seized cash is counted and deposited into ED's personal deposit account, assets like vehicles are sent to Central Warehousing Corporation's warehouses.

titles: Rajkot game zone fire: 6 officials suspended for gross negligence
descriptions: The Gujarat government has suspended 6 officials over the Rajkot game zone fire that claimed 27 lives. They include Rajkot Municipal Corporation's town planning department assistant engineer Jaideep Chaudhary, assistant town planner for RMC Gautam Joshi, Rajkot Roads and Buildings department's deputy executive engineers MR Suma and Paras Kothiya, and police inspectors VR Patel and NI Rathod.

titles: Adani Ports shares surge 3% to 52-week high
descriptions: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) shares surged nearly 3% to a 52-week high as it will replace Wipro in the BSE Sensex from June 24. APSEZ rose to ₹1,457.25, while Wipro fell 2.36% to ₹452.55. This marks the first Adani Group firm in the Sensex. Changes, effective June 24, were announced by Asia Index.

titles: Monitor Lizard found in Lucknow apartment sparks panic
descriptions: Lucknow residents were surprised by a monitor lizard in a Yash Heights Tower apartment. The reptile alarmed residents, who quickly shared videos on social media. Chinhat police and forest department officials responded swiftly. Measures are underway to ensure resident safety and handle the situation effectively.

titles: Modernisation of railway stations in India accelerated: Reddy
descriptions: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy announces accelerated modernisation of railway stations in India. Under the Amrit Bharat Station scheme, ₹22.57 crores were allocated for top-notch facilities. The mission-mode approach emphasizes efficiency and passenger comfort. The initiative underscores the government's commitment to upgrading public infrastructure and promoting sustainable development.

titles: Mumbaikars to face 5% water cut from May 30, 10% from June 5
descriptions: Mumbaikars will have to start using water judiciously as reservoirs supplying water to the city have only 10% of usable water stock. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has announced that they would be imposing a 5% water cut in the city from May 30, and a 10% water cut from June 5, as a precautionary measure.

titles: Schools in Telangana gear up to reopen
descriptions: Telangana schools will reopen on June 12 for the 2024-2025 academic year with revised timings: primary schools from 9 am to 4:15 pm and high schools from 9:30 am to 4:45 pm. The calendar includes 229 working days, ending on April 23, 2025, with SSC exams in March 2025. Holiday schedules are also set.

titles: Kejriwal moves SC seeking 7-day extension of interim bail
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has moved Supreme Court ahead of his scheduled return to jail on June 2 seeking an extension of his interim bail by seven more days on the grounds that he has to undergo some medical tests, including a PET-CT scan. The top court had on May 10 granted him 21-day bail for Lok Sabha poll campaign.

titles: Have you gone blind, were you sleeping?: HC to Gujarat govt on Rajkot fire
descriptions: Taking suo motu cognisance of the Rajkot gaming zone fire that killed over two dozen people, the Gujarat High Court said it doesn't trust the local system and the state government. When the court was informed that fire safety certification hearings have been unresolved for four years, it said, "Have you gone blind? Did you fall asleep?"

titles: Pune Porsche crash: Doctors held for teen’s blood sample 'switch'
descriptions: Pune Police have arrested two doctors of the Sassoon General Hospital in Pune for alleged manipulation of blood samples and destruction of evidence in the case of a car accident involving a 17-year-old boy. The arrested persons have been identified as Dr Ajay Taware, head of the forensics department, and Shrihari Harnor, chief medical officer at Sassoon Hospital, police said.

titles: Municipal staff mishandle rowdy bull, drag by rope in MP
descriptions: A video showing municipal officials mishandling a bull, has gone viral on social media. The video from a locality in Sagar city, captures the officials tying a rope around the bull's neck and pulling it forcefully. The animal, unable to withstand the harsh treatment, causing him to fall unconscious on the ground.

titles: Massive transformation planned for Kempegowda Airport
descriptions: Bengaluru Airport City Limited (BACL), a subsidiary of Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL), is spearheading this transformation with a focus on sustainability and technological innovation. The biophilic-inspired Business Park will offer smart workspaces within a vibrant public realm, fostering growth and collaboration.

titles: License of Delhi hospital that caught fire expired in March 2024
descriptions: The license issued by the Delhi government to the baby care center had expired on March 31, 2024. After the license expired, only 5 beds were allowed, but at the time of the incident, 12 children were admitted. They had enrolled BAMS doctors and also lacked a NOC on fire safety.

titles: Hyderabad restaurant lift collapses, eight injured
descriptions: In a Hyderabad restaurant, a lift collapsed during an engagement ceremony, injuring eight individuals aged around 32. The incident at Kinara Grand Hotel, Nagole, occurred around 3 pm on Sunday. The injured were shifted to Kamineni Hospital, LB Nagar, with severe bleeding injuries. Nagole police are investigating the case.

titles: Cyclone Remal: 3 get injured, traffic & metro disrupted in Kolkata
descriptions: Cyclone Remal injured three people and disrupted traffic in Kolkata as trees were uprooted. Waterlogging caused traffic diversions. Train services resumed, but metro operations remain affected. Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim assured efforts to clear roads and restore services. No casualties reported, and the cyclone is weakening.

titles: Who is Dalveer Bhandari, Indian judge in UN court who supported ruling against Israel?
descriptions: Judge Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian representative at top UN court International Court of Justice (ICJ), favoured ordering an immediate stop to Israel's military operations in Rafah. Bhandari was born in Rajasthan's Jodhpur and has been an ICJ member since 2012. He's a Padma Bhushan awardee and has served as a judge of Supreme Court and Bombay High Court.

titles: CCTV footage shows man shooting DJ dead after being refused liquor in Ranchi bar
descriptions: A man shot dead a DJ at point-blank range on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday at a bar in Jharkhand's Ranchi after the employees refused to serve him alcohol. The incident was caught on CCTV. The accused arrived after the bar had closed, police said. The DJ was rushed to hospital where he was declared dead.

titles: Teen drives father's BMW as man performs stunts on bonnet in Maharashtra
descriptions: A 17-year-old boy drove his father's BMW car in Maharashtra's Kalyan with a 21-year-old man performing stunts on the bonnet. After a video of the incident surfaced on social media, police arrested the 21-year-old man and booked the father-son duo. The teen, influenced by Instagram reels, had recently coaxed his father to buy the second-hand BMW costing around ₹5 lakh.

titles: BBMP intensifies mosquito-control measures amid rains
descriptions: In response to the recent rainfall, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is ramping up its efforts to control mosquito populations across the city. With the onset of the rainy season, officials emphasize the importance of proactive measures to prevent mosquito breeding and mitigate the risk of diseases such as dengue.

titles: Ad agencies move Bombay HC against CIDCO's billboard notice
descriptions: Two ad agencies have reportedly moved the Bombay High Court, challenging the notice issued by the City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) against illegal hoardings in the Navi Mumbai Airport Influence Notified Area (NAINA). The agencies—Devangi Outdoor Advertising and Harmesh Dilip Tanna, proprietor of Gargee Graphics—reportedly said that these notices were arbitrary and unlawful.

titles: Corporator goes half-naked to protest irregular water supply in MP
descriptions: A corporator in Indore took off his shirt and sat on a dharna to protest the irregular water supply in his ward amid rising temperature. The area corporator Kamlesh Karla said that it's been two months that the residents of Sindhi Colony ward are not receiving proper water supply. Water is coming only for five to ten minutes.

titles: Evolution of Bengaluru Cantonment railway station
descriptions: Bengaluru Cantonment Railway Station stands as a bustling hub, but its origins trace back over 150 years, playing a pivotal role in shaping the city’s growth. Established in 1864 during the tenure of Sir Mark Cubbon as chief commissioner in Mysore, the station emerged as a crucial transportation link for the British, connecting their headquarters in Madras to southern India.

titles: Mentally unstable man kills son, claims 'Sacrifice' order
descriptions: In Chhattisgarh's Balrampur district, a mentally unstable man allegedly killed his four-year-old son by slitting his throat, claiming voices told him to 'sacrifice' someone. The incident happened in Mahuadih village. The man, Kamlesh Nagesia, was arrested. His wife found out and called the police. An investigation is ongoing.

titles: Liquor truck collides in UP, people prioritize looting over aid
descriptions: In UP's Bijnor, bystanders prioritize looting over aiding the injured after a liquor truck collides with a tree. As caught on camera, people scavenge alcohol instead of helping. Incident near Jatpura Bonda village, Mandawali Police Station's jurisdiction. The driver swerved to avoid a cow, leading to a collision. Law enforcement swiftly responded and legal action is underway.

titles: Pune case: 2 doctors nabbed for tampering driver’s blood sample
descriptions: In a fresh development in the Pune Porsche accident case, two doctors from Sassoon General Hospital were arrested in connection with the accident involving 17-year-old Vedant Agarwal, reports said on Monday. The arrested doctors were charged with manipulation of blood samples, Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar confirmed to ANI.

titles: AIMIM leader shot thrice in Maharashtra's Nashik
descriptions: AIMIM leader was shot thrice in Nashik (Maharashtra) around 1:20 am when the perpetrators, riding a motorbike, opened fire at him. He was hit on the left side of his chest, his right hand, and his leg. Following the attack, Malik was immediately taken to a nearby hospital. According to police report, his condition is currently stable.

titles: Essay competition held at Pune car crash site
descriptions: An open essay-writing competition was held in Pune on Sunday as a sign of protest against the initial bail granted to the 17-year-old involved in the Porsche car crash on May 19. Nearly 100 people took part in the contest, with a cash prize of ₹11,111 offered for the best essay. The event was conducted at the accident site.

titles: UP court schedules Rahul's defamation case hearing for June 7
descriptions: An MP-MLA court has scheduled a hearing on June 7 for the 2018 defamation case against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. The case was filed by BJP leader Vijay Mishra over Gandhi's remarks about Amit Shah. Gandhi's lawyer asked for more time due to campaign work. Earlier, Gandhi paused his Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra to attend court hearing and get bail.

titles: What is Payal Kapadia's ongoing dispute with film institute?
descriptions: In 2015, Payal Kapadia led a student protest against the appointment of the new chairman-- actor-turned-politician Gajendra Chauhan, better known as Yudishthir from the Mahabharat TV series. The protesting students condemned the appointment as "politically coloured", adding that Chauhan did not match the vision and stature of past chairmen of the Pune-based institute's governing council.

titles: Flight ops resume at Kolkata airport after 21 hrs amid cyclone
descriptions: Flight operations resumed at Kolkata airport on May 27 after suspension of services for around 21 hours due to Cyclone Remal that made landfall in West Bengal on Sunday night. IndiGo's Kolkata-Port Blair flight became first to depart from the airport at 8.59 am today, an airport official said. The last flight departed the airport at 12.6 pm on Sunday.

titles: Kerala minister praises AI training to teachers by KITE
descriptions: The practical Artificial Intelligence training provided by Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education for the state’s teachers will speed up Kerala’s transformation into an AI knowledge hub, Law and Industries Minister P Rajeev said in Kochi on Sunday, 26 May. The training was imparted in the run-up to the Generative AI Conclave to be held in Kochi in July.

titles: Youth battling for life after being set on fire in Karnataka
descriptions: A harrowing incident unfolded in Dhavalagi village in Karnataka where a youth finds himself fighting for his life after allegedly being doused with petrol and set ablaze by the family of the girl he was romantically involved with. Rahul Ramanagouda Biradar is currently receiving treatment at a private hospital in Vijayapura for severe burns sustained during the ordeal.

titles: 13 Indians lured into illegal work in Laos rescued
descriptions: 13 Indians were rescued from illegal work in Laos and they have now returned home. The Indian Embassy commends Laos' cooperation and has urged for caution against fraudulent job offers. An advisory has been issued that warns of deceptive schemes enticing Indians via Thailand. 428 Indians have been rescued so far.

titles: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee pays homage to Jawaharlal Nehru
descriptions: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee pays tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on his death anniversary, acknowledging his pivotal role in shaping India's modern identity. Nehru's leadership as the first Prime Minister, and his commitment to democracy, secularism, and global diplomacy, remain influential. Banerjee's homage highlights Nehru's enduring legacy & his contributions to India's progress and democracy.

titles: PM Modi chairs meeting to review cyclone 'Remal' preparedness
descriptions: PM Modi chairs a meeting to assess cyclone 'Remal' readiness over the North Bay of Bengal. Coordination with state authorities is emphasized. Precautionary measures include advising fishermen and evacuating one lakh people. PM Modi assures full support to affected states and directs the Ministry of Home Affairs for monitoring and post-landfall assistance.

titles: Why is Menstrual Hygiene Day observed on May 28?
descriptions: Menstrual Hygiene Day is observed annually on May 28 to highlight importance of good menstrual hygiene and break stigma around menstruation. The day is observed on the 28th day of the fifth month because menstrual cycle averages 28 days in length and a person usually menstruates for five days. According to UNICEF, around 1.8 billion people menstruate every month globally.

titles: Cannes winner Payal has a court hearing next month in FTII protest case: Resul
descriptions: Filmmaker Payal Kapadia, whose film won the Grand Prix award at Cannes, has a court hearing next month in connection to a case lodged by FTII, Oscar-winning sound designer Resul Pookutty said. A case was filed against 35 students for protesting actor Gajendra Chauhan's appointment as Chairman in 2015. One of the students said the trial hadn't started yet.

titles: IMD Hyderabad forecasts dry weather in Telangana until May 31
descriptions: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) Hyderabad forecasts dry weather in Telangana until May 31, with partly cloudy skies in Hyderabad. No warnings have been issued. Light to moderate rain or thundershowers may occur in isolated areas. Temperatures have exceeded 45°C in several districts, with Asifnagar in Hyderabad recording 42.6°C. Monsoon is expected after June 6.

titles: 'India is proud': PM Modi lauds Payal Kapadia's Cannes win
descriptions: Payal Kapadia's film, notably the first Indian movie in 30 years to qualify for the festival's competition section, won the prestigious Grand Prix award at the renowned film festival. Narendra Modi took to X to congratulate Payal Kapadia, writing, "India is proud of Payal Kapadia for her historic achievement of winning the Grand Prix at the 77th Cannes Film Festival."

titles: 2000 workers from Telangana apply for jobs in Israel; 905 selected
descriptions: Amid the Israel-Palestine conflict, 905 skilled workers from Telangana passed a recruitment test for construction jobs in Israel. Organized by the state government and NSDCI, the drive attracted 2,209 applicants. Workers, including carpenters and plasterers, are drawn by high pay (₹1.2-1.38 lakh/month). Similar drives occurred in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

titles: Indian apps rule fantasy sports world, betting too: Report
descriptions: Betting and gambling are strictly prohibited in India under the Public Gambling Act, 1867, and are considered illegal in the majority of regions across the country. However, sports betting apps continue to make inroads in the country with 19.4 lakh new downloads in 2023, as per data.ai’s latest report “State of Mobile 2024”.

titles: All We Imagine As Light, Indian cinema’s beacon of hope
descriptions: For once “India shining” at Cannes is not about who wore which fashion label. For the first time, it is about Indian Cinema winning. The credit goes to Payal Kapadia and her luminous cast and crew who won the prestigious Grand Prix at Cannes 2024. Other Indian filmmakers and talents won important awards, as well.

titles: PWD engineers suspended for misconduct during office hrs in K'taka
descriptions: In a decisive move, District Election Officer K M Janaki has demonstrated zero tolerance for misconduct by suspending five engineers from the Public Works Department. Their alleged involvement in consuming liquor with Zilla Parishad officials and contractors at an inspection bungalow during official hours has drawn severe condemnation.

titles: Belagavi police apprehends 27-year-old in harassment case
descriptions: Belagavi rural police have apprehended a 27-year-old individual from Kinaye village, identified as Thippanna Dukare, based on the complaint filed by the girl. She claims to have faced harassment from Thippanna for three years, with relentless pressure to marry him. The complaint alleges that Thippanna threatened her with a fate similar to Neha and Anjali’s if she refused his proposals.

titles: CCTV footage reveals how did fire began in Rajkot Gaming Center
descriptions: Two days after the devastating fire, heart-wrenching CCTV footage has surfaced, revealing the cause of the that led to the massive fire. The video shows sparks erupting from welding equipment, quickly growing throughout the gaming zone within minutes. Police have arrested the owner, Yuvraj Singh Solanki, and his manager, Nitin Jain, on charges including culpable homicide.

titles: Heavy rains, gales claim 13 lives in Telangana
descriptions: Heavy rains with thunderstorms and lightning lashed Telangana on Sunday night, killing 13 people. The severe cyclonic storm Remal caused havoc, uprooting trees, damaging power lines, and disrupting transport. Nagarkurnool district reported seven deaths, Hyderabad four, and Medak reported two casualties. Power supply and communications were significantly impacted in multiple districts.

titles: Voting underway for MLC bypoll in Telangana
descriptions: Polling is underway for the Telangana Legislative Council by-election in the Warangal-Khammam-Nalgonda graduates’ constituency. Voting, from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., involves 4,63,839 eligible voters at 605 polling centres. The main contest is among Congress, BRS, and BJP candidates. Congress aims to retain support by focusing on job promises.

titles: Telangana food safety dept bans Gutka with tobacco & nicotine
descriptions: Telangana has banned the manufacture, storage, distribution, transportation, and sale of Gutka and Pan masala containing tobacco and nicotine for one year from May 24, 2024. This aims to protect public health as these products are linked to severe health issues, including oral cancer.

titles: Arvind Kejriwal seeks 7-day bail extension
descriptions: CM Arvind Kejriwal has filed an application with the Supreme Court seeking an extension of his interim bail for an additional seven days. His application states that during his detention in Tihar jail, he has experienced a weight loss of 7 kg and currently ketone levels in his body are very high. He needs more time for PET-CT scans.

titles: 2 inspectors among 5 suspended for negligence in Rajkot fire
descriptions: Five officials, including two police inspectors and three civic officials, were suspended after over 30 people were killed in fire at gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot. "They were held responsible for their gross negligence in allowing the game zone to operate without necessary approvals," state government said. This comes after reports said that the game zone had no fire NOC.

titles: Doctors arrested for replacing juvenile's blood sample: Pune CP
descriptions: Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar revealed that doctors at Sassoon Hospital replaced the blood sample of a juvenile accused in a luxury car crash, discarding the original. Arrests were made, and IPC sections 120B, 467, and 201 were added. The minor's Porsche crash killed two IT professionals. The investigation continues.

titles: Arrest made in double murder case in South Bengaluru
descriptions: In a significant breakthrough, the Banashankari police in South Bengaluru have apprehended a 26-year-old man suspected of committing two murders within a span of five days. Identified as Girish M, the suspect allegedly bludgeoned his victims to death with stones on footpaths in separate incidents between May 13 and 18.

titles: Cyclone Remal weakens, flights resume in Kolkata
descriptions: Severe Cyclone Remal weakened to a cyclonic storm early Monday, IMD reported. Kolkata Airport resumed flights after being closed due to the cyclone. NDRF teams are clearing roads and waterlogging in Kolkata. West Bengal Governor praised locals' resilience. IMD asked people to stay informed and to follow official updates.

titles: Violent unrest erupts in Channagiri over alleged custodial death
descriptions: Tension gripped Channagiri town in Davanagere district as eleven policemen were injured in an attack on a police station by an enraged mob following the alleged death of a man from a minority community in police custody. The unrest ensued after Adil, 33, was reportedly picked up by police for suspected involvement in illegal betting.

titles: Goa CM congratulates Payal Kapadia and team for Cannes triumph
descriptions: Goa CM Pramod Sawant congratulated Payal Kapadia and her team for winning the Grand Prix at the 77th Cannes Film Festival for 'All We Imagine as Light.' He also lauded actress Chhaya Kadam's special standing ovation, calling it a proud moment. Sawant wished the team continued success and a bright future in Indian cinema.

titles: Delhi Rajkot fires claim young lives, parents demand justice
descriptions: A massive fire broke out in Gujarat's Rajkot on May 24 claiming the lives of 33 people including nine children under the age of 16. Special Investigation Team members met with the local administration in Rajkot city to take stock of the situation. One of the grieving parents alleged that every official visiting the hospital after the incident is “tightlipped”.

titles: Blood sample of teen who crashed Porsche thrown in dustbin, replaced with someone else's
descriptions: Pune Police said the blood sample of the teen, involved in the Porsche crash that killed two techies, was thrown in the dustbin and replaced with another person's. The initial report showed no alcohol trace in the teen's blood. Police added that the sample was replaced on instructions of Dr Ajay Taware and Dr Shrihari Halnor, who have been arrested.

titles: Indian Open Surfing Meet to start in Mangaluru on May 31
descriptions: The 5th Indian Open Surfing will begin from May 31 in Mangaluru in Karnataka. Among the notable participants are Ramesh Budihal, Kishore Kumar, Harish M, Srikanth D, Manikandan D, Kamali Moorthy, Srishthi Selvam, and Sandhya Arun. The event formally commenced with an official inauguration on May 24 under the auspices of the New Mangaluru Port Authority.

titles: PM will build his own temples in every village: K'taka minister
descriptions: Karnataka minister Shivaraj Tangadagi on Saturday, May 25, said if BJP won the Lok Sabha elections again, Prime Minister Narendra Modi would build his own temples in every village. The remark came after Modi said in an interview with a national TV channel that after his mother’s demise, his experiences convinced him that he was sent by God.

titles: BJP protest in Kerala over waterlogged roads in state capital
descriptions: BJP on Sunday, May 26, held a protest march demanding the resignation of Thiruvananthapuram Mayor Arya Rajendran, alleging that roads in Kerala’s capital were waterlogged and damaged and epidemics were on the rise due to the inefficiency of the city corporation. The protestors marched to the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation office with party flags and a banner demanding Rajendran’s resignation.

titles: Minor girl mauled to death by stray dogs in Kanpur, video surfaces
descriptions: A five-year-old girl was allegedly mauled to death by stray dogs in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The alleged dog attack incident occurred when the girl was sleeping with her family on the footpath. The stray dogs dragged two children, including the deceased girl who was sleeping on the Govind Nagar CTI intersection in Kanpur.

titles: PM Modi pays homage to Jawaharlal Nehru on his death anniversary
descriptions: PM Modi pays homage to Jawaharlal Nehru on his death anniversary, recognizing his pivotal role in India's independence and development. Nehru, India's First Prime Minister, championed democracy, secularism, and technological advancement. His legacy as the "architect of Modern India" continues to inspire.

titles: Arunachal CM Pema Khandu extends birthday wishes to Nitin Gadkari
descriptions: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu wished Union Minister Nitin Gadkari a happy birthday, praising his visionary leadership and dedication to transforming India's infrastructure. Khandu expressed admiration for Gadkari's impactful work and wished him continued passion, health, and success.

titles: Water contamination crisis grips Srirangapatna in Mandya District
descriptions: Despite recent incidents elsewhere underscoring the dire consequences of contaminated water, local authorities turned a blind eye to the purification process in Srirangapatna. The Cauvery River, the primary source of drinking water, has been contaminated with blackened, foul-smelling water, raising alarm among residents.

titles: 33 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
descriptions: In a significant development, 33 Maoists surrendered before the Chhattisgarh police and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in Bastar’s Bijapur district, citing disillusionment with the Maoist ideology and condemning atrocities committed by Maoists against tribals. According to officials, the surrendered Maoists also expressed appreciation for the police’s rehabilitation policy.

titles: AIMIM leader Abdul Malik critical after being shot at in Maharashtra
descriptions: AIMIM leader and former Malegaon Mayor Abdul Malik was left grievously injured after two unidentified assailants opened fire at him, reports said on Monday. The incident happened around 1 am in the Malegaon city area when he was outside a restaurant on a highway. Reports said he sustained three bullet wounds, including on the left side of his chest.

titles: Women blessed me for 'Gruha Lakshmi', 'Shakti': Siddaramaiah
descriptions: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who visited the temple town of Dharmasthala in Dakshina Kannada on Saturday, May 25. He said that women blessed him for the two prominent guarantees — 'Gruha Lakshmi' and 'Shakti' — with which they were able to lead a comfortable life and travel from faraway towns to see the deity.

titles: Minor drives father's BMW on busy road in Maha, video surfaces
descriptions: The police took swift action after a viral video showed a youngster performing stunts on the bonnet of a moving BMW driven allegedly by a 17-year-old in Kalyan. According to a report in the Times of India, the 21-year-old on the bonnet, was arrested, while the teenager and his father, a retired government official, have been booked.

titles: Arrears, conflict with Union govt mar Kerala revenue gains
descriptions: For some time now, Kerala has found itself walking a financial tightrope. There are persistent concerns over the state’s struggles to clear arrears it owes to pensioners and beneficiaries of various social security schemes. While the LDF government blames the BJP-led Union government for squeezing state finances, the other side of the coin is internal shortcomings contributing to the strain.

titles: Cyclone Remal disrupts normal life in eastern India
descriptions: Heavy rains and strong winds triggered by Cyclone Remal uprooted trees and destroyed thatched houses in several districts of West Bengal, mainly in coastal areas, on Monday. According to reports, one person died after a portion of a building collapsed in the Entally region in Kolkata.

titles: Missing Telangana IT professional found dead in Australia
descriptions: A 30-year-old IT professional from Shadnagar town in Telangana, who went missing in New South Wales in Australia, was found dead, according to his family members in Hyderabad. Aravind’s body was recovered from the sea in Sydney and family members were informed about his death by the authorities in Australia on Friday, his relative Krishna A said Saturday, May 26.

titles: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Nitin Gadkari
descriptions: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, praising his significant role in enhancing India's infrastructure. Gadkari, known as the "Expressway Man of India," has spearheaded transformative road projects. His leadership in public-private partnerships has garnered global recognition. Modi applauds Gadkari's dedication and wished him continued health and success.

titles: Southwest monsoon expected to weaken upon entering Kerala
descriptions: Weather experts anticipate a weakening of the southwest monsoon as it approaches Kerala in the coming days, attributed to the potential formation of a low-pressure system over the Bay of Bengal. Initial predictions suggest an early onset of the monsoon due to the El Niño effect.

titles: Minor girl dies in sleep after bleeding from nose in Tamil Nadu
descriptions: A minor girl allegedly died in her sleep after starting to bleed from her nose in Tamil Nadu's Salem. The deceased girl has been identified as S Lakshmikumari. The incident occurred after the girl went to sleep post-dinner. Her mother noticed that her daughter was bleeding from her nose. She rushed her daughter to a hospital but was declared dead.

titles: Bihar CM Nitish's helicopter runs out of fuel during poll campaign
descriptions: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's helicopter ran out of fuel during election campaigning on Sunday, JD(U) MP Sanjay Jha told PTI. This happened when the CM had gone to Masaurhi to address a public meeting in favour of NDA candidate Ram Kripal Yadav. Later, Kumar proceeded to his next destination by road for another poll-related engagement.

titles: Speeding Audi fatally rams elderly man in Noida
descriptions: In a repetition of the Pune horror, a 64-year-old man died after he was hit by a speeding Audi car in Noida on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Janak Dev Shah. According to reports, the incident occurred at 6:30 am near Kanchenjunga Apartment in Sector 24 area when the victim was crossing the road.

titles: PM announces ₹2 lakh aid for families of newborns killed in Delhi
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi has announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for each of the families of the seven newborn babies who lost their lives in a fire at Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi. He has also announced a compensation of ₹50,000 for those injured, the Prime Minister's Office said. Notably, the owner of the hospital has been arrested.

titles: Millions without power in West Bengal, Bangladesh amid cyclone Remal
descriptions: Strong winds and heavy rain hit the coastal regions of West Bengal and Bangladesh as severe cyclone Remal made landfall late on Sunday, leaving millions without electricity after power poles fell. The storm crossed the coastal regions with wind speeds measuring up to 135 kmph. The landfall process began around 9 pm on Sunday and continued for about five hours.

titles: German influencer’s dance video at Taj Mahal goes viral
descriptions: German TikTok star Noel Robinson wins hearts in India with his captivating dance moves. His video at the Taj Mahal, clad in traditional attire, goes viral. Robinson's energetic performance of Kuldeep Manak's "Jind Kadh Ke" garners millions of views and praise. Fans flood comments, suggesting he's a new cultural ambassador, bringing joy worldwide.

titles: 2 doctors from Sassoon Hospital held in Pune Porsche accident case
descriptions: In a fresh development in the Pune Porsche accident case, two doctors from Sassoon General Hospital were arrested in connection with the accident involving a 17-year-old, ANI reported on Monday. The arrested doctors were charged with manipulation of blood samples, Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar confirmed to ANI.

titles: Two male elephants found dead in Karnataka
descriptions: On Friday, a somber atmosphere enveloped Talacauvery and Tyagathur in Kodagu of Karnataka as the decomposed carcasses of two male elephants were discovered, raising concerns about wildlife conservation in the region. In Talacauvery, the carcass of a 40-year-old elephant was found on the grassland adjacent to the forest.

titles: Rainfall and monsoon advancements forecasted for several regions
descriptions: The Southwest Monsoon has advanced further, impacting the Bay of Bengal and surrounding areas. Cyclonic storm "Remal" weakens, bringing heavy rainfall to West Bengal and the Northeast. Heat waves persist across Rajasthan and Punjab. Fishermen are warned against venturing into the North Bay of Bengal. Stay alert for weather warnings and advisories.

titles: Gang rape in Sirsi, photos misused; Cops attacked
descriptions: A group, that befriended young ladies in the coastal districts of Uttara Kannada and Udupi, took pictures of them pretending to be in love, edited the pictures into pornographic images, and then used the images to threaten and rape the victims, has been apprehended by the police. Three cops were hurt as the accused threw stones during the arrest.

titles: Theft in front of Parthippadi masjid raises concerns
descriptions: A burglary at a locked house in Vitlapadnur village has left residents shocked, especially considering the occupants were abroad at the time. The perpetrators made away with valuable items including a Rado watch, CCTV, and a DVR. The family of the homeowner, M K Khalil, who had returned from Ajman six months ago, fell victim to the burglary.

titles: 51-yr-old dies in Kolkata as Cyclone Remal makes landfall
descriptions: A 51-year-old man died in Kolkata after heavy rain lashed the city as severe cyclonic storm ‘Remal’ made landfall. The man reportedly died after a wall collapsed and chunks of concrete fell on him during the storm. Trees were uprooted, houses were damaged and waterlogging was seen in parts of Kolkata due to cyclonic storm 'Remal'.

titles: 85 people hospitalised due to suspected food poisoning in Kerala
descriptions: At least 85 people, including children, who consumed food at a restaurant in Kerala's Thrissur district were taken to hospitals on Sunday due to suspected food poisoning. Health officials suspect the consumption of mayonnaise supplied with the dish known as "kuzhimanthi" is the reason for food poisoning. The eatery has been sealed and food samples have been sent for testing.

titles: Parents of Delhi hospital fire victim sold jewellery for child
descriptions: Father of a newborn boy who died in a fire in Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi said that this is the second time he lost a son and criticised the facilities provided by the hospital. "I am a labourer...Ask those parents who have sold jewellery or taken loans for treatment of their childrens," the father told reporters.

titles: Newly-married couple among those killed in Rajkot game zone fire
descriptions: A newly-married couple and their relative were among over 30 victims of Rajkot game zone fire. The couple were identified as Akshay Dholaria and his wife Khyati, who were celebrating their court marriage at the game zone and were to have a grand wedding in December. Five members of a family are also missing and presumed dead in the fire.

titles: Kejriwal asks SC to extend bail by 7 days, says 'have to undergo medical tests'
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, whom the Supreme Court granted interim bail, has filed a plea seeking to extend his bail by seven days. This extension is sought to get a PET-CT scan and other medical examinations, said the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). He was granted bail till June 1 and was asked to surrender on June 2.

titles: 2 doctors arrested for manipulating blood sample of teen in Pune Porsche case
descriptions: Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said on Monday that two doctors from the state-run Sassoon General Hospital were arrested on the charge of manipulating the blood sample of a 17-year-old who crashed his Porsche in a drunken state killing two techies. The initial report showed no trace of alcohol in his blood. The teen is the son of a builder.

titles: Fatal accident claims life of 35-year-old in Mangaluru
descriptions: In a devastating incident, 35-year-old Kushalappa Gowda, also known as Prashanth, from Thotattadi village, met with a fatal accident in Mangaluru. The son of Agari Krishnappa Gowda, Kushalappa worked in the hostel department of a college in Mangaluru. Tragically, his life was cut short when an Innova car collided with his two-wheeler, resulting in severe head and stomach injuries.

titles: Tragic incident exposes lack of safety measures by MCC
descriptions: A case has been registered at Urwa police station against officials of the Mangaluru City Municipal Corporation (MCC) following the tragic death of auto-rickshaw driver Deepak Acharya. Deepak fell into a stormwater drain and drowned while driving his auto-rickshaw near Kottara. The incident, which occurred amid heavy rainfall, was attributed to MCC’s alleged negligence.

titles: Severe cyclone Remal leaves trail of destruction in coastal Bengal
descriptions: Severe cyclone Remal made landfall between West Bengal and Bangladesh coasts with winds gusting up to 135 kmph, bringing heavy rain that flooded homes and farmland, and leaving behind a trail of destruction. Extensive damage to infrastructure and property was seen across coastal West Bengal. Roofs of thatched huts were blown away, trees uprooted and electric poles knocked down.

titles: We don't need a 'Bekhabar PM': Kapil Sibal
descriptions: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal launched a scathing attack on PM Modi on Monday morning in a social media post. Kapil Sibal hit out at PM Modi, saying we don't need a "Bekhabar PM." Kapil Sibal, who currently has no affiliation with any party, has been continuously attacking the Modi government over various issues during the general elections.

titles: Cyclone Remal to weaken into cyclonic storm today
descriptions: The severe Cyclonic storm Remal, that made landfall over coastal areas of West Bengal and Bangladesh, would continue to move northwards for some time and then north-northeastwards before gradually weakening into a cyclonic storm during the next 3 hours, IMD said. Trees were uprooted and heavy rains and gusty winds lashed several parts of West Bengal on Sunday.

titles: Video shows the moment welding sparks triggered fire at Rajkot game zone
descriptions: CCTV footage has shown the moment the massive fire started at the TRP game zone in Gujarat's Rajkot, killing over 30 people. The fire was triggered by welding sparks that landed on "piles" of inflammable materials, reports said, quoting a senior official. The official said "foam sheets, plastic mattresses and thermocol" were stored at the site and these caught fire.

titles: Cyclone Remal makes landfall in West Bengal, uproots trees
descriptions: Severe cyclonic storm 'Remal' made landfall between the coasts of Bangladesh and adjoining West Bengal with winds gusting up to 135 kilometres per hour, bringing heavy rains. Videos showing waterlogging and trees uprooted in Kolkata surfaced. The landfall process began at 8:30 pm on Sunday. Nearly a million people were evacuated over the past two days due to the cyclone.

titles: CCTV footage shows how blaze started in Rajkot
descriptions: The CCTV footage of Rajkot TRP gamin zone has surfaced where a massive fire claimed 28 lives including one child on Saturday. In the footage, it could be seen that the blaze started due to welding in the extension area. Fire extinguishers were also put to use but to no avail due to the intensity of the fire.

titles: Child among 5 killed after speeding van collides with bus in UP
descriptions: Five people, including a child, died and eight others were injured after a speeding van collided with a UP roadways bus on a highway on Sunday, police said. Lakhimpur Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Ramesh Kumar Tiwari said four passengers of the van were killed on the spot while another died on the way to the hospital.

titles: Govt approves ₹21,253cr borrowings for Kerala amid economic crisis
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi-led central government has sanctioned a borrowing limit of up to ₹21,253 crore till December this year for Kerala to help tackle its economic crisis, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar has announced. "I urge CM Pinarayi Vijayan to use funds properly for the welfare of the people of Kerala, without any leakages and corruption," he said.

titles: 1 lakh people shifted to shelters in Bengal due to cyclone Remal
descriptions: Over 1 lakh people were shifted to shelters in West Bengal as the landfall process of cyclone Remal began over the coastal parts of the state. State disaster management staff and NDRF personnel have been deployed all along the coastal belt for rescue and relief operations. A centralised control unit has also been set up to monitor the situation.

titles: Andhra Pradesh stares at capital city uncertainty
descriptions: As Hyderabad is all set to cease to be the joint capital of AP and T'gana on 2 June, the fate of a capital city and its geographical location for the residual AP hangs in the balance even 10 years after the bifurcation. While CM Jagan has come up with a three capital cities proposal, TDP remains committed to Amaravati.

titles: BJP protest in Kerala over waterlogged roads in state capital
descriptions: BJP on Saturday, 26 May, held a protest march demanding the resignation of Thiruvananthapuram Mayor Arya Rajendran, alleging that roads in Kerala’s capital were waterlogged and damaged and epidemics were on the rise due to the inefficiency of the city corporation. The protestors marched to the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation office with party flags and a banner demanding Rajendran’s resignation.

titles: Rajkot gaming zone owners charged with culpable homicide
descriptions: Rajkot Police have filed an FIR against six partners of the gaming zone, charging them with culpable homicide not amounting to murder. Two individuals have been arrested in connection with a fire that claimed the lives of 27 people. The gaming zone had been granted a booking license by local authorities, but its fire safety measures were reportedly inadequate.

titles: Don't have money to reach police station: Influencer who made rap video of Pune crash
descriptions: Influencer Aryan Neekhra, booked for allegedly making a rap video on Porsche crash incident, has appealed to Pune Cyber Cell to take back the case against him as he doesn't have enough money to appear before the police in Pune. "I posted videos and the media made them viral, saying I am the accused who killed two," he added.

titles: SIT invokes KCOCA against hackers in Bitcoin scam
descriptions: The Special Investigation Team probing the bitcoin scam has booked hackers Srikrishna alias Sriki and Robin Khandelwal under the Karnataka Control of Organised Crime Act. Sriki was arrested by the Tumakuru police for his alleged role in stealing 62 bitcoins worth ₹32 crore on 8 May. The bitcoin scam had surfaced during the previous BJP regime in 2021.

titles: Strict FSSAI warning on human breast milk commercial sale
descriptions: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India issued a strict warning on Friday, 24 May, against the sale of human milk and its derivatives, saying it should be immediately stopped. Any violation to this may result in the initiation of action against food business operators in accordance with the FSS Act of 2006 and rules and regulations under it.

titles: Chennai YouTuber reveals unborn baby’s gender, faces legal action
descriptions: Mohamed Irfan, a well-known YouTuber and food vlogger from Chennai, faces action for revealing the gender of his unborn child in a video. In a series of now-deleted videos, he shared details of a prenatal sex determination test his wife underwent in Dubai. That’s illegal in India and he got a notice from the Tamil Nadu Health Department on Tuesday.

titles: Soldier beats wife in UP, stitches fingers with sewing machine
descriptions: A horrifying case of domestic violence has come to fore from Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, a soldier allegedly subjected his wife to brutal physical abuse, resulting in severe injuries, including the loss of her fingers. The incident occurred in Hafiz Ganj Chaukhandi village, under the jurisdiction of Nawabganj police station in Bareilly district.

titles: Cyclone Remal begins landfall over Bengal and Bangladesh
descriptions: The landfall process of severe cyclonic storm 'Remal' has begun over the coastal areas of West Bengal and Bangladesh, IMD said on Sunday. It is forecasted to bring extremely heavy rainfall and strong winds to the coastal areas of Bangladesh and West Bengal. Its maximum sustained speed would be 110-120 kmph gusting to 135 kmph.

titles: Man seen trying to climb stage to reach Akhilesh, stopped by guards
descriptions: A video of a man running and trying to climb the stage where SP chief Akhilesh Yadav was seated has surfaced online. The incident took place during an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia on Sunday. In the video, security personnel can be seen immediately intercepting the man, following which he was escorted back to the audience area.

titles: PM Modi reviews Cyclone Remal preparedness
descriptions: A tense wait grips the coasts of West Bengal and Bangladesh as severe cyclonic storm Remal hurtles towards landfall tonight. Underlining the seriousness of the situation, Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself chaired a meeting on Sunday to review the response and preparedness measures for the cyclone.

titles: 'Make Modi CM again': Nitish Kumar goofs up during election rally
descriptions: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, speaking at a rally in Patna on Sunday (May 26), goofed up on stage and said that Narendra Modi should become the "Chief Minister" (instead of Prime Minister) again so that India and Bihar can develop. When corrected on stage, Nitish refused to accept his mistake and said, "Narendra Modi is already the Prime Minister."

titles: Which were the top 10 hottest cities in India on Sunday?
descriptions: Phalodi in Rajasthan was the hottest city in India on Sunday with a maximum temperature of 49.8°C. This was followed by Barmer 49°C, Bikaner 48.6°C, Jaisalmer 48.5°C, Delhi's Mungeshpur 48.3°C and Najafgarh 48.1°C. Ganganagar recorded 47.8°C, Churu and Jhansi 47.6°C, Faridkot 47.4°C and Kota 47.1°C.

titles: Speeding Audi kills man crossing road in Noida; incident caught on CCTV
descriptions: A speeding Audi was seen hitting a 63-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh's Noida, killing him on the spot. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced on social media, showing the man being flung several feet into the air after the impact. Police said that they are searching for the vehicle and owner details.

titles: Odisha BJP candidate 'vandalises' EVM over long wait in queue
descriptions: BJP candidate Prasanta Jagadev has been arrested for allegedly vandalising an EVM after he had to wait in queue for long to cast his vote as the machine malfunctioned in Odisha's Khordha, officials said. Jagadev apparently pulled the EVM from the table while arguing with the presiding officer, officials added. The presiding officer claimed Jagadev also abused polling personnel.

titles: Audi kills elderly man in Noida, days after Porsche crash
descriptions: An incident similar to the devastating Porsche car accident that occurred in Pune has come to light from Noida, in which a luxury car owner knocked down an elderly man on Sunday morning. The speeding Audi car hit the old man walking on the road, due to which the man was tossed several feet in the air

titles: Track maintainer prevents possible train mishap in Udupi
descriptions: A potential disaster was avoided on the Konkan Railway network on Sunday thanks to the vigilance of a track maintainer. Pradeep Shetty, during his night patrol at 2:25 am, identified a weld failure on the rails between Innanje and Padubidri in Udupi district. He promptly informed his superiors, preventing a possible train accident.

titles: Prison guard sexually exploits man accused of raping minor in MP
descriptions: A case has been filed against a prison guard for allegedly sexually exploiting a 22-year-old male inmate who is facing trial for raping a minor in Madhya Pradesh's Agar Malwa district, an official said on Sunday. The matter came to light after the inmate complained to the district's chief judicial magistrate when she visited the district jail, the official added.

titles: License of Delhi hospital that caught fire expired in March: Police
descriptions: The license of Delhi's Baby Care New Born Hospital, which caught fire killing seven newborn babies, expired in March, police said. Furthermore, the hospital was permitted to have five beds only, but at the time of the incident, 12 newborn children were admitted to the Hospital. No fire extinguishers were installed at the hospital in case of a fire.

titles: What are heat safety measures for workplace as per govt?
descriptions: Amid rising heat, the Health Ministry has shared heat safety measures for workplace. The measures include providing drinking water facility in the workplace, scheduling outdoor and strenuous jobs during cooler hours of the day and increasing frequency of rest breaks. It also recommended training workers to recognise symptoms of heat-related illnesses.

titles: Man installs CCTV in women's bathroom, 200 clips found in UP
descriptions: According to the police complaint filed by a 45-year-old woman on Thursday night, the Mahant, identified as Mukesh Giri, installed a hidden CCTV camera above the changing room at Shani Mandir Ghat in Ganganahar. The live feed reportedly streamed directly to his phone. Authorities confiscated the CCTV device and discovered recordings of approximately 200 women changing.

titles: Reporter asked my 'favourite' word: Shashi on using 'defenestrate'
descriptions: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has shared a picture of a news article in which he used the word 'defenestrate', which means to throw or push someone out of a window, in a remark for the PM Narendra Modi-led government. "Honestly not my fault. A journalist...asked for my 'favourite big word' for the current situation...I usually tend to oblige," he said.

titles: Army Chief General Manoj's tenure as COAS extended till June 30
descriptions: The government on Sunday extended the tenure of Army Chief General Manoj Pande as Chief of Army Staff (COAS) for a period of one month. Initially set to retire on May 31, General Pande will now serve until June 30, 2024. He has held the position of COAS since his appointment on April 30, 2022.

titles: People loot liquor bottles from truck after accident in UP
descriptions: A shocking video from Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor has surfaced online. After an accident involving a liquor truck, people at the scene left the injured unattended and shamelessly started looting the liquor that had spilt onto the road. The incident occurred when a DCM truck, loaded with foreign and domestic liquor, lost control and collided with a tree.

titles: Robert Vadra calls Arvind Kejriwal an 'opportunist'
descriptions: Businessman and husband of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi, Robert Vadra, in an interview to India TV news channel, called AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal an "opportunist". "It is my view," said Vadra when the interviewer reminded him that AAP and Congress were fighting the Lok Sabha elections together in Delhi. AAP and Congress are also part of the opposition INDIA bloc.

titles: What is choline, a key nutrient found in eggs?
descriptions: Choline is a crucial nutrient found in eggs which helps in the development of the brain's memory centre, Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying stated. It also helps in regulating moods, muscle control and forming membranes that surround the cells in a body, as per the National Institutes of Health. Choline is also found in meat, fish, potatoes, cauliflower, etc.

titles: Woman raped by man who promised her role in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' in Mumbai
descriptions: A man has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly raping a 26-year-old aspiring actress after promising her a role in 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. Identified as Anand Singh, he told the woman that he had connections with prominent personalities in the TV industry. He then invited her to his house under the pretext of an audition, where he raped her.

titles: Needle stuck in woman's hip during sewing 3 years ago removed in Delhi
descriptions: A needle stuck in a 49-year-old woman's hip while sewing three years ago was removed by doctors in Delhi. The woman had placed her needle on the bed and stood up to attend to something else when she suddenly slipped and fell back onto the bed. The needle broke and half of it was lodged deep in her hip muscle.

titles: Japan's international student numbers surge by 20.8%
descriptions: According to JASSO, the number of international students studying in Japan increased by 20.8% in 2023 to 279,274. The majority of the newcomers are Chinese, with additions from Nepal and Vietnam. The increase coincides with Japan's objective of drawing in 400,000 foreign students by 2033.

titles: University of Manchester scholarships for Indian students
descriptions: The University of Manchester has announced scholarships for Indian students for September 2024. Scholarships include the Global Futures Scholarship, offering up to £21,000 for undergraduates and £8,000 for postgraduates, and the Humanities Bicentenary and International Excellence Scholarships.

titles: 7 died in heavy downpour in Telangana
descriptions: Heavy thunderstorms and lightning in Hyderabad on Sunday resulted in seven fatalities across various incidents. Four people were struck by lightning at a poultry farm in Tadoor village, Nagarkurnool district. The State Disaster Management Department has issued a warning for more thunderstorms and gusty winds in several districts..

titles: Guj gaming zone fire could've been caused by welding work: Police
descriptions: The fire at a gaming zone in Gujarat that killed at least 27 people may have been caused because of welding work, said Rajkot Police Commissioner Raju Bhargava. "Prima facie...it seems that some fabrication work was going on...There was a lot of inflammable material there, which quickly caught fire and spread throughout the gaming zone," Bhargava said.

titles: Army defuses 3 bombs planted on road in Manipur
descriptions: Three improvised explosives devices (IEDs) were defused by the Indian Army in Manipur's Imphal East district, a defence spokesperson said today. The IEDs were found concealed on the road connecting Nongdam and Itham villages. "A bomb disposal squad arrived at the location and defused the IEDs safely, preventing potential loss of life and injury to locals," the spokesperson stated.

titles: 4-day-old abandoned on road in Rajasthan, succumbs to extreme heat
descriptions: A newborn was found dead in extreme heat conditions in Pratapgarh district of Rajasthan. The body, believed to be no more than 4-days-old, was discovered by sanitation workers near a drain in the Chhoti Sadri police station area. Scorching afternoon sun took its toll on the body with some parts burnt.

titles: 'May Narendra Modi become CM again,' says Nitish Kumar; later corrects himself
descriptions: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar mistakenly suggested that he wishes Prime Minister Narendra Modi becomes a Chief Minister again. "We wish to win over 400 seats across India and respected Narendra Modi should become Chief Minister again," he said. However, after being corrected by other leaders, he clarified that he meant Narendra Modi becomes the PM again and keeps moving ahead.

titles: Game zone visitors in Gujarat had to sign form waiving legal right to sue company
descriptions: The game zone where 27 people died in a fire in Gujarat had made visitors sign a form which waived their right to sue the company. The form saved the employees from "all liability whatsoever for personal injury, property damage or loss or wrongful death caused by its negligence". It didn't have a NOC from the fire department.

titles: No religion-based campaign, BJP will win big: Amit Shah
descriptions: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has asserted that the BJP will get a bigger win in opposition-ruled states due to a "positive mandate" for Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Lok Sabha polls. He also slammed the opposition's criticism of the Election Commission as a ploy to cover up for its impending loss.

titles: BJP candidate in Odisha arrested for alleged EVM vandalism
descriptions: A BJP candidate in Odisha's Khurda district was detained for allegedly damaging an EVM after a malfunction. Prashant Jagdev, MLA for Chilika, reportedly pulled the EVM, causing it to break. He was arrested, booked under various sections, and sent to judicial custody. BJP claims the allegations are politically motivated. BJD also filed a complaint.

titles: K'taka Dy CM orders safety check in game zones after Rajkot fire
descriptions: Following the devastating fire at a game zone in Rajkot, Gujarat, which claimed over 30 lives, Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has issued a memo urging precautionary measures in Bengaluru amusement centers. The memo highlights the Rajkot tragedy as a wake-up call, considering the similar game zones and adventure sports facilities operating in Bengaluru malls and other locations.

titles: French forces get a close look at Indian Army’s new ASMI 9mm SMG
descriptions: The Exercise Shakti, a joint military exercise between India and France held in Umroi, Meghalaya, witnessed an exchange of knowledge beyond just combat drills. French forces getting a firsthand look at the Indian Army's newly inducted ASMI 9mm SMG. The ASMI is a domestically designed and produced submachine gun.
