titles: Tejas equipped No. 45 squadron receives President’s Colours
descriptions: IAF witnessed a momentous occasion as Tejas-equipped No. 45 Squadron and No. 221 Squadron Valiants were conferred with prestigious recognitions. No. 45 Flying Daggers based out of Sulur Airforce Station has been leading the operationalization of Tejas fighter jets. No. 221 Valiants are equipped with Su-30MKI fighter jets while 509 signal unit is the IACCS node in East for IAF.

titles: Owner of Delhi hospital arrested after 7 babies die in fire
descriptions: The owner of Delhi's Baby Care New Born Hospital, Naveen Kichi, has been arrested after at least seven babies were killed and several others were injured in a massive fire, the police said. Earlier, the police had said that the owner was absconding. As per reports, the owner was booked for alleged mistreatment of a newborn in 2021.

titles: Telangana bans gutka, pan masala containing nicotine for a year
descriptions: The Telangana Food Safety Commissioner's Department has decided to halt the production, storage, sale, and transportation of gutka and pan masala containing tobacco and nicotine. These items pose health risks despite not being smoked. This ban, effective for one year starting May 24, is crucial due to the serious health issues associated with these products, such as oral cancer.

titles: What led to massive fire at children's hospital in Delhi?
descriptions: After fire at a Delhi children's hospital killed seven newborns, fire officer Atul Garg said that initial cause of the fire seems to have been an electrical pole igniting, which then set fire to a parked vehicle. He added that oxygen cylinders caught fire eventually and began to explode. "There were 4-5 explosions that significantly worsened the fire," Garg stated.

titles: 11-yr-old girl loses mother in accident, gets ₹1 cr compensation
descriptions: An 11-year-old girl, who lost her mother in a 2015 accident involving a trailer ramming into her scooty at Mazgaon, has been awarded ₹1.1 crore in compensation by a Motor Accident Claims Tribunal. The claim was initially filed by Ritika Ashokan, her father Ashokan Kanapathy, and maternal grandfather Anand Subayya Rai in 2015.

titles: IndiGo reschedules, cancels flights ahead of Cyclone Remal
descriptions: IndiGo Airlines reschedules and cancels flights due to Cyclone Remal and NOTAM in Kolkata. Passengers received updates regarding 394 flights that are now suspended at Kolkata Airport. Complaints over lack of notifications arise too, prompting some to demand compensation. Remal is expected to make a landfall on the Northern Bay on Sunday Night.

titles: KTR accuses Telangana govt of ₹1000 crore scam in rice procurement
descriptions: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) working president K T Rama Rao has accused the Congress-led Telangana government of ₹1,000 crore paddy lifting and rice procurement scam. He demanded Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy and civil supplies minister Uttam Kumar Reddy to clear themselves of the allegations. He challenged them to initiate a judicial inquiry with a sitting judge.

titles: Locals record videos, obstruct rescue ops by firemen in Delhi
descriptions: Even as the fire blazed in and around Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi on Sunday, firefighters faced several challenges during the rescue operation, none more than clearing the crowd that had gathered to record videos. A Delhi Fire Services official said people must avoid coming close to areas where a firefighting operation is underway to allow smooth rescue.

titles: 'Bar bribery' allegations trigger political storm in Kerala
descriptions: A special team from Kerala Police will investigate bar bribery allegations stemming from a leaked WhatsApp audio, which suggests hotel owners were asked to pool money for a favourable liquor policy. The leak allegedly involves Animon, also known as Jayakrishnan, the Idukki district president of the Federation of Kerala Hotels Association.

titles: Ram Mandir bans mobile phones on premises
descriptions: Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra and Ayodhya administration have decided to impose a complete ban on mobile phones on Ram Mandir premises keeping in mind devotees' facilities and security, temple trustee Anil Mishra said. "We appeal to all the devotees to respect this decision...We have complete facilities to keep mobile phones safe," he stated.

titles: Bhavesh's custody extended till May 29 in Mumbai hoarding collapse case
descriptions: A court on Sunday extended till May 29 the police custody of Ego Media owner Bhavesh Bhinde in the Mumbai hoarding collapse case. The 'illegal' hoarding weighing 2.5 lakh kg, which collapsed in Ghatkopar during dust storm, had been installed by Ego Media. Bhavesh has been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder. Seventeen people died in the incident.

titles: Hyderabad's joint capital status nears end, no capital for AP yet
descriptions: As Hyderabad is set to cease being the joint capital of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana on June 2, the future capital and its location for the remaining Andhra Pradesh remains uncertain even 10 years after the bifurcation. Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSRCP and principal opposition TDP continue to toe their respective positions of a single and multiple capital cities.

titles: Man with lotus tattoo says he'll vote for Congress, party shares video
descriptions: Congress shared a video showing stand-up comedian Vikas Kush Sharma interacting with a man who had lotus tattoo on his arm. As Sharma indicated that the man was a "true" BJP fan, the man clarified that his name is Kamal (lotus) and he'll vote for Congress. The video then played 'Moye Moye' song. Congress said, "Moye moye...[will] happen with Modiji."

titles: T'gana bans manufacturing & sale of gutkha & pan masala for 1 year
descriptions: Telangana has banned the manufacturing, storage, distribution, transportation and sale of gutkha and pan masala products containing tobacco and nicotine for one year. The state's Commissioner of Food Safety said the order was taken "in interest of public health" and will apply to products which are packed in sachets/pouches/containers etc. The ban across the state is effective immediately.

titles: IMD issues heat wave alert for multiple regions in India
descriptions: IMD warns of heat wave in West Rajasthan, isolated parts of Punjab, Haryana-Chandigarh-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, East Rajasthan, and Vidarbha on May 30, 2024. Residents advised precautions like staying hydrated and avoiding outdoor activities. Authorities urge vigilance and readiness to tackle the extreme heat. Stay updated with official weather advisories for safety measures.

titles: Had saved money for her: Father of 12-day-old girl dead in Delhi fire
descriptions: The father of a 12-day-old baby who died in a fire in Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi has said that he had saved money for her. "I consider the baby care responsible and also the hospital which referred her here. I want justice for all the babies," the father added. Seven newborns died in the incident.

titles: 'Had saved money for baby', says father of girl dead in Delhi fire
descriptions: "The girl was 12-day-old. I consider the baby care (facility) responsible and also the hospital which referred here. I want justice for all the babies. I request the PM and the CM to ensure justice. I had saved money for the baby. I did not know that she would die," says the shattered man in the video.

titles: Akola hottest city in Maha at 45.8°C; Sec 144 imposed till May 31
descriptions: Akola recorded the maximum temperature above 45°C on Friday and Saturday making it the hottest city in Maharashtra, as per the India Meteorological Department's (IMD) data. In view of the heatwave conditions in Akola, Collector Ajit Kumbhar on Saturday imposed Section 144 till May 31, prohibiting public gatherings. Workers engaged in the industrial sector shouldn't work in sun, order said.

titles: Kakani files complaint over ‘forged' car pass found at rave party
descriptions: A rave party busted on Bengaluru outskirts has triggered a political slugfest between the YSRCP and TDP in Andhra Pradesh after a car pass, purportedly of Andhra Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy, was found at the farmhouse near Electronic City, where the party was organised. The minister has now complained to the Nellore police that a forged car pass was used.

titles: Cyclone Remal approaches North Bay with a speed of 13 kmph
descriptions: In Kolkata, West Bengal, the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) scientist Somenath Dutta has provided an update on cyclone Remal, indicating its trajectory and potential impact on the region. According to Dutta, over the past six hours, cyclone Remal has been moving northward in the North Bay at a speed of 13 km/hr.

titles: 6 Hizb-ut-Tahrir activists arrested for anti-poll campaign in TN
descriptions: Six members of Hizb-ut-Tahrir (HuT), an international Islamist outfit have been arrested for anti-national activities such as propaganda against holding elections and democracy, police said on Saturday, May 26. They were arrested by Chennai police in an operation closely coordinated by intelligence agencies following their propaganda against conduct of elections and democracy.

titles: Shameless: Srinivas as BJP MLA smiles while talking on Rajkot fire
descriptions: During his interaction with media, BJP MLA Ramesh Tilala was seen smiling while talking about the massive fire incident in Gujarat's Rajkot which killed over 30 people. A reporter had asked, "There was no fire facility?" To this, Tilala replied that it'll be known after investigation and smiled. "Instead of crying...people are 'laughing shamelessly'‼️" Congress leader BV Srinivas said.

titles: 5 of family killed after truck collides with their car in K'taka
descriptions: Six people, including five members of a family, died after a speeding truck rammed into their vehicle in Karnataka's Hassan. The incident occurred around 7 am on Sunday on National Highway 75 when the family, along with a driver, were reportedly returning from Mangaluru. Police have registered a case and further investigation has been initiated.

titles: Goa CM Pramod Sawant vows justice after accident in Verna IDC
descriptions: Goa CM Pramod Sawant expressed sorrow over the tragic accident near Commoscope company in Verna IDC, which caused deaths and injuries. He announced the prosecution of the bus driver, who was under the influence of alcohol, and blacklisting of the involved contractors. Sawant assured strict action, stating that no one responsible would be spared.

titles: FSSAI warns against commercial sale of human milk
descriptions: India’s food safety regulator FSSAI has strictly warned against the sale of human milk and its derivatives, emphasizing that the country prohibits commercialization of mother’s milk. The Ayush ministry found that giving approval to companies for production of human milk products led to ethical issues as well as women and human rights violations.

titles: PM Modi praises Payal Kapadia’s historic grand prix win
descriptions: PM Modi praises Payal Kapadia for her historic Grand Prix win at the 77th Cannes Film Festival for "All We Imagine as Light." An FTII alumnus, Kapadia's global recognition highlights India's rich creativity. Modi noted this accolade honors her exceptional talent and inspires new Indian filmmakers, showcasing the artistic potential of India's creative community.

titles: Mother of Porsche crash accused 'emotionally' requested family driver to take the blame
descriptions: Mother of the 17-year-old Porsche crash accused had "emotionally requested" their family driver to take responsibility for the incident, Pune's Commissioner of Police Amitesh Kumar said. Earlier it was reported that the boy's father and grandfather had pressured the driver, Gangadhar, to take the blame. The boy's family members "gave...different enticements" to Gangadhar, police said.

titles: UDF seeks ministers’ resignation in Kerala amid liquor policy row
descriptions: Kerala’s opposition UDF on Saturday, May 26, stepped up its attack against the Left government over its liquor policy and demanded the resignation of Excise and Tourism ministers over alleged corruption in this regard. While UDF accuses LDF of taking bribes to 'favour' bar owners, the latter claims it has not yet held any deliberations over its liquor policy.

titles: FIR filed against 6 Rajkot game zone partners; 2 arrested
descriptions: Police in Rajkot, Gujarat, have filed a case against six partners of a game zone after a fire killed 27 people. Two people have been arrested. The game zone did not have proper fire safety measures or an NOC. A special team is investigating. The Gujarat CM announced compensation for the victims' families.

titles: Blaze engulfs transformer repair centre in Karnataka's Bidar
descriptions: A fire erupted on Sunday morning at the transformer repair centre located within the premises of the Jyoti Colony GESCOM office in Bidar. The blaze caused extensive damage, burning transformers, electrical wires, and a large quantity of diesel. Luckily, all six staff members present at the time managed to escape unharmed.

titles: Severe heatwave in Rajasthan will persist for next 2-3 days: IMD
descriptions: The severe heatwave in Rajasthan will last for the next 2-3 days, with Phalodi reaching 50°C, the highest this summer, says the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Temperatures might drop by 2-3 degrees from May 28-29. Most parts of Rajasthan are very hot, with humidity levels between 15-30%.

titles: People ran inside burning hospital to save babies in Delhi
descriptions: People who saw a huge fire engulf Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi scaled its compound wall and climbed from the rear side of the building to rescue newborn babies, eyewitnesses said. They added that local residents and members of a non-profit, Shaheed Seva Dal, were the first to rush to help. Seven newborns died in the incident.

titles: People write essay on 'If my father was a builder' at Pune Porsche crash site
descriptions: The Congress' Youth Wing organised an essay writing competition at the crash site where a Porsche driven by a 17-year-old in a drunk state killed two techies. Notably, the court had asked the accused to write an essay while granting him bail. The competition's topics included  "My favourite car", "If my father was a builder", and "Ill effects of alcohol".

titles: All Vadodara game zones temporarily shut after Rajkot fire mishap
descriptions: All gaming zones in Gujarat's Vadodara have been temporarily closed after over 30 people died in a massive fire at a gaming zone in Rajkot. "Experts from different departments like the mechanical [and] electrical department…came to investigate…[gaming zones in Vadodara]," Chief Fire Officer Parth Brahmbhatt said. "Those gaming zones that seemed unsafe were asked to take requisite steps," he added.

titles: Gold rates in Hyderabad slide after hitting all-time high
descriptions: Gold rates in Hyderabad have dropped since reaching an all-time high on May 20. From the peak, 24-carat gold fell by ₹2,720 per 10 grams. Currently, 22-carat gold is priced at Rs 66,400, while 24-carat gold is at ₹72,440 for 10 grams. Rates have decreased by nearly 4% in six days, with a 3.61% decline since May 20.

titles: First time hearing about work from jail: Rajnath on Kejriwal
descriptions: Union Minister Rajnath Singh while commenting on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said he had heard about work from home but it's the first time that he is hearing of work from jail. "Kejriwal was jailed in the liquor scam. Even after that, he says he will continue to occupy the chief minister's post," Singh said. Kejriwal is out on bail.

titles: Contaminated water makes over 15 villagers sick in Chamarajanagar
descriptions: More than 15 villagers in Maduvanahalli, Kollegal taluk, in the district, fell ill after they drank contaminated water. They are being treated at the Kollegal government hospital. The villagers complained of vomiting and diarrhoea. The cause is suspected to be contaminated drinking water. Deputy Commissioner Shilpa Nag visited the affected village today to assess the situation.

titles: Swati Maliwal gets rape and death threats, blames on Dhruv Rathee
descriptions: Swati Maliwal has recently spoken out about receiving serious threats after a video posted by popular YouTuber Dhruv Rathee. She claims that this one-sided video has led to a surge in rape and death threats against her. She alleges that leaders and volunteers from her own party are trying to tarnish her reputation.

titles: 16 counting centres set up in Hyderabad for Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: For the Lok Sabha poll results, 16 counting centers have been established in Hyderabad. At the centers, 14 tables will be arranged in each hall for the counting. District Electoral Officer for Hyderabad, Ronald Rose, has announced that the counting of votes will begin at 8 a.m. on June 4.

titles: Stage set for by-election to Telangana MLC seat
descriptions: The stage is set for the by-election to the Telangana Legislative Council from the Warangal-Khammam-Nalgonda graduates' constituency on Monday. A total of 4.63 lakh graduates are eligible to cast their votes in this constituency spread over 34 assembly segments in the undivided districts of Warangal, Khammam and Nalgonda.

titles: Telangana bans gutka, pan masala with tobacco and nicotine
descriptions: The Commissioner of Food Safety, Telangana has issued a notification prohibiting the manufacture, storage, distribution, transportation and sale of Gutka and Pan masala which contains tobacco and nicotine. The department said that the order is in effect for a period of one year from Friday, May 24.

titles: Claim that paracetamol tablets contain 'Machupo' virus fake: Govt
descriptions: A viral post claiming that P-500 Paracetamol tablets contains 'Machupo' virus is a hoax, government's Press Information Bureau (PIB) said. The fake viral post claimed that the white colour tablets looks very shiny and doctors advice that it contains 'Machupo' virus. Paracetamol is a pain reliever usually prescribed to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever.

titles: Who is Payal Kapadia, the first Indian to win Cannes Grand Prix award?
descriptions: Payal Kapadia is the first Indian to win Cannes Film Festival's second-most prestigious award- Grand Prix- for 'All We Imagine as Light'. In 2015, the 38-year-old FTII alumna held a 139-day protest against the appointment of Gajendra Chauhan as Chairman, was booked and denied scholarship. FTII, however, supported her after her short film 'Afternoon Clouds' was selected at Cannes.

titles: 11-year-old girl who lost mother in accident gets ₹1 crore compensation in Mumbai
descriptions: An 11-year-old girl, who lost her mother in an accident in Mazgaon in 2015 when their scooter was hit by a trailer, has been given ₹1.1 crore compensation by a Motor Accident Claims Tribunal in Mumbai. The girl's father and grandfather, who initially filed the claim, died while the case was still active. The girl's mother was a school teacher.

titles: Policeman seen in underwear in front of women praying near temple; UP Police responds
descriptions: A policeman was seen sitting in his underwear in front of women attending a religious event near a temple on Saturday in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. A video of the incident showed him sitting at a police post. Reacting to the video, Unnao Police said, "Area Officer of Bighapur was directed to investigate and take necessary action."

titles: Telangana bans gutka, pan masala for one year
descriptions: The Telangana government has imposed a one-year ban on Gutka and Pan Masala from May 24. The order from the Commissioner of Food Safety prohibits the manufacture, storage, distribution, transportation, and sale of these products containing tobacco and nicotine in any form. This public health measure targets smokeless tobacco products.

titles: Why was other AAP MP who was in London given red carpet?: Maliwal
descriptions: AAP MP Swati Maliwal denied claims of party leadership being upset over her absence during Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's arrest. She said she was in US for a Harvard University seminar and then her sister got COVID-19. "If that's...reason why I was beaten...[and] other Rajya Sabha MP who was in London...given red carpet reception?" she added without naming Raghav Chadha.

titles: IMD issues red alert for heavy rainfall in Assam, Meghalaya
descriptions: IMD issued a red alert for Assam and Meghalaya, predicting extremely heavy rainfall (>204.4 mm) on May 27-28, 2024, and heavy to very heavy rainfall (115.5-204.4 mm) on May 29, 2024. Residents are advised to take precautions, avoid travel, and stay updated with weather alerts to ensure safety during this period.

titles: SpiceJet flight makes emergency landing after bird hit its engine
descriptions: A SpiceJet flight bound for Leh (SG123) encountered a bird strike shortly after takeoff from Delhi on Sunday. The Boeing 737 aircraft safely returned to Delhi after the incident, which involved engine damage. The flight crew detected a bird strike on engine number two and opted to return to Delhi for inspection, said a source. The aircraft landed safely.

titles: Wife gave birth in auto as MP hospital refused to admit her: Man
descriptions: A man claimed her 30-year-old wife gave birth in an autorickshaw after female staff at a Madhya Pradesh hospital refused to admit her. "When my wife gave birth...few kind people set up sheets to give her privacy," Dinesh Silavat added. Cesarean births weren't possible since anaesthetist was on leave, a staff said, adding, "We don't admit...serious patients to avoid risk."

titles: UP man sews wife's fingers, hits genitals, films it
descriptions: The woman sustained serious injuries when her husband struck her with a sharp weapon. He sewed her cut fingers with a sewing machine, repeatedly hit her private part with shoes. He also stabbed her face with a knife several times. He then made a video of his wife's grave condition. He compelled her to make a video of his brutality.

titles: I grew up washing plates, relation between chai and Modi deep: PM
descriptions: While addressing a gathering in UP, PM Narendra Modi said that he grew up washing plates and serving tea. "The relationship between Modi and tea is also very deep," PM Modi said. While criticising SP, PM Modi added, "No one wants to waste their vote on the Samajwadi Party. No one will vote for someone who is drowning."

titles: Man thrown off terrace, thrashed by goons in UP
descriptions: A merchant was thrown off a roof by local goons after refusing to let them drink alcohol on his home's terrace in UP's Lucknow. The incident reportedly took place near the Madeh Ganj area when the goons forced their way into the merchant's home and demanded access to his roof to consume alcohol. The police immediately arrested the assailants.

titles: Owner of Delhi hospital where 7 babies died in fire absconding
descriptions: The owner of the Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi, where seven babies died after a fire broke out, is absconding, police have said. An FIR has been filed against Naveen Kichi, who is a resident of Paschim Vihar, police added. This comes as CM Arvind Kejriwal said that those found guilty of the incident won't be spared.

titles: BJP candidate arrested for vandalising EVM in Odisha
descriptions: A BJP candidate, Prashant Jagdev, was arrested in Odisha's Khurda district for damaging an EVM after it malfunctioned, causing long delays. This happened at booth 114 in Bolagad block. Jagdev is now in custody, facing several charges. The police are investigating and reviewing CCTV footage.

titles: Swati Maliwal shares screenshots of rape threats sent to her after Dhruv Rathee's video
descriptions: AAP MP Swati Maliwal, who accused Arvind Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar of assaulting her, has shared screenshots of rape threats she has been receiving. "After...AAP orchestrated a campaign of character assassination, victim shaming...against me, I've been getting rape and death threats...This got further exacerbated when YouTuber Dhruv Rathee posted a one-sided video against me," she wrote.

titles: 15-year-old boy murders man who raped him several times, arrested in UP
descriptions: A 15-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly murdering a 50-year-old man, who reportedly raped him several times in a village in UP's Muzaffarnagar, police said. The deceased also blackmailed him using an obscene video clip that he recorded. "The boy picked up a sharp object lying next to him and attacked the man's head and throat," police said.

titles: Man made disaster: HC takes suo motu cognisance of Rajkot fire
descriptions: Gujarat High Court on Sunday took suo motu cognisance of fire incident at a gaming zone in Rajkot in which at least 27 people were killed and said it was prima facie a "man-made disaster". HC sought a report from the state government and municipal corporations regarding under what provisions of law such gaming zones were allowed to run.

titles: BSF seizes 89 gold biscuits worth ₹12 Crore
descriptions: On May 25, the Jawans of border outpost Gunarmath received information about a very big consignment of gold in a house in the border village Haldarpada. As soon as the information was obtained, a special operation was launched under which the said suspicious house of the village was cordoned off from all sides.

titles: Video: Thief jumps off moving DTC bus after snatching phone; held
descriptions: A shocking video has surfaced on the internet showing scenes of a robbery on a DTC bus in Delhi. According to reports, the terrifying incident took place on the bus route no. 801 on May 16 in the Kapashera area of the South West district of Delhi NCT. The thief was soon caught by a team of DCP Delhi South-West.

titles: Najafgarh road affected due to burnt truck near metro pillar
descriptions: Traffic on Najafgarh Road from Uttam Nagar to Dwarka Mor is disrupted due to a burnt truck near Metro Pillar No. 748. Commuters are advised to plan accordingly and expect delays. Authorities are working to clear the area. Drivers are encouraged to seek alternative routes and remain patient during this period of congestion.

titles: India has remained filthy at street level for last 50 years: Sanjiv Kapoor
descriptions: Former Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said India "at street level has remained filthy" for the last 50 years despite the multifold growth in per capita income. "Countries with lower per capita income are much cleaner," he wrote on X. He earlier praised the world's most populous city Tokyo for its cleanliness and said, "You'll never find...garbage on the road."

titles: Retired IAS officer's wife killed in Lucknow home while he was playing golf
descriptions: Mohini Dubey, the wife of retired IAS officer Devendra Nath Dubey, was found murdered at the couple's residence in Lucknow on Saturday, police said. The incident happened when Devendra Dubey was out playing golf. "He also mentioned that some jewellery and other items were stolen," police added. Police suspect someone who knew the couple's routine committed the crime.

titles: Red alert issued for Delhi for 4 days amid severe heatwave
descriptions: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red alert for Delhi for today (Sunday) and the next three days amid severe heatwave. The maximum temperature is expected to hit 44°C today and 45°C the next three days. The IMD has warned that there is a "high health concern" for vulnerable people like infants, elderly and people with chronic diseases.

titles: Foreigners call Delhi Metro safest & cleanest in viral video
descriptions: Two foreigners made a video and said that even though they were skeptical of taking the Delhi Metro, it turned out to be the safest, cleanest and smoothest for them. "After 5 months in India...we have learned that most of the time...everything is a lot safer than you think it is...and most people are good people," they wrote on Instagram.

titles: Dry days in Bengaluru from June 1-4 & June 6 amid polls
descriptions: The sale of liquor in Bengaluru has been banned for five days in the first week of June for the upcoming Karnataka Legislative Council (MLC) elections and vote counting of Lok Sabha elections. Liquor sales will be banned from June 1-June 4 and then on June 6, the day when MLC election results will be declared.

titles: IMD warns of heatwave conditions in several regions of India
descriptions: IMD predicts heatwave in parts of West Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, East Rajasthan, and Vidarbha on May 30, 2024. IMD has urged people of caution and to avoid outdoor activities during peak hours. Timely alert emphasizes preparedness and safety measures to mitigate risks and ensure well-being amid rising temperatures.

titles: Swati Maliwal reports rape and death threats to Delhi police
descriptions: Swati Maliwal levelled fresh allegations against the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and YouTuber Dhruv Rathee for her 'character assassination' in public. Maliwal stated that she has been receiving rape and death threats on social media, due to AAP's 'orchestrated campaign' against her. She also accused YouTuber Dhruv Rathee of posting a one-sided video against her.

titles: PM Modi highlights deep bond with tea in Mirzapur
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that he grew up washing cups and serving tea. He criticized the Samajwadi Party for giving jobs to family members and making communal policies. Modi praised CM Yogi for his cleanliness drive and promised to help the poor and marginalized. He opposed SP's unfair reservation plans.

titles: President mourns victims of tragic road accident in Shahjahanpur
descriptions: President Droupadi Murmu mourns victims of a tragic road accident in Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh. 11 lives were lost, and several were injured as a truck collided with a bus carrying pilgrims. Heartfelt condolences extended to families; prayers for swift recovery. Rescue operations deployed, investigation is underway. Urgent call for enhanced road safety measures to prevent future tragedies.

titles: HTV breakdown causes traffic disruption on Mathura Road
descriptions: Traffic on Mathura Road, Delhi, is disrupted from Badarpur to Ashram due to a breakdown of a heavy transport vehicle near Sarita Vihar flyover. Commuters are advised to plan alternate routes for smoother travel. Authorities are working to clear the obstruction. In the meantime, patience and caution are urged from drivers navigating through the affected stretch.

titles: ₹2 cr Porsche that Pune teen crashed killing 2 techies was his birthday gift
descriptions: The Porsche Taycan, which costs around ₹2 crore, that a 17-year-old boy in Pune crashed killing two techies was his birthday gift. The teen's grandfather, Surendra Agrawal, had shared a picture of the car on a WhatsApp group saying it was his grandson's present, Agrawal's friend said. Surendra Agrawal was also arrested over allegations of confining the family's driver.

titles: Fire engulfs multiple shops outside Ajmer railway station
descriptions: An incident that unfolded near Rajasthan's Ajmer railway station, a fire broke out at a restaurant, quickly spreading to several adjacent shops. Swift response of the fire brigade ensured that they quickly douse it off and prevent further damage. The fire began at a restaurant situated near Ajmer railway station, leading to a rapid escalation that engulfed multiple shops nearby.

titles: Cyclone Remal will hit Bengal and Bangladesh on Sunday night
descriptions: Cyclone 'Remal' has become a severe storm and will hit between West Bengal's Sagar Island and Bangladesh's Khepupara on Sunday night, says the IMD. With winds up to 135 kmph, it will bring heavy rain to coastal areas of West Bengal and north Odisha. The Sundarbans forest is also at risk. Fishermen should stay away from north Bay of Bengal.

titles: Odisha Board declares Class 10 results, 96% students pass
descriptions: Board of Secondary Education (BSE) Odisha has announced Class 10 board results which were taken by over 5.5 lakh students. As per data, 96% students passed the exam with girls  outperforming with a pass percentage of 96.73% against boys' 95.39%. A total of 2,644 schools have achieved 100% results. The results can be checked on official websites bseodisha.ac.in and orissaresults.nic.in.

titles: PM announces ex-gratia for victims of Delhi Hospital fire tragedy
descriptions: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh ex gratia for next of kin of deceased and ₹50,000 for injured in Delhi hospital fire tragedy from PMNRF. The gesture aims to aid families coping with loss and support survivors. Government vows thorough investigation and stringent safety measures to prevent future incidents. Assistance and medical care efforts are underway for affected individuals.

titles: ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for kin of those killed in Rajkot fire mishap
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi announced  ₹2 lakh ex-gratia from PMNRF for families of those who died in Rajkot fire mishap, and ₹50,000 for injured. The swift response aims to ease financial burdens and extend support to those affected by the tragic incident. Modi's gesture underscores solidarity and the government's commitment to assist during crises, ensuring relief reaches the affected.

titles: ₹116 crore in cash, assets seized in tax raid on Surana Jewellers in Nashik
descriptions: The Income Tax Department on Sunday launched a raid on Surana Jewellers in Maharashtra's Nashik in response to alleged undisclosed transactions by the proprietor. About ₹26 crore in cash and documents of unaccounted wealth worth ₹90 crore have been seized in raids. Visuals shared by ANI showed tax officials with several bags full of seized cash.

titles: House of man who raped 7 MP girls by pretending to be female razed
descriptions: The house of the 30-year-old man who allegedly raped at least seven tribal girls in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi has been demolished. A video showed a bulldozer razing the house. Brajesh Prajapati had contacted his victims by using a voice-changing app and posing as a female college professor. He allegedly lured them by posing to offer them scholarships, police said.

titles: Vadodara gaming zones closed after Rajkot fire incident
descriptions: All gaming zones in Vadodara are temporarily closed after the Rajkot fire that killed 27 people. Chief Fire Officer Parth Brahmbhatt said they inspected the zones and told the unsafe ones to improve safety. The zones will stay closed until further notice. They are planning measures to prevent future incidents.

titles: NWKRTC staff suspended for making reels on duty
descriptions:
Karnataka's NWKRTC suspends driver and conductor for making Instagram reel on-duty, casting negative light on department. Viral video shows driver Hanumanthappa with umbrella, sparking safety concerns. Departmental inquiry has been launched. NWKRTC MD Priyanga confirms 
 that no roof leakage was found after inspection, and reel was made only for entertainment.

titles: MP woman denied admission in govt hospital, gives birth in auto
descriptions: When 30-year-old Rajni was denied admission to the Neemuch district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, she ended up giving birth in an auto-rickshaw. Following this incident, both the mother and child were later admitted to the hospital and were reported to be in good condition. The district collector has ordered an inquiry into the matter, according to reports.

titles: Sanjay Singh told me he'll do something: Maliwal on assault
descriptions: AAP MP Swati Maliwal said that Sanjay Singh came to meet her after the alleged assault by Arvind Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar. "I also received a call from Sanjay Singh. He told me: 'hum dekhte hain, kuch karenge' (we will see and will do something)," Maliwal told Times Now, adding that Singh went to Kejriwal's house after meeting her.

titles: Third case of Polio reported in Pakistan
descriptions: Pakistan confirmed its third polio case of the current year, intensifying the ongoing struggle against this crippling disease. Additionally, three more environmental samples tested positive for polio, increasing concerns about the virus's prevalence. The latest victim is a 12-year-old girl from Balochistan’s Killa Abdullah district.

titles: 11 pilgrims dead in UP as gravel-loaded truck overturns on bus
descriptions: Eleven pilgrims headed to the Purnagiri temple in Uttarakhand were buried to death when a gravel-loaded dumper truck overturned on their bus and emptied its content into their vehicle. Ten other pilgrims were seriously injured in the Saturday night incident and have been admitted to the hospital.

titles: IRCTC staff finds huge trash on sweeping under train seats
descriptions: A video from an Indian railway coach has surfaced online which shows an on board housekeeping staff sweeping under train seats and drawing huge amount of trash thrown there. He cleaned the area which was kept filthy by passengers. From consumed chips packets to empty plastic water bottles, there were many items collected in the trash.

titles: Uttarakhand CM expresses grief over Shahjahanpur road accident
descriptions: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed sorrow over the Shahjahanpur road accident, which claimed 11 lives. He extended condolences to the bereaved families and prayed for the injured's swift recovery, invoking blessings from Maa Purnagiri. Dhami emphasised solidarity in grief, urging strength for the affected families during this tragic time.

titles: Arunachal CM celebrates Rinya’s role at biodiversity convention
descriptions: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu lauded Koj Rinya, IFS, from Ziro, for representing India at the International Convention on Biodiversity. He praised her as a symbol of women's excellence in the state and urged her to highlight Arunachal's biodiversity conservation initiatives, showcasing the state's commitment to preserving its rich natural heritage.

titles: 7 newborns die in Delhi hospital fire, several injured
descriptions: A fire at New Born Baby Care Hospital in Delhi's Vivek Vihar killed seven infants and injured others. Delhi Fire Services swiftly responded with nine fire tenders. Eleven newborns were rescued. The cause of the fire is under investigation. The rescued infants were shifted to the East Delhi Advance NICU hospital.

titles: Remal intensifies into severe cyclonic storm
descriptions: The Southwest Monsoon advances in the Bay of Bengal, while Severe Cyclonic Storm 'Remal' intensifies, threatening Bangladesh and West Bengal. Expect heavy rainfall, thunderstorms, and gusty winds in over these regions within the next 24 hours. Heat wave conditions persist in several areas, with fishermen advised to avoid certain seas. Stay informed on weather updates for safety.

titles: Cyclone Remal threatens Bengal & Bangladesh coast
descriptions: IMD warns of Cyclone Remal's severity as it approaches the West Bengal-Bangladesh coasts on Sunday night. Wind speeds may hit 120 kmph, with heavy rainfall expected in West Bengal, coastal Bangladesh, Tripura, and northeastern states. Kolkata airport suspends operations, NDRF is on standby, and evacuations are underway in vulnerable areas.

titles: What is causing extreme heat in Northeast India?
descriptions: Northeast India is facing extreme heat due to change in wind direction which is northerly, IMD said. "The change in wind direction is mainly due to cyclone formation over the Bay. Northeast India will see relief from Sunday once cyclone makes landfall," the weather department said. On Saturday, Guwahati recorded highest maximum temperature in May after 64 years at 40.1°C.

titles: Cyclone Remal intensifies into 'severe cyclonic storm'
descriptions: Cyclone Remal in the Bay of Bengal has intensified into a severe cyclonic storm (with wind speeds of 85-95km/hour), the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. It is expected to "intensify further", IMD said, adding that it is expected to make landfall between West Bengal and Bangladesh by Sunday night. Heavy rainfall warning has been issued for several states.

titles: Woman goes to Mumbai hospital, dies as doctor's SUV runs over her
descriptions: A 60-year-old woman was killed after a 'speeding' SUV ran over her on the premises of Mumbai's Sion hospital on Friday. Rubeda Shaikh had gone to hospital for treatment of a wound when SUV being driven by Dr Rajesh Dere allegedly hit her. Dere, an HOD of the hospital, has been arrested. "She died due to cardiogenic shock," he stated.

titles: Guilty won't be spared: CM as 7 babies killed in Delhi hospital fire
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the cause which led to the fire incident at Delhi's Baby Care New Born Hospital is being investigated. Those who are found guilty of the incident will not be spared, he added. Seven newborn babies died in the fire. Calling the incident "heartbreaking", Kejriwal said, "We all stand with those who lost their innocent children."

titles: IndiGo passenger tries to open door mid air
descriptions: A 29-year-old man was arrested for allegedly attempting to open the door of a Hyderabad-bound IndiGo flight mid-air, shortly before landing. The incident, which occurred on May 21, surfaced on Friday.Police reported that the passenger, from Chandragirinagar in Hyderabad's Gajularamaram, had consumed bhang (cannabis) before boarding the flight from Indore, as per PTI.

titles: Game zone where fire killed 27 in Rajkot had no fire licence & only 1 exit
descriptions: The gaming zone in Rajkot where a fire broke out on Saturday killing at least 27 people was operating without a fire clearance, officials said, adding that no application was received for it. They added it had only one emergency exit. "We will investigate how such a big game zone was functioning without a fire NOC," Mayor Nayanaben Pedhadiya said.

titles: Cyclone Remal expected to make landfall on the West Bengal coast
descriptions: Cyclone Remal is all set to turn severe before making landfall between the coasts of West Bengal and Bangladesh on Sunday night, as per IMD. The cyclone is forecast to cross the West Bengal and adjoining Bangladesh coasts with wind speeds of 110 to 120 kmph, gusting to 135 kmph, by midnight on Sunday.

titles: Hit by doctor’s car, woman dies at hospital premises in Mumbai
descriptions: An elderly woman was hit by a speeding car on Friday evening on the premises of Lokmanya Tilak Hospital in Sion, Mumbai. Police reported that the woman died due to the accident. Police have registered an FIR and initiated an investigation. The car that caused the woman's death was being driven by Dr. Rajesh Dhere, who works at Sion Hospital.

titles: President mourns tragic loss of children in hospital fire in Delhi
descriptions: President Droupadi Murmu expressed deep sorrow over the tragic death of children in a hospital fire in Vivek Vihar, Delhi. She extended condolences to the bereaved families and wished for the swift recovery of the injured. Murmu emphasised solidarity and strength during this difficult time, offering prayers for those affected by the devastating incident.

titles: Bengaluru to enforce liquor sales ban during MLC elections
descriptions: Liquor sales will be banned in Bengaluru from June 1-6 due to legislative council elections. Wine shops, bars, and pubs will remain closed, except for serving non-alcoholic beverages and food. Elections will take place on June 3 and counting on June 6. Seats are vacant after the retirement of members, including Dr. Chandrashekhar B Patil, Ayanuru Manjunatha, and others.

titles: India records highest temperature since 2019 at 50°C
descriptions: Temperatures in India soared on Saturday with Rajasthan's Phalodi recording a maximum temperature of 50°C. According to IMD, 50°C is the highest temperature recorded in the country since June 1, 2019, when Rajasthan's Churu recorded its highest temperature of 50.8°C. Seventeen places in states like Punjab, Maharashtra and UP recorded maximum temperatures of 45°C or more.

titles: Cyclone Remal intensifies into severe cyclonic storm
descriptions: Cyclone Remal, which is expected to make landfall between West Bengal's Sagar Island and Bangladesh's Khepupara on Sunday night, has intensified into a severe cyclonic storm, the IMD said. The cyclone is likely to bring extremely heavy rainfall in coastal Bengal and Odisha on Sunday while rains are also predicted in parts of northeast India on May 27-28.

titles: FSSAI issues warning against sale of human milk in India
descriptions: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has banned the commercialization of human milk, citing no approval under FSS Act, 2006. Licensing authorities are instructed to deny permits to businesses involved in human milk processing or sale. Donor human milk is strictly for medical use, free of charge.

titles: Serial killer Charles Sobhraj was also interviewed like this: PM Modi on Kejriwal
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, saying he was "shocked" by a "corrupt individual being interviewed" by the media after he secured interim bail. "I've only seen (serial killer) Charles Sobhraj being interviewed like this before," he said. He added there were "daakoos" (dacoits) earlier who were "glorified" by media, adding, "Now corrupt politicians are...getting this benefit."

titles: Guwahati records highest max temp in May after 64 yrs at 40.1°C
descriptions: The city of Guwahati in Assam recorded its highest maximum temperature in May since 1960 at 40.1°C on Saturday. It was a departure of 8°C from the normal temperature. On May 1, 1960, Guwahati had experienced a maximum temperature of 40.3°C. The IMD on Saturday issued its first heatwave warning for Assam in recent years.

titles: 3 dead, 3 hurt as fire breaks out in residential building in Delhi
descriptions: At least three people were killed and three received injuries after a massive fire broke out at a residential building in Delhi’s Krishna Nagar on early Sunday, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) officials said. “We received a call of fire at 2.35 am...Fire was doused at 7.20 am,” Delhi Fire Services official said. Seven people were rescued safely in the incident.

titles: 7 babies killed in massive fire at hospital in Delhi
descriptions: At least seven newborns, who were rescued after a fire broke out at a hospital in East Delhi's Vivek Vihar, have died, officials said on Sunday. The officials of the Delhi Fire Services (DFS) said the blaze broke out at the children's hospital in Shahdara on Saturday night. Twelve newborns were rescued from the facility, but seven of them died

titles: YEIDA farmers to get ₹1,334 cr compensation in Jaypee resolution
descriptions: NCLAT has upheld Suraksha Realty's resolution plan for Jaypee Infratech and has directed the former to pay ₹1,334.31 crore to Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) over four years. This will allow YEIDA to hike land compensation paid to farmers, affecting approximately 10,000 farmers. YEIDA had filed claims totaling ₹6,111.59 crore against Jaypee Infratech for pending works.

titles: 11 dead, 10 injured after truck hits bus carrying devotees in UP
descriptions: A truck topples onto an Uttarakhand-bound bus near Khutar police station in Shahjahanpur district. 11 people died whereas 10 are injured. A collision occurred at a roadside eatery. Victims from Jetha village, Sitapur district. Ashok Kumar Meena, SP Shahjahanpur, stated the truck lost control and flipped onto the bus. Injured have been admitted to hospitals.

titles: Make temple for Modi: Mamata's jibe at PM's 'sent by God' remark
descriptions: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee took a dig at PM Narendra Modi after he recently said that he feels he has been sent by the God. Mamata said, "These days he claims he is not biologically born and that God created him. I will then give you some space so that you build a temple, place your photograph there."

titles: 4 tourists killed as speeding Scorpio car skids off road in J&K
descriptions: Four tourists were killed and three others were injured after the Scorpio car they were travelling in skidded off a road in south Kashmir on Saturday. The deceased, all from Punjab's Moga district, were aged between 23 and 28. "The driver was driving...at high speed and the vehicle turned turtle," a police official said. The vehicle was going to Srinagar.

titles: Man 'high on bhang' tries to open IndiGo flight door mid-air, arrested
descriptions: A 29-year-old man was arrested for allegedly trying to open an IndiGo Indore-Hyderabad flight's door mid-air, police officials said. The man allegedly consumed intoxicant 'bhang' before boarding the flight and argued with airline staff minutes before it landed in Hyderabad, they said. "The man was moving in the aisle without reason when plane was in the air," said an official.

titles: Learnt about Delhi hospital's fire from news: Newborn's family
descriptions: Family members of newborns who were admitted in Delhi's Baby Care New Born Hospital said that they were not informed about the fire incident and got to know about it from news. "I kept calling hospital staff but they didn't respond," a family member said. Around 12 newborns were rescued from the fire, of which at least six have died.

titles: Was in US during Kejriwal's arrest but kept tweeting: Maliwal
descriptions: AAP MP Swati Maliwal said that in March when Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was arrested she was in US to attend a Harvard conference, and participated in various events organised by AAP volunteers. Reacting to criticism by AAP leaders over her staying quiet during Kejriwal's arrest, Maliwal said she was tweeting and did whatever she could do at that time.

titles: Game zone manager & co-owner arrested over Gujarat fire, death toll rises to 27
descriptions: Two people, Nitin Jain and Yuvrajsinh Solanki, were arrested as the death toll in the fire at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot, rose to 27, police said. Solanki is a co-owner of the zone while Jain is the manager, they added. "We are also looking for Prakash Jain, another person associated with this gaming zone," an official said.

titles: Fire spread in seconds, narrow gates made escape difficult: Eyewitnesses on Rajkot fire
descriptions: The fire in Rajkot gaming zone in Gujarat that killed 27 people including children on Saturday spread within seconds and narrow gates made escape difficult, eyewitnesses said. A visitor said a few staff members tried to use fire extinguishers but to no avail. "The area was...full of smoke...We tried to escape from the rear door but couldn't," another visitor said.

titles: 11 devotees going to U'khand crushed to death as truck overturns on bus in UP
descriptions: Eleven devotees were killed and ten were injured after a truck carrying ballast stones lost control, hit a parked bus at a dhaba and overturned on it in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur on Saturday night. Police said bus was carrying devotees to Uttarakhand's Purnagiri and some people were eating at dhaba when the accident happened. The devotees were residents of Sitapur.

titles: Twenty dead as fire engulfs gaming zone in Rajkot
descriptions: A massive fire that erupted at a gaming zone in Rajkot, Gujarat on Saturday evening has claimed twenty lives, said officials and rescue operation is currently underway. Gujarat Chief Minister, Bhupendra Patel, swiftly directed officials to prioritize the immediate treatment of the injured. Rajkot Police Commissioner Raju Bhargava provided updates on the ongoing rescue efforts.

titles: Sign of state’s law & order decline: MLA Suvarna on Udupi gang war
descriptions: The gang war incident in which gangsters brandished deadly weapons and fought on Udupi main road at midnight is a testament to the failure of the home department in the state and a complete collapse of law and order under the Congress government, said Udupi MLA Yashpal Suvarna. He expressed concern on this incident.

titles: Joshi slams CM's action against police in Channagiri case
descriptions: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi has lashed out at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah for suspending a DYSP and CPI in the Channagiri case, saying it has demoralized the police force. Joshi said that the CM action makes it seem as if the police should run away from the police stations. He condemned incident and suspension of the police officers.

titles: 6 newborn babies killed in massive fire at Delhi hospital
descriptions: Several newborn babies were killed after a massive fire broke out at Baby Care New Born Hospital in Delhi late on Saturday, officials said. Around 12 newborns were rescued from the fire, of which at least six have died, reports said, adding that one child is on ventilator. Five other children are getting treatment and fire has been extinguished completely.

titles: CM wrote to PM in April to cancel Prajwal's passport: K'taka minister
descriptions: Karnataka minister G Parameshwara has reacted to EAM S Jaishankar's remark about receiving the request to impound the passport of ex-PM Deve Gowda's grandson Prajwal Revanna after nearly a month, saying, "If [Jaishankar] said so, then it means...PMO didn't inform the Ministry of External Affairs." CM Siddaramaiah wrote to PM Modi about cancelling the passport in April, he added.

titles: ₹4 lakh ex-gratia announced for family of those killed in Gujarat fire
descriptions: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel has announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for family of those killed and ₹50,000 for those injured in the Rajkot gaming zone fire. He also said that a Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed to probe the incident. PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah have also spoken to Patel and rendered their support.

titles: Rahul, Kejriwal express grief as 20 killed in Guj gaming zone fire
descriptions: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and AAP supremo Arvind Kejriwal expressed grief as 20 people, including children, were killed in a massive fire at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot on Saturday. "Congress workers are requested to provide all possible assistance to the administration in relief and rescue work," Rahul wrote. "May God give courage to all the families," Kejriwal wrote.

titles: Spy camera found in women's washroom in Ghaziabad, temple priest booked
descriptions: Police have booked a temple priest for allegedly putting up camera over a roofless women's bathroom in Ghaziabad, police said. The matter came to light when a woman who went to the temple with her daughter noticed a CCTV camera pointed at the bathroom. The display of the CCTV was linked with the mobile phone of the priest, police said.

titles: IIT graduate quits MNC job to become fitness coach
descriptions: Priyanka Gupta, who graduated from IIT Kanpur, started her own business, VegFit. In 2012, she decided to take the risk and launch her first startup. Eventually, she found her niche and now helps professionals stay fit. "Scary as heck, but man, was it worth it!" she wrote in her post on LinkedIn.

titles: K’taka could surpass Punjab in drug cases: Minister Pralhad Joshi
descriptions: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi warned that Karnataka could surpass Punjab in drug cases if the state does not take immediate and strict action to control drugs, ganja, and other narcotics. Speaking to the media in Hubballi on Saturday, Joshi said that the increasing number of drug cases in Hubli, Bengaluru, and Mangalore regions is a clear indication of the problem.

titles: Car driver drags police constable hanging on car bonnet in Delhi
descriptions: A shocking video has surfaced on the internet in which a traffic police constable is seen hanging on the bonnet of a speeding car in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area on Saturday. It can be seen in the video that a car driver keeps driving, even as a traffic police constable is hanging on the bonnet of the car.

titles: BJP's Pranat Tudu attacked by 200 people in Jhargram
descriptions: During the sixth phase of the Lok Sabha elections, there was major poll violence in Jhargram. BJP candidate Pranat Tudu was attacked in Garbeta while visiting booth number 200 in Monglapota. Several people, including CISF jawans, were injured. Tudu accuses TMC of trying to scare BJP voters and says the local police did not protect them.

titles: 33 Naxalites surrender to security forces in Chhattisgarh
descriptions: 33 Naxalites, including three with bounties totalling Rs 5 lakh, surrendered in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh. They were unhappy with Maoist violence and empty promises, so they turned to the police and CRPF for rehabilitation. Among them were Raju Hemla and Samo Karma, each with a ₹2 lakh bounty, and Sudru Punem with a ₹1 lakh bounty.

titles: Extremely distressed by Rajkot fire, talked to Gujarat CM: PM Modi
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi has said that he's "extremely distressed" by the massive fire incident that occurred at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot. Around 20 people, including children,  were killed in the incident. He added that CM Bhupendra Patel informed him that "efforts [are] underway to ensure all possible assistance" to those affected during their conversation on the phone.

titles: Heatwave to severe heatwave warning issued for several states, list released
descriptions: Heatwave to severe heatwave conditions are very likely in many parts of Rajasthan during May 25-29, Punjab during May 26-29, Haryana-Chandigarh during May 25-29, West Uttar Pradesh during May 26-28, isolated pockets of Madhya Pradesh till May 28 and Delhi during May 25-29. Himachal Pradesh,  Chhattisgarh, Assam, Meghalaya, Gujarat and Maharashtra are also likely to experience heatwave.

titles: Video shows Bengal BJP candidate running as people pelt stones
descriptions: BJP Lok Sabha candidate from Jhargram Pranat Tudu was allegedly attacked while visiting a booth in West Bengal's Monglapota. A video of the incident shows Tudu running as people pelt stones. Accusing the TMC of orchestrating the attack, Tudu claimed, "We could have been murdered." He added that two CISF jawans and his security personnel were injured in the incident.

titles: 2 Rashtrapati Bhavan staffers claim names missing from voters' list
descriptions: Two employees at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, Younus Salim and Azim Khan, have claimed that their names were missing from the voters' list even though they had valid documents. The duo had gone to cast their vote at the Dr Rajendra Prasad Kendriya Vidyalaya in the President's Estate in Delhi. Another person in the national capital also made a similar allegation.

titles: Which were the hottest cities in India on Saturday?
descriptions: Phalodi in Rajasthan was the hottest Indian city on Saturday (May 25) as it recorded highest maximum temperature of 50°C, as per the IMD. Barmer was the second hottest city at 48.8°C, followed by Jaisalmer (48°C), Bikaner (47.2°C), and Churu (47°C). Meanwhile, Najafgarh in Delhi recorded 46.8°C, Punjab's Amritsar witnessed 43.4°C, and Khargone and Khandwa in Madhya Pradesh recorded 45.5°C.

titles: Kolkata airport to suspend flight operations for 21 hrs from 12 pm tomorrow
descriptions: Kolkata airport has said that flight operations will be suspended for 21 hours from 12 pm tomorrow in view of heavy winds and heavy to very heavy rainfall predicted for the district due to Cyclone Remal. The cyclone is likely to make landfall along the adjoining coasts of West Bengal and Bangladesh around midnight tomorrow, as per the IMD.

titles: 20 killed in massive fire at gaming zone in Gujarat
descriptions: At least 20 people have been killed in a massive fire at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot, police said. "We are trying to retrieve as many bodies as possible. The gaming zone is owned by a person called Yuvraj Singh Solanki. We will be registering an offence for negligence and the deaths which have occurred," police added.

titles: 3 held after video of clash between groups goes viral in K'taka
descriptions: Three persons were arrested for their alleged involvement in a clash between members of two groups at Udupi in Karnataka and lethal weapons were seized from them, police said. This incident occurred at Kunjibettu junction on the Udupi-Manipal state highway on May 18 night. A resident shot a video and it has gone viral on social media.

titles: Businessman key suspect in MP’s murder: Bangladesh govt
descriptions: Bangladesh Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan has said businessman Akhtaruzzaman Shahin, who is believed to be in the US, is the key suspect in the murder of MP Anwarul Azim Anar. The ministry is collaborating with India and the US to apprehend and prosecute him. Khan said, "Of course, we are looking for Akhtaruzzaman Shahin."

titles: Pune car crash case: CCTV footage in teen's house tampered with
descriptions: The DVR of a CCTV camera recovered from the house of the teenage boy involved in the Pune Porsche crash case shows signs of tampering, according to the prosecution. The boy's grandfather was arrested on Saturday (May 25) for "wrongful confinement" of the family driver in the aftermath of the May 19 accident and was produced before a holiday court.

titles: Teen's family pressured driver in Porsche crash case, say police
descriptions: Pune Police Chief Amitesh Kumar said on Saturday (May 25) that the father and grandfather of the 17-year-old minor allegedly involved in the Porsche crash attempted to bribe their family driver with cash and gifts. Later, they reportedly threatened him to take the blame for the accident. The driver and his family will be given police protection, he said.

titles: Kejriwal snubs ex-Pakistan minister over support
descriptions: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal criticised former Pakistan minister Chaudhry Fawad Hussain on Saturday (May 25) after Hussain called for the defeat of "forces of hate and extremism" in the Lok Sabha elections. Kejriwal insisted that the polls are India's internal matter and stated that India will not tolerate interference by the "biggest sponsors of terrorism".

titles: 20 killed in Rajkot game zone fire
descriptions: 20 people, including children, died in a big fire at Rajkot's TRP game zone on Saturday evening. The fire started in a temporary structure during the summer vacation. Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel has ordered immediate rescue and relief operations. Efforts to control the fire and rescue those trapped are ongoing.

titles: Reservation to Muslims under OBC to be reviewed in Raj: Minister
descriptions: The BJP government in Rajasthan will review the reservation given to Muslims under the Other Backward Class (OBC) category, the state's Cabinet minister for Social Justice and Empowerment, Avinash Gehlot, said. "As part of its appeasement politics, Congress gave reservation to 14 Muslim castes under OBC category between 1997 and 2013. We [will review] all those circulars," he added.

titles: Tourists' car plunges into pond following Google Maps in Kerala
descriptions: The incident occurred when the four-member group, including a woman, were going towards Alappuzha. The road they were travelling on was covered by water overflowing from the stream due to heavy rains and since the tourists were unfamiliar with the area, they drove right into the water body while navigating using Google maps, police said.

titles: Phalodi records Rajasthan's highest temperature at 50°C: IMD
descriptions: Rajasthan is experiencing a severe heatwave. Phalodi recorded 50.0°C, the highest temperature, and Barmer recorded 48.8°C. Other cities like Jaisalmer, Bikaner, Churu, Jodhpur, Ganganagar, Kota, and Jaipur also reported very high temperatures. The heatwave continues in many areas. A slight drop in temperature is expected by the end of May.

titles: Young lineman dies due to electrocution in Telangana
descriptions: In a shocking incident, a lineman died due to electric shock on electric pole in Telangana's Sangareddy District. The incident was caught on camera and it can be seen in the video that the lineman died due to electric shock and the people are seen taking his dead body down from the pole after he died due to electrocution.

titles: 17 dead in Rajkot gaming zone fire
descriptions: Seventeen people including children were killed in a massive fire that broke out at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot city on Saturday evening (May 25), officials said. Efforts are underway to control the blaze and rescue those trapped inside. The blaze erupted at a temporary structure at the TRP Game Zone.

titles: Former BJP MLA Raghupathi Bhat expelled from the party
descriptions: Former MLA from Udupi and BJP leader, K. Raghupathi Bhat, has been expelled from the party. Bhat, who is contesting as an independent candidate from the South West Graduates Constituency after being denied a ticket by the BJP, has been suspended for six years. Just a few days ago, he was served a notice by the disciplinary committee.

titles: There'd be rare Agniveer unemployed, Rahul misleading people: Shah
descriptions: Home Minister Amit Shah has alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is 'misleading people' on Agniveer military recruitment scheme. Shah said that 25% of Agniveers would get permanent postings in Army, while reservations in state government and paramilitary forces would be given to the remaining 75%. There would be a rare Agniveer who would not be employed, he added.

titles: 4 including kids killed in massive fire at gaming zone in Gujarat
descriptions: At least four people including children were killed in a massive fire that broke out at a gaming zone in Gujarat's Rajkot city on Saturday, officials said, adding that the exact number of victims is not known. Efforts are underway to control the blaze and rescue those trapped. The blaze erupted at a temporary structure at the TRP game zone.

titles: Man books seats in train's AC coach, shows coach full of general passengers; govt responds
descriptions: A man, who booked eight seats in AC-3 of Brahmaputra Express, posted on social media after he found the coach full of general and ticketless passengers. The man said he could only access six seats, adding, "What's even the use of confirmed ticket." After his multiple tweets, the Railways Ministry tweeted, "Your complaint has been registered on RailMadad."

titles: Businessman key suspect in B'desh MP Anwarul's murder: Minister
descriptions: Bangladeshi Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan has claimed that a businessman, identified as Akhtaruzzaman Shahin, is the key suspect in murder of MP Anwarul Azim Anar, who was found dead in Kolkata on May 22. Khan added that the ministry was working with India and US to nab and put him on trial. Khan said the motive would be "revealed soon".

titles: Telangana schools to reopen on June 12 after summer vacation
descriptions: The Department of Education announced that schools in Telangana will reopen on June 12 for the 2024-2025 academic year. The year will have 229 working days, ending on April 23. Primary schools will run from 9 am to 4:15 pm, and high schools from 9:30 am to 4:45 pm. SSC Examinations are scheduled for March 2025.

titles: US envoy asks about B'luru dish he 'can't miss', DK Suresh replies
descriptions: US Ambassador to India Eric Garcetti in an X post asked people to tell him about a "must-see sight and one dish [he] absolutely can't miss" as he arrived in Bengaluru for a visit. Congress MP for Bengaluru Rural DK Suresh replied to him, saying, "Enjoy a crispy Masala Dose and soak in the beauty of the Vidhana Soudha!"

titles: Congress, RJD are cowards; I'm not like them: PM Modi
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi called Congress and RJD cowards, blaming them for past terrorist attacks due to weak leadership. He highlighted his strong action with surgical strikes against Pakistan. Modi praised Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's rule and warned against returning to "jungle raj" under RJD in the upcoming Bihar elections.

titles: 7 tribal girls raped in MP's Sidhi; 4 arrested
descriptions: In Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district, a man used a voice modulation app to pretend to be a female teacher and raped seven tribal girls. He promised scholarships to lure them and called them to a deserted place. After one girl reported it, the police arrested him and his helpers. A Special Investigation Team (SIT) is now investigating the case.

titles: Andhra police unearth Maoist explosives dump in forest in Sileru
descriptions: Andhra Pradesh police unearthed a Maoist explosives dump in a forest near Panaslabanda village under Sileru police station limits in Alluri Sitaramaraju district.The police said the dump was planted by a banned CPI (Maoist) party senior cadre with an intention to carry out attacks on police teams engaged in combing operations.

titles: Suspecting infidelity, man kills wife with axe in UP; arrested
descriptions: A man, Garibe Lal, was arrested for killing his wife, Kiran Devi on Friday, May 24. Allegedly suspecting her of infidelity, Garibe Lal attacked her with an axe in front of their children. Despite efforts to save her, Kiran succumbed to her injuries. Garibe Lal surrendered to the Mehmoodabad police station, facing charges filed by Kiran's father.

titles: Google Maps lands Hyderabad tourists in stream in Kerala
descriptions: Using Google maps to navigate resulted in a tourist group in Hyderabad driving into a stream swollen with water near Kuruppanthara in this south Kerala district. The group members are residents of Miyapur, according to police. A four-member group, Koushik, Yashwanth, Madhan and Abhi, all residents of Miyapur, were on the way to Alappuzha from Kottayam when the incident occurred.

titles: Attempt to create doubt: CEC Rajiv as SC rejects voter data plea
descriptions: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar has reacted to the Supreme Court dismissing a plea seeking the release of booth-wise voter turnout data on ECI's website within 48 hours of polling, saying, "An attempt is being made to create an atmosphere of doubt." He added that one day, the poll body will tell everyone how they are being "misled".

titles: How did Cyclone 'Remal' get its name?
descriptions: Cyclone 'Remal' is expected to make landfall and bring heavy rainfall to parts of Bangladesh and West Bengal on May 26. The cyclonic storm has been named 'Remal' by Oman. It is pronounced Re-Mal and it means 'sand' in Arabic. The RSMC New Delhi Tropical Cyclone Center is responsible for naming tropical cyclones over Bay of Bengal and Arabian Sea.

titles: Did PMO not inform MEA?: K'taka HM on Prajwal's passport issue
descriptions: Home Minister G Parameshwara, took a jab at the central government on Saturday, after the Ministry of External Affairs revealed that it had only received the state government request to revoke the diplomatic passport of absconding Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna on May 21. Following this, Karnataka Home Minister asked, "Did PMO not inform MEA?"

titles: Video shows men on bike stealing goods from moving truck in MP
descriptions: A video showing three men on a bike stealing goods from a moving truck on a highway in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur has surfaced online. In the video, two men can be seen on top of the truck as another follows on a bike. The state police have stated that similar incidents have been reported from Dewas and Tarana.

titles: What is election stress disorder?
descriptions: The term 'election stress disorder' was coined by US therapist Steven Stosny. The symptoms include refreshing social media repeatedly, reading news alerts and having a deep emotional reaction to polling. Separately, a study published in 2023 concluded that continuous exposure to political news may lead to fatigue. "This concept...reflects...experience of many people worldwide," an expert said.

titles: Which states saw highest and lowest voter turnouts in Lok Sabha polls today?
descriptions: West Bengal saw the highest estimated voter turnout of 77.99% in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha polls today till 5 pm, followed by Jharkhand (61.41%), Odisha (59.60%), Haryana (55.93%) and NCT of Delhi (53.73%). Bihar saw 52.24% voter turnout, while the voter turnout in Uttar Pradesh was 52.02%. The lowest estimated turnout was seen in J&K (51.35%).

titles: EC releases seat-wise vote data for first 5 phases
descriptions: The Election Commission released data on votes cast in the first five phases of the Lok Sabha elections, ensuring no changes in vote counts. This came after the Supreme Court refused to direct the EC to publish booth-wise turnout data. The EC will now include the exact number of voters for each constituency to improve transparency.

titles: Teen murders friend's sister after stealing ₹2,000 in B'luru
descriptions: The Bengaluru police have arrested a 14-year-old boy for the murder of a 20-year-old college student, R Prabuddha, in Brindavan Layout, Padmanabhanagar. The incident occurred on May 15, following a confrontation over stolen money. The 14-year-old boy, a friend of her younger brother, allegedly stole ₹2,000 from her purse to pay for a friend's broken spectacle.

titles: Couple burnt alive in car fire after collision in UP
descriptions: A couple, Akash Pal (23) and his wife Kirti (20), died in a car accident when their vehicle hit a tree and caught fire near Baghrai village on the Hardoi-Sandi road. This happened on Friday while they were returning from Sandi. The police are looking into the accident, which left the couple trapped in the burning car.

titles: PM Modi says Opposition performing 'mujra' for vote bank, sparks row
descriptions: Leaders of the I.N.D.I.A bloc criticised PM Narendra Modi for accusing the Opposition of performing "mujra" for vote bank. "Modiji, what is this state of mind? Why don't you take something?" Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera wrote on X. "Such cheap language," Trinamool Congress MP Saket Gokhale said. "Is this the language of a PM?" RJD's Manoj Jha stated.

titles: Chandigarh man gets ₹73,000 waste collection bill, says 'Used to pay ₹600/month'
descriptions: A Chandigarh resident received a bill of ₹72,900 for waste collection for a three-floor building he rented out to small traders. Sanjeev Grover said he used to receive a bill of ₹600/month earlier and had gotten a bill with a similar amount last year too, which was held back later. Chandigarh Mayor Kuldeep Kumar said he'll "certainly get it checked".

titles: 4 killed in a lorry-van collision in Karnataka's Chikkamagaluru
descriptions: Four people were killed in an accident near Banakal in Mudigere taluk on Saturday. A lorry collided with a van, and the car behind it hit the van. Four of the occupants of the van and car died, they were travelling from Dharmasthala to Holalkere. The lorry was going from Mudigere to Kottigehara.

titles: Kejriwal rebukes ex-Pak minister; rejects interference
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal criticised ex-Pakistan minister Chaudhry Fawad Hussain for commenting on India's Lok Sabha elections, saying it's an internal matter. Kejriwal emphasised that India won't tolerate interference from terrorism sponsors. Fawad shared Kejriwal's X post that was critical of BJP and wrote,"May peace and harmony defeat forces of hate and extremism."

titles: Three Kalaburagi devotees killed in accident near Ayodhya
descriptions: Three devotees from Kalaburagi died in a head-on collision between a lorry and a tempo near Ayodhya on Friday night. Several others sustained minor injuries. The accident occurred when a tempo carrying 22 members of the same family who were going to Ram Temple in Ayodhya after visiting Kashi Vishwanath in Varanasi collided with a lorry.

titles: BJP leader's convoy attacked in West Bengal during phase 6 polls
descriptions: Senior BJP leader Pranat Tudu said his convoy was attacked in Garbeta, West Midnapore. His security personnel were injured and taken to the hospital. Tudu claimed TMC supporters threw bricks at his car. TMC denied this and accused Tudu of disrupting the polling. Media vehicles were also damaged.

titles: 92 eateries offer up to 25% discounts to voters in Delhi today
descriptions: New Delhi Municipal Council has coordinated with 92 restaurants or stores to offer discounts of up to 25% to people who cast their votes today in the ongoing Lok Sabha elections. Sharing a list with the eateries' addresses, the civic body said, "Go vote and be...part of 'Chunav Ka Parv' and enjoy this delicious democracy discount from your favourite outlet."

titles: Driver bribed and threatened by teen's family in Pune crash case
descriptions: Pune police chief Amitesh Kumar said the father and grandfather of a 17-year-old involved in a Porsche crash tried to bribe and threaten their driver to take the blame. The driver was wrongly confined and pressured but now has police protection. Arrests were made, and two officers were suspended for not doing their duty.

titles: Heavy rainfall expected in Arunachal Pradesh: IMD
descriptions:
IMD forecasts heavy rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh from May 27th-29th, 2024. Residents urged caution as extremely heavy falls (>204.4 mm) 
 are expected on May 28th, increasing the risk of flash floods and landslides. Authorities have advised people to stay indoors, to avoid risky areas and also to prepare for emergency situations.

titles: Sixth arrest in the Bengaluru rave party case
descriptions: The Central Crime Branch sleuths, probing the rave party hosted at a farmhouse in Bengaluru, have apprehended one more person, taking the total arrests so far to six. Hailing from Hyderabad, he was among the organisers of the event, police sources said on Saturday, 25 May. The police are actively looking for the remaining accused.

titles: EC releases absolute number of voters for 5 phases amid turnout data row
descriptions: The Election Commission on Saturday released the absolute number of voters for all five phases where voting has been completed amid the ongoing Lok Sabha elections. On Friday, the SC refused to entertain a plea asking EC to publish booth-wise voter turnout data. "The process of collection and storage of votes polled is rigorous, transparent and participative," EC said.

titles: Delhi records 44% voter turnout till 3 pm in Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: Delhi recorded a voter turnout of 44.58% till 3 pm in sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections, in which Delhi's all seven parliamentary constituencies are voting. North-east Delhi recorded the highest voter turnout at 47.85%, while New Delhi recorded the lowest voter turnout at 42.17%. BJP's Manoj Tiwari and Congress' Kanhaiya Kumar are among the key candidates in the fray.

titles: 'EVMs have BJP tags', says TMC & shares pics; EC issues statement
descriptions: The Trinamool Congress alleged on Saturday that five EVMs in Bankura's Raghunathpur had BJP tags on them and accused the BJP of tampering with the machines. It also shared pictures of the EVMs. Subsequently, EC said that during commissioning, common address tags were signed by candidates and since only BJP's representative was present his signature was taken.

titles: Influencer who made fake rap video of Pune teen boasting about Porsche crash booked
descriptions: Influencer Aryan Neekhra was booked for allegedly making a rap video on Porsche crash incident in Pune. The video had gone viral on social media, with several claiming that it showed the accused teenager boasting about the accident after his bail. A case has been registered under Sections 509, 294 B of IPC and 67 of IT Act, police said.

titles: Google Maps drives tourists from Hyderabad into pond in Kerala
