descriptions: A tourist group from Hyderabad drove into a pond near Kurupunthura early Saturday, following Google Maps. Heavy rain had submerged the road, leading the unfamiliar travellers into the water. They escaped through the back glass of the vehicle. Locals noted this is a recurring issue due to the lack of warning signs on the road.

titles: Mob attacks police station over man who allegedly died in custody
descriptions: As many as 11 police personnel were injured after a mob mostly relatives of a man who was apprehended by the police and later allegedly died in police custody tried to enter Channagiri police station in Karnataka. They pelted stones at the station on Friday night. In the incident, 10 police vans were also damaged.

titles: Pramod Sawant congratulates first Goan to climb Mount Everest
descriptions: Goa's Chief Minister Pramod Sawant proudly announced that Pankaj Narvekar is the first Goan to climb Mount Everest. He congratulated Pankaj, wishing him a bright future. Sawant believes this achievement will inspire young mountaineers in the state to pursue their dreams and reach new heights.

titles: Scam victim files complaint against fake overseas company
descriptions: A case has been lodged at the cyber police station of the city by an individual who fell victim to an online scam perpetrated by a fake overseas employment company. The victim reported the incident after realizing they had been misled. Victim transferred ₹36.34 lakh in multiple installments for various purported fees

titles: Hyderabadi tourists drive into Kerala stream due to Google maps
descriptions: Using Google Maps to navigate resulted in a tourist group from Hyderabad driving into a swollen stream near Kuruppanthara in this south Kerala district, police said on Saturday, 25 May. All four managed to escape due to the efforts of a nearby police patrolling unit and local residents, but their vehicle was completely submerged.

titles: MIG-29 UPG of IAF receives Made in India engines
descriptions: 15 RD33 series engines have been delivered within a month of signing a contract with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) for the MiG-29UPG program. The contract, valued at ₹5,300 crore, signifies a major step towards modernizing the IAF fighter jets.The RD33 engines are expected to enhance the performance and lifespan of the MiG-29UPG aircraft.

titles: Haryana MLA Daultabad dies of cardiac arrest, PM condoles demise
descriptions: Rakesh Daultabad, an Independent MLA from Haryana's Badshahpur Assembly, passed away after suffering cardiac arrest on Saturday morning. The legislator is survived by his wife and two sons. PM Narendra Modi expressed condolences on his demise and said, "With his hard work and dedication, Daultabad had created a distinct identity among the people at a very young age."

titles: Phase 6 voter turnout at 49.2% till 3PM, Bengal leads with 70.19%
descriptions: The sixth phase of the Lok Sabha elections saw a 49.2% voter turnout by 3 pm, according to the Election Commission. West Bengal had the highest turnout at 70.19%, followed by Jharkhand at 54.34%. Important seats include New Delhi, Azamgarh, and Anantnag-Rajouri. 889 candidates are competing in states like Bihar, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh.

titles: Why is World Thyroid Day observed?
descriptions: World Thyroid Day is celebrated annually on May 25 to create awareness about the significance of the thyroid gland. The thyroid gland is a small gland located at the neck's base and produces two hormones, thyroxine and triiodothyronine, crucial for normal body functions like metabolism. Thyroid disorders arise when the gland produces either insufficient or excessive amounts of these hormones.

titles: Cyclone Remal to make landfall tomorrow, heavy rainfall warning issued for several states
descriptions: Cyclone Remal is predicted to make landfall between Bangladesh and West Bengal coasts around May 26 midnight. Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning has been issued for West Bengal, Odisha, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Mizoram, Tripura, Manipur, Assam, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland from May 26-28. Rainfall is also likely over Lakshadweep, Kerala, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Telangana.

titles: Elderly woman rescued from flooded home by Kadri Fire Services
descriptions: In a commendable act of bravery and swift response, the Kadri Fire and Emergency services rescued an elderly bedridden woman from her flooded home on Sagar Court Road in Kottara Chowki during the early hours of Saturday. She expressed heartfelt gratitude to the fire department for their prompt action, despite difficulties in reaching the local corporator.

titles: 27 Vizag youths trafficked to Cambodia return home
descriptions: Nearly 27 youngsters from Visakhapatnam trafficked to Cambodia reached home on Friday, May 24. Three persons were arrested for luring over 150 local youth by promising jobs in Cambodia. In reality, they were trafficked to be sold over to Chinese operators in Cambodia. They were tortured and confined to work in dark rooms to carry out cybercrime and ponzi schemes.

titles: Wheat procurement for RMS 2024-25 surpasses last year’s total
descriptions: Wheat procurement for RMS 2024-25 has reached 262.48 LMT, surpassing last year's total and benefiting 22.31 lakh farmers with an MSP outflow of ₹59,715 crores. Major contributions came from Punjab, Haryana, and other states. Combined wheat and rice stocks now exceed 600 LMT, ensuring ample supply for welfare schemes and market needs.

titles: EC gives nod to Telangana Formation Day celebrations on June 2
descriptions: With the EC giving the go-ahead, preparations begin for Telangana Formation Day celebrations on June 2. They will be on a major scale since it would be Revanth Reddy dispensation’s first state formation day fete. Apart from inviting Sonia Gandhi, the government may announce "Jaya Jayahe Telangana" by poet Ande Sri as the state’s anthem and unveil its new logo.

titles: Man dies after being run over by private water tanker
descriptions: In a tragic incident in Amruthahalli, north Bengaluru, a 50-year-old man lost his life after being run over by a private water tanker on Thursday night. The Hebbal traffic police took immediate action by detaining the 20-year-old driver, Hussain Bhasha, impounding the vehicle, and issuing a notice to the tanker owner.

titles: Auto driver attacked after allegedly molesting a woman in B'luru
descriptions: A troubling occurrence occurred in Bengaluru involving a 55-year-old autorickshaw driver who, according to police officials, had molested a 21-year-old woman before being struck with a sharp object. Though it happened on May 4, the incident didn’t come to light until Friday. He has also been accused of sexual harassment under IPC Section 354A.

titles: 1 killed, 6 injured in blast at explosives factory in Chhattisgarh
descriptions: One person was killed and six were injured in a blast at an explosives manufacturing factory in Chhattisgarh's Bemetara district on Saturday, officials said. The rubble of the building is being removed to look for missing people. Meanwhile, Chhattisgarh CM Vishnu Deo Sai announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh to the family of the deceased and ₹50,000 for injured persons.

titles: Mild earthquake of magnitude 3.5 strikes Assam
descriptions: The National Center for Seismology reported a 3.5 magnitude earthquake in Karbi Anglong, Assam, on May 25, 2024, at 05:25:52 IST. The quake's coordinates were 25.85 N latitude and 93.47 E longitude, with a depth of 10 km. Residents are reminded to stay vigilant and informed about earthquake preparedness.

titles: Ex-S'pore PM's brother to pay ₹1.2 cr to Indian-origin ministers
descriptions: Singapore High Court has instructed Lee Hsien Yang, brother of former PM Lee Hsien Loong, to pay ₹1.2 crore each to Indian-origin ministers K Shanmugam and Vivian Balakrishnan for defaming them. Both the ministers initiated lawsuits over Lee's Facebook comments, alleging corruption in their rental of state properties. Lee claimed they received preferential treatment from Singapore Land Authority.

titles: BJP asks Odisha DGP to 'free CM from aide's clutches', CM reacts
descriptions: Odisha BJP has alleged that CM Naveen Patnaik is being held hostage by his close aide VK Pandian and urged the state DGP to "free" Patnaik from Pandian's "clutches". Reacting to this, Patnaik said, "There's a limit to the...lies...BJP can tell...I'm in very good health and I've been campaigning...all over the state." Pandian called BJP's claims "below the belt".

titles: How can heatwaves impact Indian economy?
descriptions: A reduction in water reservoir levels due to heatwaves can impact access to water for agricultural activity, experts said. This can make vegetables costlier and increase food inflation, which may influence RBI's monetary policies, they said. Heatwaves also reduce workforce's productivity, impact construction activity, increase pressure on power grids, affect crop yields and reduce rural incomes.

titles: Reel falsely claims PM Modi's govt hasn't incorporated any PSEs
descriptions: An Instagram Reel has falsely claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government hasn't incorporated any public sector enterprises (PSEs) since 2014. The video also falsely claims that PM Modi has privatised (or disinvested from) 23 PSEs in the last 10 years. The BJP-led government has actually disinvested from 179 PSEs since 2014 and has incorporated 82 central PSEs from 2014-2020.

titles: Man critical as speeding car hits, throws him 20-ft in air in Raj
descriptions: A man received critical injuries after a speeding car hit him while he was crossing a road in Rajasthan's Dholpur district on Wednesday. A video of the incident has surfaced online in which the man can be seen being thrown 20 feet into the air after being hit by the vehicle. Police have launched a hunt for the car's driver.

titles: Don’t cut roadside trees for commercial reasons: Kerala HC
descriptions: Kerala High Court has directed the government not to cut roadside trees merely because they obstruct commercial activities. It said trees can be cut and removed only if damaged and pose a danger to public safety. A committee on regulating felling and disposal of trees on government lands should take a final decision, it said.

titles: Delhi CM votes with family, urges support against 'dictatorship'
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his family voted in the sixth phase of the general elections. Kejriwal, with his wife and children, helped his sick father to the polling station. He urged voters to support democracy and fight against unemployment and dictatorship. AAP leaders Atishi, Saurabh Bharadwaj, and Kailash Gehlot also voted.

titles: Karnataka Deputy CM orders testing of drinking water in Bengaluru
descriptions: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has issued directives to Bengaluru water supply and civic authorities to urgently test and rectify the quality of drinking water in the city. This action follows several instances of water contamination and reported cases of cholera in the state.

titles: EVM's battery down in morning, waited 50mins to vote: Brinda Karat
descriptions: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat criticised ECI, claiming that the battery of the EVM control unit at her polling booth in Delhi was down and she waited for around 50 minutes to cast her vote. "If the machine's battery is down early in the morning, imagine what's the condition of the ECI," she said. She added that she wrote a complaint.

titles: Video falsely claims that Delhi power subsidy will be discontinued
descriptions: An old video is going viral, falsely showing Delhi minister and AAP leader Atishi claiming that the electricity subsidy scheme of the Delhi government will soon be discontinued. However, the original video, from April 2023, shows Atishi saying that Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena is not returning the file regarding the subsidy scheme. Saxena had countered Atishi's claims.

titles: 4 held for filming girl being raped, circulating video in Andhra
descriptions: Andhra Pradesh Police arrested four persons under POCSO Act on Friday, May 24, for filming the alleged rape of a minor girl by a juvenile and circulating the video. The incident allegedly took place on May 15, but came to light recently, leading to the arrests. The boy was sent to a juvenile home while the arrested men were remanded.

titles: Video shows gang war involving 2 cars and 6 men in K'taka; man run over
descriptions: A man sustained injuries in a fight over a financial dispute between two gangs involving two cars and six men in Karnataka. According to police, two of them have been arrested, while four are absconding. In the video taken by a resident of a high-rise near the road where the fight happened, one car is seen running over a man.

titles: Man uses voice-changing app to pose as female teacher, rapes 7 tribal girls in MP
descriptions: A man has been arrested for allegedly raping at least seven tribal girls in Sidhi, Madhya Pradesh, after contacting them by posing as a female teacher using a voice-changing app. Two other men who assisted him by providing the phone number of the first victim have also been arrested. All the victims belong to financially weak families, police said.

titles: US ambassador aims to establish consulate in Bengaluru
descriptions: In an announcement on Friday, US Ambassador to India Eric Garcetti expressed his commitment to establishing a US consulate in Bengaluru within the next year. Garcetti revealed that during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s state visit to the US, both Modi and President Joe Biden agreed to open two additional consulates in India, with one slated for Bengaluru.

titles: K'taka HM responds to BJP's allegation of 'Udta Bengaluru'
descriptions: Karnataka’s Home Minister G Parameshwara refuted claims by the BJP that Bengaluru is becoming “Udta Bengaluru” due to alleged narcotics and rave parties. This comes after the opposition criticised the Congress government for a perceived deterioration in law and order. This comes after police raided a farmhouse in Bengaluru and busted a rave party.

titles: Dy CM unveils five-point programme for B'luru’s infrastructure
descriptions: In a recent statement, Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar unveiled a comprehensive five-point programme to address infrastructural challenges in Bengaluru. The programme focuses on key areas including drinking water, pothole filling, widening the property tax net, property tax collection, and clearance of encroachments on water resources.

titles: Teen couple in TN ends life after parents object to relationship
descriptions: A teenage couple in Chennai, both of whom had recently appeared for their class 10 examinations, walked into the sea off Thiruvottiyur coast on Friday with their hands tied together with a shawl and ended their lives after their parents objected to the relationship. The two, aged 15, had been in love for more than two years.

titles: Cyclone Remal expected to graze Kolkata on Sunday
descriptions: Cyclone Remal is expected to graze Kolkata after making landfall between Sagar Island and Khepupara on the Bengal-Bangladesh coast around midnight on Sunday. The city could experience up to 200 mm of rainfall and wind gusts reaching 100 kmph within the 24-hour period following the impact of the cyclone on the coast.

titles: Handle your country 1st: Kejriwal to ex-Pak minister Fawad over Lok Sabha polls' remark
descriptions: PTI leader and ex-Pakistan minister Fawad Chaudhry commented on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's picture, which he shared after voting in the Lok Sabha elections. "May peace and harmony defeat forces of hate and extremism," Chaudhry wrote. Responding to him, Kejriwal asked him to handle Pakistan first. "India won't tolerate interference from the biggest sponsors of terrorism," the AAP leader added.

titles: HAL delivers Dhruv helicopters to army within 2 weeks of contract
descriptions: HAL has delivered indigenously-developed ALH Dhruv Mk3 utility helicopters to the Indian Army. The contract for a total of 25 Dhruv Mk3 helicopters was signed in mid-March 2024. Demonstrating impressive production efficiency, HAL delivered the first six helicopters within a remarkably short timeframe by the end of March 2024, just two weeks after the contract signing.

titles: Why are ASHA workers discontent despite Ayushman Bharat inclusion?
descriptions: In February-March 2024, Uttar Pradesh saw state-wide protests by ASHA workers. They claimed that the Ayushman Bharat scheme failed to address their longstanding demands of a fixed salary and social security, instead offering cashless medical services up to ₹5 lakh. As the announcement came ahead of the general elections, an ASHA worker noted their inclusion as "too little, too late."

titles: Hotel where PM stayed in K'taka claims ₹80 lakh bill not settled
descriptions: A hotel in Mysuru, where PM Narendra Modi stayed during his visit in April 2023, has claimed that ₹80.6 lakh bill is pending and threatened legal action if it is not cleared by June 1, a report said. A government official said the state government rebuffed the Centre's directive to clear the bill as it was a Central government programme.

titles: I will win thrice or even 7 times, I've blessings of people: PM
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi in an interview with ANI said that he might win the Lok Sabha elections for the BJP seven times as he has the blessings of 140 crore people of India. PM Modi said, "Modi will win thrice, five times or even seven times." He added, "I've...blessings of 140 crore people of India so this will go on."

titles: J&K records 35.22% voter turnout till 1 pm in Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: The Anantnag-Rajouri constituency in Jammu and Kashmir recorded an overall voter turnout of 35.22% till 1 pm, as reported by the Election Commission of India (ECI) on Saturday. Meanwhile, Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief and candidate from Anantnag-Rajouri, Mehbooba Mufti, alleged that her party workers and polling agents were being unlawfully detained and protested outside police station.

titles: Acclaimed filmmaker Morgan Spurlock dies at 53
descriptions: Renowned filmmaker Morgan Spurlock, best known for his groundbreaking documentary 'Super Size Me', has passed away at the age of 53 due to complications from cancer. His family confirmed his death in New York on Thursday, surrounded by loved ones. Morgan Spurlock leaves behind a super-sized legacy in the world of documentary filmmaking.

titles: Rameshwaram Cafe, Bahubali Kitchen in Hyderabad violate norms
descriptions: Telangana food safety officials found several hygiene violations during inspections at The Rameshwaram Cafe and Bahubali Kitchen in the Madhapur area of Hyderabad on Thursday, May 23. The violations included the presence of expired products, unlabelled food items, pest infestation and synthetic colours. The officials put up these details on social media sites to make people aware.

titles: Infant injured in drunk driving incident critical in Nagpur
descriptions: In Nagpur's Mahal area, an inebriated driver hit a woman, her son, and a three-month-old infant, leaving them injured and the baby critically hurt. Locals caught and assaulted the fleeing driver before police arrest. Alcohol was found in the car, and the driver is being questioned.

titles: PM Modi urges maximum voter turnout for 6th phase of Elections
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged voters to participate actively in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections, emphasizing the importance of every vote. He made a special appeal to women and young voters, stating, "Democracy flourishes with active public participation. I request mothers, sisters, daughters, and young voters to exercise their franchise in large numbers."

titles: Man scares college students with car stunts in Noida, fined
descriptions: A 25-year-old Delhi man has been arrested over imperilling pedestrian safety by reckless driving on a road in Noida, police said. In a video, he can be seen driving an SUV on a street near Amity University and braking close to college students. He has been charged with violating road traffic regulations and fined ₹35,000. The vehicle has been impounded.

titles: Jharkhand records 42.54% voter turnout till 1 pm in LS polls
descriptions: Jharkhand has recorded a voter turnout of 42.54% till 1 pm in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha polls on Saturday. The highest voter turnout was recorded in Giridih at 45.82%, followed by Jamshedpur at 43.44%. On the other hand, Jharkhand's capital Ranchi recorded 41.83% voter turnout with the lowest in Dhanbad at 39.83%.

titles: UP sees 37% voter turnout in 6th phase of Lok Sabha polls till 1 pm
descriptions: The voter turnout till 1 pm in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday was recorded at 37.23%, Election Commission data shows. The sixth phase of the seven-phased Lok Sabha elections is currently underway. The key candidates include BJP's Maneka Gandhi, SP's Rambhual Nishad, BSP's Udraj Verma and actor Dinesh Lal Yadav alias Nirahua, who is fighting on a BJP ticket.

titles: KGF-inspired serial killer who murdered sleeping watchmen gets life term in MP
descriptions: Shivprasad Dhurve, a serial killer who said the 'KGF' movie inspired him, has been sentenced to life imprisonment in Madhya Pradesh, a special prosecutor said on Friday. He killed at least four security guards sleeping while on duty in 2022. He reportedly told the police officers who caught him that he did not like people sleeping on duty.

titles: Kerala to introduce medical audit to deal with negligence cases
descriptions: In the wake of several complaints of medical negligence against state-run hospitals, the Kerala government on Friday, May 25, said it will introduce medical audit in all of its hospitals to investigate such cases. A government hospital doctor was recently suspended for allegedly operating on the tongue of a child instead of surgically removing her sixth finger.

titles: Anasuya Sengupta wins first Cannes best actress award for India
descriptions: Anasuya Sengupta made history as the first Indian actor to win Best Actress at Cannes 2024 for 'The Shameless.' Her acceptance speech highlighted marginalized communities. Shyam Benegal's 'Manthan' was also screened. Indian films and actors received numerous nominations and awards, marking a significant global presence.

titles: Foreign Minister Jaishankar receives certificate for voting
descriptions: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar cast his ballot in Delhi during the sixth phase of the Lok Sabha elections, becoming the first male voter at his polling booth. Confident in the BJP's return to power, he urged citizens to vote, calling it a decisive moment for the country. Votes will be counted on June 4.

titles: MEA  serves show-cause notice to Prajwal for diplomatic passport
descriptions: The Ministry of External Affairs has served a show-cause notice on suspended JD(S) MP Prajwal Revanna asking why his diplomatic passport should not be cancelled as sought by the Karnataka government in view of allegations of sexual abuse against him, people familiar with the matter said on Friday, 24 May. Currently, he is believed to be in Germany.

titles: BBMP and local body elections post Lok Sabha polls: Siddaramaiah
descriptions: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday, 24 May, said the process to hold the local body elections including the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will start soon after the Lok Sabha poll process ends. He said the delimitation of wards has happened and reservation of wards will be the next step.

titles: Sibal urges SC to direct EC to preserve EVM logs for 2-3 years
descriptions: Kapil Sibal urged the Supreme Court to direct EC to store EVM logs for 2-3 years and declare the records of every phase of voting before counting so that no member is elected “illegally”. Sibal suggested that if EC cannot upload Form 17C, which reveals number of votes polled in a polling station, state electoral officers could upload the data.

titles: Pune teen's grandfather told me 'If you talk about this, remember...': Family driver
descriptions: The grandfather of the 17-year-old Pune teen allegedly told the family driver to take the blame for the accident. "He first called me up and shouted at me over the phone. Then, he forcibly took me to their bungalow in their BMW car," the driver has said. "He told me, 'If you talk to anyone about this, remember...'," he added.

titles: Haryana records 36% voter turnout till 1 pm in Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: Haryana witnessed voter turnout of 36.48% till 1 pm in the ongoing Lok Sabha polls. Of all 10 parliamentary constituencies of the state that are voting in the sixth phase of the polls, Gurgaon recorded the lowest turnout at 30.59%, followed by Faridabad, at 33.92%, and Hisar, at 34.99%. Sirsa recorded the highest voter turnout (40.84%), followed by Kurukshetra (40.06%).

titles: Odisha sees 35.7% voter turnout till 1 pm in 6th phase of LS polls
descriptions: Odisha recorded 35.69% voter turnout till 1 pm in the six parliamentary constituencies (Cuttack, Puri, Sambalpur, Dhenkanal, Keonjhar, Bhubaneswar) that have gone to polls in the sixth phase of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. A total of 64 candidates are contesting in this phase. Voting is also underway for 42 assembly seats in the state.

titles: Delhi sees 34% voter turnout till 1 pm in Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: Delhi recorded voter turnout of 34.37% till 1:00 pm in the sixth phase of the Lok Sabha polls, in which all seven parliamentary constituencies of Delhi are voting. North-east Delhi recorded the highest voter turnout at 37.31%, followed by North-west Delhi (35.72%) and East Delhi (34.24%). New Delhi recorded the lowest voter turnout at 31.66%, followed by Chandni Chowk (32.18%).

titles: Out on bail, Kejriwal casts vote in Lok Sabha polls; shares pic
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who was given interim bail, cast his vote in Delhi on Saturday in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections. Sharing a picture, he wrote, "I voted today with my father, wife and children...My mother is very ill...She could not go...I voted against dictatorship, unemployment and inflation." All seven seats of Delhi went to polls today.

titles: WB sees 54.80% turnout till 1 pm as voting underway for 8 LS seats
descriptions: The eight seats in West Bengal where polling is being held in the sixth phase of the Lok Sabha elections recorded a voter turnout of 54.80% till 1 pm on Saturday. The eight seats are - Tamluk, Ghatal, Kanthi, Jhargram, Medinipur, Purulia, Bankura and Bishnupur. BJP's Abhijit Gangopadhyay and TMC's Debangshu Bhattacharya are among the key candidates in the fray.

titles: New arrest made in Bengaluru's Rameshwaram Cafe blast case
descriptions: Three days after the interstate raid, on May 24, 2024, the National Investigation Agency (NIA) detained another suspect in the Bengaluru Rameshwaram Cafe bomb case. This is the fifth arrest in the case by the investigation agency. The blast at Rameshwaram Cafe in Bengaluru's Brookfield area occurred on March 1, leaving ten individuals injured.

titles: Bengal hits 36.88% voter turnout by 11 AM, Jharkhand at 27.80%
descriptions: West Bengal saw a 36.88% voter turnout by 11 am in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections, followed by Jharkhand at 27.80%. Other states like Bihar (23.67%), Haryana (22.09%), Jammu and Kashmir (23.11%), Delhi (21.69%), Odisha (21.30%), and Uttar Pradesh (27.06%) also participated. Voting continues across 58 constituencies in six states and two UTs.

titles: Stalin asks Centre to drop Kerala’s new Mullaperiyar dam proposal
descriptions: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin wrote to the Centre objecting to the environment ministry considering the Kerala government’s proposal of a new dam in Mullaperiyar. He sought the intervention of the Environment Ministry as the idea was against the directions of the Supreme Court. He also wants discussions dropped on the proposed Environment Impact Assessment on May 28.

titles: Former TN DGP Rajesh Das held after estranged wife’s complaint
descriptions: Former Tamil Nadu special DGP Rajesh Das was arrested on Friday, May 24, for trespass and intimidation based on a complaint by his estranged wife, Beela Venkatesan. Venkatesan, the state energy secretary, had alleged that Das and his associates had trespassed into her house at Thaiyur on the outskirts of Chennai on May 18 after assaulting the security guard.

titles: Tourists drive into stream while using Google maps, their car sinks in Kerala
descriptions: A car carrying four Hyderabad-based tourists submerged in a stream full of water in Kottayam, Kerala, police said on Saturday. Since the tourists were unfamiliar with the area, they drove right into the water body while navigating using Google maps, police said. All four of them, including a woman, were rescued with the help of police patrolling unit and locals.

titles: BMC announces 5% water cut in Mumbai from May 30
descriptions: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a water cut in Mumbai due to low water reserves. According to the civic body, the water cut will start with a 5% reduction from Thursday, May 30, and escalating to a 10% reduction from Wednesday, June 5. "The water cut will remain in force till satisfactory rainfall is received," BMC said.

titles: Mysuru hotel threatens legal action for unpaid bills of PM's stay
descriptions: A Mysuru hotel, where PM Modi stayed during his visit to the city in April last year, has threatened legal action as bills amounting to over ₹80 lakh have yet to be cleared by the State Forest Department. The hotel management has threatened legal action if the dues are not settled by June 1.

titles: Minor's grandfather arrested in Pune Porsche crash case
descriptions: The Pune Police Crime Branch arrested the grandfather of a minor involved in a car crash that killed two IT professionals. The grandfather, Surendra Kumar Agarwal, and his son Vishal are charged with forcing their driver to take the blame. The minor is currently in an observation home and may be tried as an adult.

titles: Anasuya Sengupta: Meet the first Indian to win best actress Cannes
descriptions: Anasuya Sengupta has created history as she became the first Indian to win a top acting award at the Cannes Film Festival. Anasuya took home the Best Actress award at the Un Certain Regard segment of Cannes for her role in The Shameless, a film by Bulgarian director Konstantin Bojanov. The movie also features Indian actress Mita Vashisht.

titles: Wild elephant kills elderly man outside house in Tamil Nadu
descriptions: A wild elephant killed an 84-year-old man in the Nilgiris on Friday, May 24, police said. The incident occurred near Gudalur in the district early Friday. Palani was attacked when he ventured outside his house. The elephant also damaged two cars in the vicinity, they added. On Tuesday, a rogue elephant had killed a farmer in Erode district.

titles: 16-yr-old taken into custody in BBA student murder case in B'luru
descriptions: The Bengaluru South Police have taken a 16-year-old into custody in connection with the murder of a 20-year-old BBA student at her residence on May 15, initially disguised as suicide. This marks a significant development in the ongoing investigation, seeking justice for the victim and her family.

titles: Man dies as phone explodes while charging in Assam
descriptions: In a tragic incident, Amarjyoti Tide, a commando hailing from Assam's Sivasagar district, lost his life on Friday when his mobile phone exploded while he was using it during charging. Tide, who had served for a year and a half, was stationed in Cachar district and deployed at the second commando battalion camp in Hailakandi.

titles: Decline in fish caught in Dakshin Kannada due to climate change
descriptions: The Dakshina Kannada district has witnessed a significant decline in annual fish catch due to the adverse effects of climate change. According to the Dakshina Kannada Fisheries Department, the total fish production for the fiscal year 2023-24 has plummeted to 1.8 lakh metric tonnes, marking a staggering 43% decrease compared to the previous year.

titles: How did cyclone Remal get its name?
descriptions: Cyclone Remal, the first of the pre-monsoon season in the Bay of Bengal, is named after the Arabic word for 'sand.' This name, suggested by Oman and chosen as per the Indian Ocean region's naming convention, reflects the potential impact of the cyclone, evoking the image of sand's abrasive force and widespread dispersion.

titles: Lizard found in mid-day meal after 100 students fall ill in Bihar
descriptions: Around 100 children have fallen ill and have been admitted to the hospital after they consumed their school's mid-day meal in Bihar's Aurangabad on Friday. As per reports, the children began vomiting and experiencing stomach pain immediately after consuming the meal. Upon inspection of the food, a dead lizard was found in the rice container.

titles: 57-year-old tailor arrested for impregnating minor in Mumbai
descriptions: Police in Mumbai have detained a 57-year-old tailor from the city's eastern suburbs for allegedly raping and impregnating a 15-year-old girl, they said on Friday. The tailor reportedly threatened the woman, warning her not to reveal the assault to her family members. The situation finally came to light when her family discovered the girl was pregnant.

titles: I am indestructible: PM Modi on Mamata's 'expiry date' remark
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi responded to TMC chief Mamata Banerjee's jibe that BJP's government will expire on June 4. PM Modi said, "She's speaking the truth...After the elections, a new government will be formed and we'll form it." On being remarked that Banerjee would then set a "new expiry date", PM Modi said, "I'm indestructible. I'm from Kashi. Kashi is indestructible."

titles: Rare Indian banknotes that survived 1918 shipwreck to be auctioned in London
descriptions: A pair of rare ₹10 banknotes that were recovered as they floated away from a shipwreck on their way from 'Bombay' to London in 1918 will be auctioned next week. The notes, signed and stamped in 'Calcutta', are estimated to fetch between GBP 2,000 and 2,600. The amount on the note is written in Indian languages, including Hindi and Bengali.

titles: Bengaluru teen confesses to killing friend's sister for ₹2000
descriptions: A female college student was killed on May 15 by her brother's 15-year-old friend when she inquired about money missing from her purse. The now-arrested boy allegedly stole ₹2,000 from the woman and killed her when she threatened to complain to the police. The 20-year-old victim, Prabhuddha, was discovered at her home with a slit on her throat.

titles: Mufti claims police detained polling agents, stages protest in J&K
descriptions: Amid the ongoing voting for the Anantnag–Rajouri Lok Sabha seat in J&K, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti staged a sit-in protest, claiming that PDP's polling agents have been detained "without any reason". Mufti, a candidate from Anantnag–Rajouri seat, said complaints regarding efforts to "tamper EVMs" are being received. She further claimed that outgoing calls on her mobile number have been suspended.

titles: Women voters surpass men in Rae Bareli and Amethi Lok Sabha polls
descriptions: Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli and Amethi went to polls on May 20, and women voters appeared at polling stations in large numbers, surpassing male voters. In Rae Bareli, 5.23 lakh women went out to vote, as compared to 5.13 lakh male voters. In a positive trend, 61.42% of women voted in Rae Bareli as compared to 58.1% in 2019.

titles: UP man jailed for slitting wife’s womb to check baby’s gender
descriptions: The fast-track court of Additional District and Sessions Judge Saurabh Saxena punished a man with life imprisonment for slitting the womb of his 8-month pregnant wife. Panna Lal, 46, had attacked his wife Anita Devi with a sickle in the Civil Lines region of Badaun district, Uttar Pradesh, to determine the gender of their child.

titles: Shabbir Ali accuses PM Modi of misleading people on Muslim quota
descriptions: Telangana Government adviser Mohammed Ali Shabbir accused PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah of making misleading statements about Muslim reservations to create communal tension. He said he had written an open letter to PM Modi, a copy of which he shared with the media at a press conference at the Secretariat.

titles: No Namaaz on roads: MP CM Mohan Yadav to officials amid LS polling
descriptions: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav Road while addressing law and order after a meeting with police officials on Friday said that roads are not for religious work. He added that namaaz and other religious events should not be held on road or roadside. The statement comes at the time when Lok Sabha voting is underway in some states.

titles: Rahul, Sonia Gandhi take selfie after casting their votes in Delhi
descriptions: Congress' Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi took a selfie after casting their votes in New Delhi constituency for the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections. AAP and Congress are contesting the polls in Delhi as partners in the I.N.D.I.A bloc. Notably, AAP's Somnath Bharti is contesting from the New Delhi seat, while Congress hasn't fielded a candidate from the seat.

titles: Jaishankar mistakenly reaches wrong polling booth to cast his vote in Delhi
descriptions: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar arrived at the wrong polling booth in Delhi on Saturday to cast his vote in sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections. He arrived at Atal Adarsh Vidyalaya but was told it was not his booth, following which he rushed out. Upon reaching his designated booth, he became the first male voter to cast his vote.

titles: Pune teen's grandfather, who confined driver and forced him to take blame, arrested
descriptions: The grandfather of a 17-year-old Pune boy, who crashed his Porsche killing two people, has been arrested after the family's driver alleged he confined him and forced him to take the blame for the accident, reports said. The teen's father was arrested earlier this week. The driver also said that the father ordered him to let the teen drive.

titles: Indian-origin truck driver who killed 16 in accident to be deported
descriptions: An Indian-origin truck driver who caused a bus crash in Canada that killed 16 members and injured 13 others of a junior hockey team in 2018 has been ordered to be deported to India. Jaskirat Singh Sidhu, a truck driver from Calgary, had driven through a stop sign and into the path of the hockey team's bus.

titles: Men who used voice change app to rape 7 college girls arrested
descriptions: Three men have been arrested for allegedly raping seven college girls in the Sidhi district of Madhya Pradesh. The accused men would change their voice via the Magic Voice app and call the girls, pretending to be their teacher Ranjana. All girls belong to ST category. The number of the victims is expected to increase as the investigation proceeds.

titles: Jaishankar becomes 1st male voter at Delhi booth, gets certificate
descriptions: External Affairs Minister (EAM) Dr S Jaishankar cast his vote in Delhi for the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections on Saturday. Jaishankar, who happened to be the first male voter at his designated polling booth, also got a certificate for the same. He also expressed his confidence that the voters of Delhi would once again support the BJP government.

titles: What's NHCX, single under-trial platform for health insurance claims?
descriptions: National Health Claims Exchange (NHCX) is a platform which is reportedly being tested to centralise health insurance settlements. NHCX is reportedly being developed by National Health Authority and insurance regulator IRDAI. About 40-50 insurance companies and 200-250 hospitals will integrate in NHCX, which aims to increase interoperability with seamless data exchange between payers and providers.

titles: Friend held in murder of Bengaluru BBA student
descriptions: The Subramanyapura police in the murder case of 20-year-old BBA student Prabuddha, arrested his friend as the prime suspect. The incident occurred in Prabuddha residence at Brindavan Layout, Padmanabhanagar. Mother of Prabuddha, suspecting foul play in her son's death, lodged a complaint with the police. The police launched an investigation and identified the accused through CCTV footage.

titles: Karnataka driver suspended for driving bus with umbrella
descriptions: The North Western Karnataka Road Transport officials have suspended a bus driver for recklessly driving a bus while holding an umbrella in one hand and the steering wheel in the other during a rainstorm. Hanumanthappa A Killedar, was the driver who has been suspended.

titles: Which cities were the hottest on Friday as Rajasthan's Phalodi saw 49°C temperature?
descriptions: The India Meteorological Department released the data of the hottest cities on Friday, March 24, and it shows that Phalodi in Rajasthan recorded a maximum temperature of 49°C. It was followed by Rajgarh in Madhya Pradesh where the maximum temperature was 46.3°C. Others on the list were Maharashtra's Akola (45.8°C), Gujarat's Ahmedabad (45.5°C), Haryana's Sirsa (45.4°C) and UP's Orai (43.8°C).

titles: Will have system to inform parents of live-in couples: U'khand CM
descriptions: During an interview, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami spoke about how live-in relationships will be regulated. He said, "We'll have a system to inform...parents of those living together in...age group of 18-21. We're not bringing any restriction for people in live-in relationships, we're only concerned about their security." He added that a committee has been formed to frame the rules.

titles: Air India Mumbai-San Francisco delayed by over 18 hours, passenger falls ill
descriptions: Passengers of a Mumbai-San Francisco Air India flight had to wait inside the aircraft for over five hours after the flight was delayed due to a technical snag on Friday. The flight was scheduled to depart at 4 pm but eventually, some passengers deboarded while one fell ill, an official said. It was rescheduled for 10:30 am on Saturday.

titles: 3 including a child injured after speeding car hits them in Nagpur
descriptions: Three people, including a woman and her three-year-old child, were injured after a speeding car hit them in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Friday. Following the incident, a mob vandalised the vehicle and broke its glass. Meanwhile, police have arrested three youths and the car driver in connection with the incident. Police have seized liquor bottles and narcotic substances from the vehicle.

titles: Some may call me crazy but I think God sent me for a purpose: PM Modi
descriptions: In a recent interview, PM Narendra Modi said God sent him for a purpose. "Some may call me crazy but I am convinced that 'Parmatma' (God) sent me for a purpose...Once the purpose is achieved, my work will be one...This is why I have completely dedicated myself to God," he added. He said God makes him do things.

titles: 8 Naxals killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh
descriptions: Eight Naxals were killed in the last 72 hours in an encounter with security forces in the border area of Narayanpur-Bijapur-Dantewada in Chhattisgarh. According to Dantewada SP Gaurav Rai, security forces also destroyed their training camp during the operation. A tiffin bomb, pressure cooker IED, uniform, literature and other arms and ammunition have also been recovered from the spot.

titles: Flyer tries to open flight door mid-air at Hyderabad airport
descriptions: An air passenger, reportedly high on ‘bhang’ tried to open the aircraft door mid-air, just five minutes before its landing at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) in Hyderabad. The incident happened three days ago but it came to light on Friday with the police confirming it.

titles: PM admitted no evidence found in liquor scam: Arvind Kejriwal
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday hit back at PM Narendra Modi saying that the PM himself had admitted in an interview that no evidence had been found against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders in the Delhi liquor scam. "Yesterday, in an interview, the Prime Minister said that evidence was not found because Kejriwal is an experienced thief," Kejriwal said.

titles: Massive explosion in Dombivli kills 8, 60 injured
descriptions: A massive explosion at a Dombivli chemical factory near Mumbai caused widespread panic, damaging buildings within a three-kilometer radius. Eight people died and 60 were injured. Efforts to extinguish the fire continue. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde and officials visited the site. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis called the incident tragic and assured support for the injured.

titles: Two Pune cops suspended for negligence in Porsche car crash
descriptions: Two officials from Yerawada police station in Pune were suspended for not doing their duty after a 17-year-old's Porsche accident killed two people on May 19. Inspector Rahul Jagdale and Assistant Inspector Vishwanath Todkari reported the incident late. Blood samples of the juvenile, who allegedly drank alcohol, were collected late.

titles: Voting begins for 58 seats in 8 States/UTs in 6th phase of Lok Sabha elections
descriptions: Voting has begun in Phase 6 of the Lok Sabha elections for 58 seats in Haryana, Delhi, Bihar, Jharkhand, Jammu and Kashmir, Odisha, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal. Polling for 42 Assembly Constituencies for the Odisha State Legislative Assembly is also taking place simultaneously. The last phase (7th phase) of polling will be on June 1.

titles: Who are the key Lok Sabha candidates as UP goes to polls tomorrow?
descriptions: Polling will occur in 14 Lok Sabha constituencies in UP tomorrow. BJP's Maneka Gandhi, SP's Rambhual Nishad and BSP's Udraj Verma will contest in Sultanpur. In Allahabad, late West Bengal Governor Keshari Nath Tripathi's son, BJP candidate Neeraj, will fight against politician Rewati Raman Singh's son and Congress candidate Ujjwal. Actor Dinesh Lal Yadav aka Nirahua will contest from Azamgarh.

titles: What are the rules for carrying cash during Lok Sabha elections?
descriptions: Citizens are advised not to carry over ₹50,000 cash while travelling during elections under the Model Code of Conduct. Meanwhile, authorities are instructed to report anyone carrying over ₹10 lakh cash or over 1kg gold to Income Tax Department. If a vehicle carrying a candidate, his/her agent or party worker is found with over ₹50,000 cash, then it is seized.

titles: 2 policemen who didn't inform control room about Pune crash suspended
descriptions: Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar has said that two officials who were attached to the Yerawada police station have been suspended for alleged dereliction of duty in connection with the Porsche accident case. He added that the duo didn't inform the wireless control room about the accident. A 17-year-old boy had killed two software engineers with the car.

titles: I wanted to marry a girl from different caste, she didn't agree: Siddaramaiah
descriptions: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, while speaking at an event, spoke about casteism. Recalling his college days, he said, "I wanted to have an inter-caste marriage but it did not happen...When I was studying, I fell in love with a girl...I was intent on marrying her but her family and she did not agree." Siddaramaiah further extended his support to inter-caste marriages.

titles: Wildlife SOS shares pic of elephant comforting struggling elephant
descriptions: Wildlife SOS took to X to share a picture of an elephant named 'Zara' that was seen comforting a fellow elephant 'Arya' with its trunk. Arya was struggling to get up due to pain caused by degenerative joint issues and had to be lifted using crane, the organisation said. Wildlife SOS has elephant care centres in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

titles: Who are the key LS candidates as Haryana goes to polls tomorrow?
descriptions: Polling will occur in all 10 Lok Sabha constituencies in Haryana tomorrow. In Karnal, ex-CM and BJP candidate ML Khattar will contest against Youth Congress leader Divyanshu Budhiraja. Congress' Raj Babbar, BJP's Rao Inderjit Singh and JJP's Rahul Yadav, aka Rapper Fazilpuria, will fight from Gurugram. AAP's Sushil Gupta, BJP's Naveen Jindal and INLD's Abhay Chautala will contest from Kurukshetra.

titles: I do not underestimate anyone, Opposition not my enemy: PM Modi
descriptions: Commenting on Opposition leaders' criticism, PM Narendra Modi said, "I do not consider the Opposition as the enemy." "I never challenge and I want to take them along. I do not underestimate anyone. They have formed the government for 60-70 years. I want to learn the good things that they did," he further said.

titles: Court convicts Medha Patkar in defamation case filed by Delhi L-G
descriptions: A court in Delhi has convicted Narmada Bachao Andolan leader Medha Patkar in connection with a defamation case filed by L-G VK Saxena. Patkar and Saxena have been in a legal battle since 2000. Last year, Gujarat High Court granted interim relief to Saxena by staying criminal trial proceedings against him in a case regarding the alleged assault on Patkar.

titles: IFS officer shares pics of traps found by forest officials in T'gana
descriptions: IFS officer Mohan Pargaien took to X to share pictures of traps found by forest officials, under the 'catch the trap' drive, which were laid to hunt wild animals in Telangana's Siddipet. "An excellent performance of duties on this #BiodiversityDay to protect...our valuable wildlife," he wrote. Pargaien also sought information on poaching and hunting from people and shared helpline numbers.

titles: IFS officer Saket shares pic of leopard hunting monkey, says 'Nature doesn't take sides'
descriptions: IFS officer Saket Badola shared a picture of a leopard hunting a baby monkey and wrote, "It might be a sad sight for many...But that's when we see it from monkey's side." "For leopard, it's critical part of its survival mechanism. This is nature. It doesn't take sides," he added. The picture shared by Saket was captured by Chandrasekhar Chauhan.

titles: Woman creates ruckus, drinks and smokes in public in Hyderabad
descriptions: A viral video on social media shows a "drunk" woman allegedly creating a ruckus in Hyderabad's Nagole. The viral clips show the woman smoking and drinking in public. As the video moves further, people are seen confronting the woman for her acts, but she pays no heed and engages in a heated argument.

titles: Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha pray at Siddhivinayak Temple
descriptions: Actress Parineeti Chopra and her husband and AAP MP Raghav Chadha prayed at the Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai on Friday. Their visit comes after reports claimed that Raghav underwent an eye surgery last month in the UK. He was wearing black sunglasses to cover his eyes but removed them while praying inside the temple. The couple got married in 2023.

titles: Section 144 to be imposed in Kolkata for 60 days from May 28
descriptions: Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal said that IPC's Section 144 will be imposed from May 28 for 60 days or until further orders. The police received information from credible sources that violent demonstrations are likely to take place in the district, he added. As per the order, an assembly of five or more people, carrying weapons, etc will be banned.

titles: Got request to impound Prajwal's passport after nearly a month: EAM
descriptions: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar revealed that the ministry received a request to impound the passport of ex-PM Deve Gowda's grandson Prajwal Revanna, accused of sexually abusing multiple women, from Karnataka "only on May 21". Prajwal reportedly escaped to Germany on April 27. "We immediately acted on it...We've to follow a certain procedure and...procedure is initiated," Jaishankar said.

titles: Video shows car obstructing movements of pedestrians in UP
descriptions: In a viral video, the driver of a black Mahindra Thar is seen erratically driving near Amity University in Noida, swerving and hitting the brakes abruptly, posing a safety risk to others on the road. After the video went viral on X, Noida traffic police took cognisance of it and fined the car owner ₹35,000.

titles: Delhi CM's aide Bibhav Kumar sent to four-day judicial custody
descriptions: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court has put Arvind Kejriwal's aide, Bibhav Kumar, in four days of judicial custody for the Swati Maliwal assault case. A bail hearing for Kumar is set for Monday. This decision came after police took CCTV footage as evidence. The investigation is still ongoing.

titles: Minor girl married off under UP govt's mass wedding scheme
descriptions: A minor girl was allegedly married off during a mass wedding ceremony in Pilibhit. The incident occurred on January 27 in Pilibhit during a mass ceremony called '934 weddings', held under the Uttar Pradesh government's Mukhyamantri Samuhik Vivah Yojana. The victim's mother claimed that the accused forged her daughter's documents to hide her age.

titles: Kejriwal claims PM Modi admits lack of evidence in liquor scam
descriptions: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said PM Modi admitted the excise policy case against AAP leaders is fake due to no evidence. Kejriwal demanded the release of the people arrested in the case, including himself and Manish Sisodia, and added that after 500 raids nothing has been found. He criticised PM Modi for calling him an 'experienced thief'.

titles: Laila Khan's stepfather sentenced to death in her murder case
descriptions: The sessions court on Friday awarded the death sentence to Parvez Tak, Laila Khan's stepfather, in the 2011 murder case of the actress. Laila Khan along with her mother and four siblings were murdered. After convicting Parvez of the charges against him, the court reserved the sentence till Friday.

titles: SP's Azam Khan, wife & son get bail in fake birth certificate case
descriptions: Allahabad High Court has granted bail to Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan, his wife Tazeen Fatma and his son Abdullah in connection with the fake birth certificate case. The court also stayed Azam's conviction but rejected the applications seeking a stay on his wife and son's convictions. The trio were sentenced to a seven-year jail term last year.

titles: EaseMyTrip co-founder Pitti challenges Dhruv Rathee to debate on govt's achievements
descriptions: EaseMyTrip's co-founder Prashant Pitti challenged YouTuber Dhruv Rathee to debate on how current government has changed India for better. He was responding to a video of BJP MP Manoj Tiwari shared by Rathee with the caption, "This is why voting for educated politicians is important." Pitti urged Rathee to show both sides of current government, instead of just "bashing" them.

titles: Used ChatGPT as govt counsel didn't give explanation: Manipur HC
descriptions: Manipur High Court said that it was "compelled" to use Google and ChatGPT 3.5 for "extra" research as it received no response after seeking an explanation from the government counsel regarding the procedures for disengagement of a Village Defence Force (VDF) personnel. While revoking the disengagement of the petitioner, the court observed that it violated "principles of natural justice".

titles: Fake pic claims govt’s online college courses to be free from May
descriptions: A fake picture is circulating online claiming that the Ministry of Education is offering online college courses free of cost from May, PIB Fact Check said. "No such announcement by Ministry of Education. Don't share personal details on any suspicious platforms," it added. The picture claimed that each person taking the course will be given a laptop and a certificate.

titles: Video shows massive flames engulf banquet hall in Delhi
descriptions: A major fire erupted at the Carnival Banquet Hall in Delhi's Alipur area on Friday afternoon, causing extensive property damage. No casualties were reported in the incident. Upon receiving reports of the blaze, fire crews dispatched 13 fire tenders to the scene. They prevented the flames from spreading further and contained the fire.

titles: Kangana Ranaut gives red rose to PM Modi as he campaigns for her
descriptions: Kangana Ranaut gave a red rose to PM Narendra Modi as he campaigned for her in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi. Kangana shared the picture on Instagram along with other pictures and wrote, "I welcome you (PM Modi) to Mandi." Ahead of PM Modi's visit, Kangana addressed a public meeting, and expressed her gratitude for the opportunity to work under PM's leadership.

titles: Flyer in trouble for trying to open flight door midair in T'gana
descriptions: An air passenger landed in trouble after he tried to open the flight door midair just five minutes before its landing at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) in Telangana. The incident happened three days ago but it came to light on Friday with the police confirming it. The passenger has been identified as Anil Patil, a resident of Gajularamaram.

titles: Teen's father sent to judicial custody till June 7 in Pune Porsche crash case
descriptions: A special court in Pune has sent all six accused, including the 17-year-old boy's father, to judicial custody till June 7 in connection with the Porsche accident case. Two people were killed after the teenager ran the car over them. The boy had earlier told the police that his father was aware that he was drinking.

titles: FTII student bags 'La Cinef' award at 77th Cannes Film Festival
descriptions: Film and Television Institute of India (Pune) has won the best short film at the globally prestigious Cannes Film Festival. A short film 'Sunflower Were First Once To Know' by Chidanand Naik, a student of the institute, has won the first prize in the competitive section of 'La Cinef'.

titles: Rajasthan's Barmer hits record 48.8°C temperature
descriptions: Rajasthan is experiencing a severe heatwave, with Barmer hitting 48.8°C, the highest this season. A red alert warns of rising temperatures. Officials' leaves have been cancelled to ensure essential services and residents have been advised to stay indoors. The IMD has issued heatwave alert for several states.

titles: Google to invest $350 million in Flipkart’s fundraising round
descriptions: Google will join e-commerce major Flipkart's cap table as a minority investor, according to a joint statement. The investment is part of Flipkart's ongoing $1 billion fundraising effort. Of this target corpus, parent company Walmart already invested $600 million in December.The latest funding is expected to value the retailer at $35 -36 billion.

titles: Kharge calls PM's Ram Temple bulldozer claim a 'Complete Lie'
descriptions: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge denied PM Modi's claim that Congress would harm the Ram temple, calling it a lie. He said Congress respects all religions and accused the BJP of dividing people and spreading false information. Kharge defended Congress's plans to help the poor and criticized the BJP's opposition to these plans.

titles: India to get next-generation nuclear fuel from Russia
descriptions: Russian state nuclear corporation Rosatom's Director General Alexey Likhachev has said that India will get next-generation nuclear fuel from the country this summer. The statement came amid Atomic Energy Commission Chairman Ajit Kumar Mohanty's visit to Russia. Likhachev also praised the cooperation between the two nations, calling India a key partner in the nuclear area.

titles: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
descriptions: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on his birthday, praying for his long life and health. Vijayan, born May 24, 1945, has been Kerala's Chief Minister since 2016 and is the longest-serving CPI(M) state secretary. He is the first Kerala CM to be re-elected after a full term and holds numerous records.

titles: Army officials' image from 2023 shared with fake claims
descriptions: An image depicting some army officials is making rounds on the Internet with the claim that an Indian army official has been arrested for massive corruption in soldiers' pension program. Upon reverse-searching the image, the DFRAC team found that the image was from 2023 and had been misleadingly shared with the baseless claim on the Internet.

titles: Prega News ad falsely shared as Congress' Mahalakshmi scheme video
descriptions: A 2022 ad of Prega News to celebrate Women's Day has been falsely shared on social media as an ad of Congress' Mahalakshmi scheme, which was launched ahead of Lok Sabha elections. The scheme aims to provide ₹1 lakh/year to every poor Indian family. Meanwhile, the ad showcases four women and talks about women's ability to balance motherhood and careers.

titles: IMD warns of severe heatwave across multiple states on May 25
descriptions: IMD issued a severe heatwave warning for Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Chandigarh, and Delhi on May 25, 2024. Isolated pockets in Madhya Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Gujarat also face heatwave conditions. Residents are advised to stay hydrated and avoid outdoor activities. Authorities urged to ensure the well-being of vulnerable populations.

titles: Village women practice flying drones to enhance farming in UP
descriptions: A video from IFFCO UP shows women agricultural field workers being trained as drone pilots for spraying pesticides, making the job significantly easier for the farming community. The video, was shared with  the caption, "Dry run practice was organised at IFFCO Phulpur in presence of DOF official." It is being done to familiarise women with drone technology.

titles: Leather industry seeks national policy for holistic development
descriptions: The Council for Leather Exports (CLE) has urged the government to formulate a comprehensive national policy aimed at attracting investments, boosting exports, and generating employment opportunities within the sector. CLE emphasised that a holistic approach through a dedicated national policy is crucial for the industry's overall development

titles: Hyderabad to get AI City spread on 200 acres of land along ORR
descriptions: Hyderabad plans to establish a 200-acre AI City along the Outer Ring Road, pending cabinet approval in June. It will also host a Skill University spread over 100 acres. Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy will likely lay the foundation before the Global AI Summit in July, aiming to make Hyderabad India's AI capital.

titles: BJP's Syria Parveen says party lied about Sandeshkhali incident, joins TMC
descriptions: Syria Parveen, a BJP leader and a notable figure in the Sandeshkhali movement, quit the party on Thursday and joined TMC. She accused the BJP of fabricating lies about the situation in Sandeshkhali and highlighted a sting video operation that allegedly exposed the BJP's involvement in instigating women. She said the BJP is focused on politicising issues.

titles: 'Red' heatwave alert issued for 7 states/UTs; list released
descriptions: The IMD has issued a red alert for heatwave in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, West Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat over the next five days. An orange heatwave alert has been issued for Saurashtra, Kutch and West Madhya Pradesh. Meanwhile, Jammu division, Himachal Pradesh, East Uttar Pradesh, East Madhya Pradesh, Vidarbha, Madhya Maharashtra have been issued a yellow heatwave alert.

titles: Who was Bangladesh MP Anwarul who was killed in Kolkata?
descriptions: Bangladeshi MP Anwarul Azim Anar, who was found murdered in Kolkata, hails from Jhenaidah. Anwarul represented Jhenaidah-4 constituency in Bangladesh's Khulna division and was a three-time MP from the country's ruling party Awami League. He arrived in India for medical treatment. According to reports, Anwarul was skinned, his bones were cut into pieces and disposed of in several plastic packets.

titles: Clip shows K'taka doctor treating patient using phone light amid power cut
descriptions: A doctor was seen treating a patient under the flashlight of a mobile phone amid power outage in a government hospital located in Karnataka's Chitradurga district. The power supply was reportedly disrupted due to the intense rainfall. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Meanwhile, BJP criticised the Congress over the matter and labelled the incident as 'Darkness Bhagya'.

titles: Expired dairy items found at Rameshwaram cafe in Hyderabad
descriptions: Food safety authorities in Telangana found expired Black gram (Urad dal) and dairy items at Rameshwaram Cafe in Madhapur. The restaurant said the expired items were meant to be thrown away. After the inspection, Rameshwaram Cafe started an internal investigation and promised to improve hygiene standards at all their outlets.

titles: Businesswoman, Ramnath Goenka's daughter-in-law Saroj Goenka dies
descriptions: Businesswoman Saroj Goenka, also the wife of the late Bhagwan Das Goenka, scion of the famous Express group's founder and the only son of the revered doyen of Indian journalism, Ramnath Goenka, died at the age of 94 in Chennai on May 24. She was a director of Express Infrastructure Limited.

titles: Doctor shows up drunk on duty in Bhopal, video surfaces
descriptions: A video, showing a drunk on-duty doctor at a hospital in Bhopal, has surfaced on social media. The viral clip shows the drunk doctor misbehaving with a police inspector who reached the hospital for the medical examination of a criminal. The accused doctor identified as Praveen Thakur, delayed the medical check-up of the patient by three hours.

titles: Father of 5 girls who cut wife's womb to check baby's gender gets life term in UP
descriptions: An Uttar Pradesh court gave life imprisonment to a Badaun resident Panna Lal, who had cut open his eight-month-pregnant wife's womb in 2020 to check the unborn baby's gender. The couple had been married for 22 years and had five daughters. She said her intestines were left hanging from her stomach. The unborn baby, a boy, didn't survive the attack.

titles: India's engineering exports struggling for growth
descriptions: India's engineering exports witnessed a 3.2% y-o-y dip in April 2024, amounting to $8.67 billion, primarily attributed to lower shipments of metals, notably iron, steel, and copper. This contraction follows four consecutive months of steady growth in the sector. Despite the April setback, the engineering export industry remains optimistic about a potential resurgence in global trade.

titles: Investigation launched into peon's exceptional Class 10 marks
descriptions: A local court in Koppal has initiated an inquiry into the academic credentials of Prabhu Laxmikanth Lokare (23), a peon who achieved an extraordinary 99.5 percent in his Class 10 exams. Originally from Sindhanur taluk in Raichur district, Lokare’s academic prowess secured him a position at the Koppal court despite his limited formal education.

titles: CCTV footage shows Bangladesh MP's killers with suitcase allegedly carrying body parts
descriptions: West Bengal Police have recovered CCTV footage purportedly linked to an apartment near Kolkata where murdered Bangladesh MP Anwarul Azim Anar was last seen. It shows two men walking out, with one carrying a suitcase and the other one carrying plastic bags. The MP's body is feared to have been chopped into pieces and carried in bags and plastic packets.

titles: No pizza party happened at police station: Pune Police on Porsche crash
descriptions: Amid allegations that the 17-year-old who crashed his Porsche in Pune killing two people was served pizza at the police station, Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said, "Pizza party didn't happen at the police station." He claimed that nothing was found in an investigation about preferential treatment given to the accused. The teen was drunk when he crashed the car.

titles: Bibhav Kumar sent to 4-day judicial custody in Swati Maliwal case
descriptions: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court sent Bibhav Kumar, aide to CM Arvind Kejriwal, to four-day judicial custody on Friday over former DCW chief Swati Maliwal assault case. Kumar, arrested on May 18, was produced before court after his 5-day custody ended. The court granted police's request for custody after hearing both sides, Republic reported. He'll appear in court on May 28.

titles: 17-year-old faces 10 years jail in  Pune Porsche accident
descriptions: Pune police commissioner Amitesh Kumar said a minor, who allegedly hit and killed two techies with a Porsche, faces 10 years in jail under Section 304 of the IPC. The Juvenile Justice Board granted him bail but later sent him to an observation home. The police also arrested his father, Vishal Agarwal.

titles: Plan was to show minor was not driving Porsche: Police
descriptions: Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar on Friday said that attempts were made to project that the 17-year-old minor who crashed his Porsche car into a motorbike, killing two persons, was not driving. Sources said the parents of the teenager asked their family driver to take the blame in exchange for cash.

titles: IMD issues warning of severe heatwave across Northern India
descriptions: IMD alerts of severe heatwave across northern India, including Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, and parts of Uttar Pradesh. Isolated pockets in Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, and Vidarbha also to face heatwave conditions on 27th and 28th May 2024. Residents are urged to take precautions amid soaring temperatures to prevent heat-related illnesses.

titles: Bus caught for fake documents in Karnataka, tourists left stranded
descriptions: In a distressing turn of events, 49 tourists hailing from Andhra Pradesh found themselves stranded outside the RTO office in Gadag, Karnataka. Their ordeal began when the private bus they were travelling in, en route from Hyderabad to Karnataka, was seized by officials due to discrepancies in its documentation.

titles: Hyderabad ranks in list of top 10 cities in India
descriptions: Hyderabad is among the top 10 cities in India, according to the Oxford Economics Global Cities Index 2024. It ranks 564 globally and ninth in India, performing best in economics. Delhi tops the list in India with a global rank of 350. New York is first globally. Other Indian cities in the top 10 include Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Chennai.

titles: Irregularities in Forest Department's Root Stock Scheme in Haveri
descriptions: Auditors uncovered irregularities totaling over ₹3.8 crore in the root stock scheme within the Haveri division of the forest department for the fiscal years 2022-23 and 2023-24. The audit, conducted by the office of the principal accountant general of Karnataka, culminated in a report sent to the forest department on April 11, 2024

titles: Aquatic faunal survey of Kerala's PTR reveals fish diversity
descriptions: The first-ever aquatic multi-taxa survey in the Periyar Tiger Reserve (PTR) has revealed an exceptional diversity of predatory insects and fish spread across the various habitats and elevations of the wildlife sanctuary. The number of fish species inside the various water bodies of PTR comprises close to 30 percent of all fish species known from Kerala.

titles: Chopper spins mid-air while landing in Kedarnath, video surfaces
descriptions: A helicopter carrying six pilgrims encountered a technical glitch necessitating an emergency landing in Kedarnath, just 100 meters away from the helipad. The helicopter experienced a technical malfunction in its rear motor, forcing the pilot to initiate an abrupt landing roughly 100 meters prior to the designated helipad. All passengers and the pilot escaped unhurt.

titles: Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar sent to 4 day judicial custody
descriptions: Bibhav Kumar, linked to the alleged assault case involving Rajya Sabha MP and former DCW chairperson Swati Maliwal, has been ordered by the Delhi Tis Hazari Court to undergo four days of judicial custody. His next court appearance is scheduled for May 28. Kumar has been Delhi CM's personal secretary.

titles: 18-yr-old pink e-rickshaw driver from UP wins UK royal award
descriptions: Arti, an 18-year-old e-rickshaw driver from Uttar Pradesh, met King Charles III after winning the Amal Clooney Women's Empowerment Award in London. Arti was honoured for inspiring other young girls through her work with the government's Pink E-rickshaw initiative, which provides safe transport for women with a mission to drive change. Arti arrived in a pink rickshaw at Buckingham Palace.

titles: President conveys condolences for Ambala road accident victims
descriptions: President Murmu expressed profound sorrow upon hearing about the tragic loss of numerous devotees in a road accident in Ambala, Haryana. She extended her heartfelt condolences to the grieving families who lost their dear ones in the unfortunate incident. Additionally, she conveyed her earnest wishes for the swift recovery of those who sustained injuries.

titles: Inquiry on Kerala veterinary college student’s death from May 29
descriptions: The Commission of Inquiry appointed by Governor Arif Mohammed Khan into alleged official lapses of the Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University that led to the death of a student, will commence its sittings from 29 May. The CoI was constituted following the death of 20-year-old Sidharthan JS, found hanging inside the bathroom of the college hostel on 18 February.

titles: Ministry of Road Transport revamps license process
descriptions: Starting June 1, 2024, significant changes in the process of acquiring a driving license in India will streamline procedures, enhance road safety, and reduce vehicular pollution, as announced by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways. Under the new regulations, private driving training centers will conduct driving tests and issue eligibility certificates for licenses.

titles: Water level of Krishna Sagar dam rises after rainfall in Karnataka
descriptions: The Kodagu district recently experienced significant rainfall, with various taluks reporting substantial precipitation. Notably, there is an inflow of 1,456 cusecs and an outflow of 274 cusecs, inclusive of water supply. The copious rainfall has led to a gradual rise in the water level at the Krishna Raja Sagar (KRS) dam

titles: Dy Superintendent reports loss from bank account due to hacking
descriptions: PK Muralidhar, Deputy Superintendent of Police (DySP) of the Hassan sub-division, has fallen victim to a significant financial loss due to alleged hacking of his bank accounts. Muralidhar discovered the loss amounting to nearly ₹16 lakh when checking his phone messages on Monday.

titles: What is Form 17-C that EC has refused to make public?
descriptions: Form 17-C is a document detailing votes cast at each polling station, including data on registered voters, votes via EVMs, and candidate vote counts. It is compiled by presiding officer and verified by Returning Officer. The Election Commission of India refused to publish it during Lok Sabha elections' final phases citing concerns over potential tampering, resulting in debate over transparency.

titles: Poor people in general category too need reservation: PM Modi
descriptions: Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, PM Narendra Modi said, "For 60 years Congress did not even think that there are poor people in the general category too." "They also need a reservation, Congress never thought about these communities," PM Modi said. "Modi came and made a 10% reservation for the poor people of the general category," he added.

titles: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall alert issued for several states ahead of cyclone
descriptions: The IMD has predicted heavy to extremely heavy rainfall over West Bengal, Odisha, Tripura, Manipur, Assam, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Sikkim and Andaman and Nicobar Islands between May 24 and 28. Rainfall is also likely over Kerala, Lakshadweep, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, TN and Puducherry. A depression is likely to intensify into a cyclonic storm over Bay of Bengal tomorrow.

titles: Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is ours, we'll take it back: Shah
descriptions: Addressing a rally in Bihar, Home Minister Amit Shah said, "Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is and will remain ours. We'll take it back. It's BJP's resolution." He said, "Congress, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav and people of the 'Ghamandiya Gathbandhan' try to scare us by saying that Pakistan has atom bombs." He added, "BJP is not afraid of Pakistan’s atom bombs."

titles: Police arrest five in Vijayapura canter robbery case
descriptions: Vijayapura police made a breakthrough in the Canter robbery case in Kolhar, with the arrest of five individuals, including the Canter driver. SP Sonawane informed reporters that a dedicated team was formed to solve the case. The stolen cotton consignment was sold, and the police managed to recover ₹31.1 lakh along with the SUV used in the crime.

titles: Police to quiz cops amid allegations in Pune car crash case
descriptions: The case against Vedant Agarwal, the 17-year-old who allegedly killed two people early Sunday while driving under influence, has taken an interesting turn. There were allegations of Agarwal receiving preferential treatment during his brief stay at the police station after fatally crashing his Porsche. On Thursday evening, reports emerged that senior level officers will probe these allegations.

titles: Gurugram Lok Sabha polls: What's open, what's closed?
descriptions: On May 25, essential services such as hospitals and public transport (including metro and buses) will operate as usual. Commercial establishments, restaurants, and shops will also remain open on election day. Schools and educational institutions, banks, non-essential government services, and liquor establishments will remain closed.

titles: Woman trafficked from Karnataka to Maharashtra
descriptions: In a distressing incident, a 30-year-old woman from Honnalli in Davanagere district, Karnataka, was reportedly trafficked and sold for ₹1 lakh to a man in Solapur, Maharashtra. The Karnataka police swiftly responded by filing an FIR against the three accused, as per the complaint lodged by the victim’s brother at the Honnalli police station.

titles: Farmers struggle with power issues along river banks in Belagavi
descriptions: Farmers in the Belagavi district of Karnataka, are facing significant challenges as they resort to using generators to sustain their crops due to inadequate power supply along the banks of the Krishna River. The high costs associated with renting generators and purchasing diesel have placed a heavy burden on farmers, making irrigation financially burdensome.

titles: Delhi traffic will be affected due to election preparations
descriptions: Voting for 7 Lok Sabha seats is to be held in Delhi on Saturday. Election campaigning has also been halted. Now the commission has started preparing for the elections. In such a situation, there will be movement of a large number of buses and other vehicles related to election duty from 9 am to 5 pm today.

titles: 'Udta Bengaluru': BJP slams Congress govt after rave party arrests
descriptions: BJP criticises Karnataka's Congress government for worsening law and order in Bengaluru, calling it "Udta Bengaluru" because of drugs and rave parties.
