This follows a police bust of a rave party with 86 people, including a Telugu actress, who tested positive for drugs. BJP says immoral gatherings have increased under Congress rule.

titles: 2 BJP councillors disqualified for having 3 kids in Guj's Amreli
descriptions: Two BJP councillors of the Damnagar Municipality in Gujarat's Amreli have been disqualified for having three children, which is in violation of the Gujarat Municipalities Act, 1963. The duo, Khima Kasotiya and Meghna Bokha, opposed the move, claiming they didn't break the rule as the third child was born after the municipality elections. However, the District Collector overruled their objections.

titles: Murdered Bangladesh MP's flesh was separated from bones, mixed with turmeric
descriptions: The West Bengal police suspect that Anwarul Azim Anar, the slain Bangladesh MP, could have been lured into a flat in Kolkata by a woman and then murdered by contract killers. Police suspect he was first strangulated. Later, his body was chopped into several pieces. The flesh was segregated from the bones and mixed with turmeric powder to delay decomposition.

titles: Declining lemon production challenges Vijayapura farmers in K'taka
descriptions: Vijayapura district, renowned for contributing 80% of Karnataka’s lemon production, faces a significant setback as lemon cultivation witnesses a 30% decline over the past five years. The shift towards less water-intensive crops, exacerbated by drought conditions, compounds the issue.

titles: Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh
descriptions: In a significant development, at least seven Maoists were neutralized in an encounter with security forces on the inter-district border of Narayanpur and Bijapur districts in Chhattisgarh on Thursday afternoon. With this successful operation, the total tally of Maoists neutralized this year rises to 112.

titles: Who is Ramakrishna Reddy, YSRCP MLA caught damaging EVM in Andhra?
descriptions: YSR Congress Party MLA Ramakrishna Reddy, who was purportedly seen damaging an EVM in a polling booth in Andhra Pradesh, is a four-time Macherla MLA. He was first elected as MLA in 2009 on Congress' ticket. He quit Congress in 2012 and was later appointed the government whip in the Assembly. Notably, Reddy has been absconding since video went viral.

titles: Father of teen, who crashed Porsche, got award from ex-Guv Koshyari in 2022
descriptions: Vishal Agarwal, the father of the teen who rammed his Porsche into a bike killing two people in Pune, had received an award for excellence in real estate from ex-Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari in 2022. Agarwal heads Bramha Realty & Infrastructure. He was arrested on Tuesday and sent to police custody till May 24.

titles: Cong, BRS, BJP intensify campaigning for T'gana MLC bye-election
descriptions: Campaigning for the Telangana Legislative Council by-election from Warangal-Khammam-Nalgonda Graduates' constituency ends soon. BJP, Congress, and BRS leaders are actively canvassing. Key candidates are Teenmaar Mallanna (Congress), Rakesh Reddy (BRS), and GP Reddy (BJP). Polling is on May 27; vote counting is on June 5.

titles: Raids conducted at two more popular restaurants in Hyderabad
descriptions: The Food Safety Department in Telangana continues restaurant inspections in Hyderabad. Yesterday, Rameshwaram Cafe and Baahubali Kitchen in Madhapur were inspected. At Rameshwaram Cafe, expired urad dal, curd, and milk were found, along with improperly labelled items and uncovered dustbins. Baahubali Kitchen had a heavy cockroach infestation and unhygienic conditions.

titles: 20 injured, 7 killed in an accident in Haryana
descriptions: In a devastating incident on the Ambala-Delhi-Jammu National Highway, at least seven members of a family lost their lives, with over 20 sustaining injuries in a major collision. The accident, involving a truck and a bus carrying pilgrims to the Mata Vaishno Devi shrine, occurred near Mohra village, close to Ambala Cantt.

titles: Actress Laila Khan's stepfather sentenced to death for her murder
descriptions: The sessions court in Mumbai on Friday sentenced Parvez Tak to death for the 2011 murder of his stepdaughter and actress Laila Khan, her mother and four others. Tak, a resident of Kashmir and third husband of Khan's mother, was arrested on July 8, 2012. The family had gone missing in February 2011 from Mumbai.

titles: Mob sets DSP's car on fire after man dies in accident in Gujarat
descriptions: A mob set a DSP's car on fire after a young man died in a road accident in Gujarat. Following the accident, protesting villagers blocked the National Highway in the Sabarkantha district, causing traffic jam stretching over five kilometres. Police had reportedly lathicharged and fired tear gas canisters to disperse the crowd. A video showing the charred vehicle has surfaced.

titles: Severe cyclone will hit Bay of Bengal on Sunday night
descriptions: A storm in the Bay of Bengal may become a severe cyclone, hitting between Sagar Island in West Bengal and Khepupara in Bangladesh around midnight on May 26. Coastal areas will have heavy rain and strong winds up to 100 kmph. Fishermen should stay out of the north Bay of Bengal until May 27.

titles: Zee wants Sony to pay $90mn as merger termination fee
descriptions: Zee Entertainment has asked Culver Max Entertainment (Sony Group Corporation's India unit) for $90 million as part of the fee for terminating the merger deal. In a statement, Zee has said that Culver Max and Bangla Entertainment have "failed to comply with their obligations under the MCA (merger cooperation agreement".

titles: BJP accuses Congress of power shortage in Karnataka hospitals
descriptions: The Karnataka BJP raised concerns on May 21, alleging that a doctor at Chitradurga government hospital had to resort to treating a patient using a mobile phone flashlight due to lack of electricity. Termed 'Darkness Bhagya' by the BJP, this critique targeted the ruling Congress government’s initiative of providing free electricity under the 'Gruha Jyoti' scheme.

titles: DCA seizes misleading Ayurvedic medicines in Telangana
descriptions: On May 23, Telangana's Drugs Control Administration seized ayurvedic medicines falsely claiming to cure diabetes and pneumonia. Ortho Win Gold Oil was among the seized items. Stocks were confiscated from a Gandipet medical shop. This violated the Drugs and Magic Remedies Act, 1954, which prohibits misleading medical advertisements.

titles: Car falls off bridge in Karnataka's Haveri, 4 killed
descriptions: Four lives were lost, including that of a seven-year-old girl, and six others were injured in a devastating accident in Haveri district, Karnataka. The incident took place near Halageri on National Highway 48 in Ranebennur Taluk. The victims were on their way to Tirupati when their car fell off a bridge.

titles: Tamil Nadu wants Kerala to stop Silanthi River check-dam work
descriptions: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Thursday urged his Kerala counterpart Pinarayi Vijayan to immediately stop the check-dam construction across the Silanthi river in Idukki district, as farmers are apprehensive that the move would block the flow of water to Amaravati dam. The check dam aims to provide drinking water to the Vattavada gram panchayat.

titles: Avian flu outbreak in state-run poultry farm in Kerala’s Kottayam
descriptions: An outbreak of avian flu (H5N1) at the government-run regional poultry farm at Manarcad in Kerala’s Kottayam has led to a ban on import of poultry into the district. A decision was taken to euthanize and cremate domesticated and pet birds within a kilometre radius of the farm and disinfect the area, the district administration said on Thursday, May 23.

titles: Man charged for issuing death threat to former legislator
descriptions: A case has been registered at the Puttur Town Police Station against a man accused of sharing a derogatory post on former legislator Sanjeeva Matandoor and issuing a death threat to the senior political leader. The accused, Prajwal Rai, allegedly posted a demeaning message about Matandoor on WhatsApp on May 17.

titles: 86 including actors test positive for drugs in B'luru rave party
descriptions: Karnataka Police busted a rave party at a farmhouse on the outskirts of Bengaluru in the wee hours of May 20, seizing narcotics and arresting five persons. Of the 103 partygoers, so far 86 have tested positive for drug consumption, allegedly including prominent Telugu actor, Hema Kolla.

titles: Reversing SUV crushes man in UP, runs over him again while accelerating
descriptions: An SUV ran over a 70-year-old man twice in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi. CCTV footage showed the man falling after being hit by the reversing SUV, which dragged him for few metres after running over him completely. The SUV's driver stopped the reversing vehicle and moved it forward, running over the man again. Locals saved the man after hearing his screams.

titles: Telangana BJP leader’s son found dead in Australia
descriptions: Telangana native and son of a BJP leader, Arati Arvind Yadav, was found dead in mysterious circumstances in Australia. He left home on May 20 and never returned. His body was discovered in the sea, his identity  was confirmed through DNA. Arvind, settled in Sydney for a decade, had booked tickets to return home with his pregnant wife.

titles: SC rejects plea asking EC to release booth-wise voter turnout data
descriptions: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea by an NGO seeking directions to the Election Commission to release voter turnout data on its website during the Lok Sabha polls within 48 hours. SC said a hands-off approach is needed to be adopted during the elections. On May 17, SC asked EC to respond to the NGO's plea within a week.

titles: Heavy pre-monsoon showers disrupt traffic on Dharwad-Hubballi road
descriptions: Heavy pre-monsoon showers lasting about an hour caused disruptions in vehicular movement along Karnataka's Dharwad-Hubballi road, stretching from KMF to NTTF, on Thursday evening. Citizens, familiar with the area’s susceptibility to flooding during heavy rain, expressed frustration towards BRTS, PWD, and national highway authorities for allegedly overlooking technical advice.

titles: Communal clashes erupt in Belagavi over 'galli cricket' dispute
descriptions: Late Thursday evening witnessed group clashes in the communally sensitive Alwan Galli area of Shahapur suburb in Karnataka's Belagavi. The confrontation arose from a trivial squabble between two groups playing ‘galli cricket’, escalating into verbal altercations and eventually stone pelting.

titles: Secunderabad Conspiracy: 50 yrs of first-ever case against writers
descriptions: May 2024 marks the 50th anniversary of the Secunderabad Conspiracy Case (1974-1989), perhaps the first-ever in then-Andhra Pradesh, or even the country, implicating writers as accused for their writings and speeches. After under two decades of twists and turns, courts finally said the criminal charges could not be proven, adding, “Writing cannot be seditious, and writers cannot be conspirators."

titles: TBSE 10th, 12th Results 2024 to be declared on May 24
descriptions: The Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE) is set to release the results for the Secondary (Class 10) and Higher Secondary (Class 12) exams on May 24, 2024, at 12:30 PM on their official website, tbresults.tripura.gov.in. The results will be available in the form of a provisional marksheet, which can be downloaded using the result link on the Board's website.

titles: Heavy rains continue to lash Kerala, IMD issues red alert
descriptions: A red alert has been sounded again in some districts of Kerala following heavy rains over the past 24 hours. The possibility of heavy rainfall has been predicted by the Central Meteorological Department for Ernakulam and Thrissur districts. Palakkad, Wayanad, Kozhikode, Malappuram, Idukki, Kottayam, Alappuzha and Pathanamthitta districts are put on orange alert.

titles: Thieves steal 24 sovereigns of jewelry in Karnataka's Belthangady
descriptions: Thieves targeted two houses in Palke, Thenka Karandur village, making off with a total of 24 sovereigns of jewelry. They pilfered 20 sovereigns of jewelry and a bag of documents from a cupboard, despite family members being asleep nearby. The occupants of the second house were absent when the theft occurred.

titles: Pune teen was in full senses, they tried to switch driver after crash: Police
descriptions: The 17-year-old boy who killed two techies with his Porsche car, was in his "full senses" and was aware of what he was doing, Pune Police Commissioner, Amitesh Kumar said. He added that they're probing under whose pressure the Agarwal family's driver made a statement claiming he was driving the car. "Effort was made to change the driver," Kumar said.

titles: 60 Indian nationals rescued from Cambodia return home
descriptions: The Indian Embassy in Cambodia rescued the first batch of 60 Indians, who had been stuck in the country due to fraudulent employers. The plight of Indians came to light after 300 of them ‘revolted’ against their handlers in Cambodia. Among the 300, about 150 people are from Visakhapatnam. They were coerced into carrying out cybercrime and Ponzi scams.

titles: Helicopter with Kedarnath pilgrims spins mid-air, video shows people running
descriptions: A helicopter carrying seven people, including pilgrims, made an emergency landing in Uttarakhand's Kedarnath after developing a technical snag on Friday. A video from the spot shows the aircraft spinning while the people on the ground running for cover. Rudraprayag DM Saurabh Gaharwar said the landing happened few metres from the helipad, adding that the pilot averted a major tragedy.

titles: SC to not ask ECI to upload booth-wise voter data amid LS polls
descriptions: The Supreme Court, on Friday, May 24, refused to interfere and direct the ECI during the Lok Sabha polls to publish the booth-wise absolute numbers of voter turnout and upload the Form 17C records of votes polled on its website. A vacation bench said it cannot issue any such directions as five phases of polling have concluded and two remain.

titles: Priyanka not competing as can't invest assets at one place: Kharge
descriptions: Talking about Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi not contesting in 2024 Lok Sabha polls, party's chief Mallikarjun Kharge said, "If we invest all...assets at one place, then what about others as they've to help others too." He stated that Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi are party's "star" campaigners and thousands of people come to "listen to them".

titles: PM Modi expresses grief over tragic road accident in Ambala
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi expressed deep sorrow over the tragic Ambala road accident, which killed seven and injured 25. He extended condolences to the bereaved families and wished for the speedy recovery of the injured. The accident involved a truck and a mini-bus carrying pilgrims to Vaishno Devi. Modi assured that local authorities are providing all possible assistance.

titles: KPTCL issues recruitment order to fill 902 posts
descriptions: The Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL) has issued an order to fill 902 posts, marking a major step in the expansion of the state’s power infrastructure, the state energy department said on Thursday, May 23. "Recruiting 902 new employees will enhance our capacity to meet growing demands for power transmission," KPTCL Managing Director Pankaj Kumar Pandey said.

titles: Monkey Fever outbreak hits Uttara Kannada district
descriptions: The Uttara Kannada district is grappling with a surge in cases of Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD), commonly known as monkey fever, with Siddapura bearing the brunt of the outbreak. According to health authorities, there have been 108 reported cases of KFD in the district so far this year, marking a significant increase since 2019.

titles: Air India announces salary hike for employees
descriptions: Tata Group company Air India has announced an increase in the salary of its employees. The company will also give bonus to the employee. The company has started the appraisal process for increase in salary. This is the first appraisal process after the acquisition of Tata Group. There are approximately 18000 employees in Air India.

titles: Cops suspect Bangladesh MP was honey-trapped before murder
descriptions: Police suspect Bangladesh MP Anwarul Azim Anar could have been "lured" into a New Town flat in Kolkata by a woman and then murdered by contract killers. The West Bengal CID on Thursday detained one person for his alleged involvement in the murder. The person is suspected to have met one of the prime accused in the murder case.

titles: Ex-MP CM Shivraj's younger son Kunal gets engaged, pics surface
descriptions: Ex-Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's younger son, Kunal Singh Chouhan, on Thursday got engaged to his childhood friend Riddhi Jain in Bhopal. Pictures from the ceremony showed the new couple, Kunal and Riddhi, in traditional attire. Riddhi Jain is the granddaughter of Bhopal's renowned doctor, Inder Mal Jain and the daughter of Sandeep Jain, Free Press Journal reported.

titles: IMD warns of heavy rains in WB due to Cyclone Remal, issues alert
descriptions: India Meteorological Department said that cyclonic storm developing in the Bay of Bengal is expected to hit the coasts of West Bengal as a severe cyclone on Sunday. Cyclone Remal could reach a wind speed of 102 km/hr. Meanwhile, IMD has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall in several West Bengal districts, including Kolkata and Howrah.

titles: Diplomatic passport, Schengen visa helping Prajwal
descriptions: The diplomatic passport of Janata Dal (Secular) leader and outgoing MP Prajwal Revanna, who faces multiple rape charges, will expire the day a new Lok Sabha comes into being in June. Investigators believe Prajwal may be having visas other than a Schengen visa that enables him to be on move. If Prajwal loses the election, his passport will automatically expire.

titles: Pune Porsche Accident: Aneesh's mother questions minor's release
descriptions: On May 19, Aneesh Awdhiya and Ashwini Costa were killed after being hit by a Porsche driven by a minor in Pune. Aneesh's mother questions the minor's release, while the family demands he be tried as an adult. "Aneesh was cremated after 52 hours; the minor was out in 15 hours. What kind of law is this?" said Aneesh's uncle.

titles: India’s gig workers escape unemployment but face job insecurity
descriptions: India's nearly 77 lakh gig workers lack social security. Food delivery partners in Delhi highlight their long working hours, pressure to meet daily targets, and the need to travel long distances for minimal pay amid severe heatwaves. While political parties pledge reforms, challenges persist, stressing the necessity of solutions to address workers' struggles.

titles: Death toll in Thane chemical factory blast rises to 9
descriptions: The death toll in the chemical factory blast in Maharashtra’s Thane district rose to nine with the discovery of one more body from the accident site, officials said on Friday. Police have registered a case of culpable homicide against the owners of the unit, Amudan Chemicals, located in Phase 2 of Dombivli MIDC.

titles: NP Singh to move on from Sony Pictures' MD and CEO role
descriptions: Sony Pictures Networks India’s NP Singh has announced that he will be moving on from his role as Managing Director and CEO. "Today, I have a significant update to share. After nearly 44 years in my career, including a rewarding 25-year tenure at SPNI, I have decided to move on from my role as MD and CEO," his message read.

titles: Flyers aboard Singapore Airlines flight report spinal injuries
descriptions: At least 22 of the 229 passengers, who were aboard a Singapore Airlines flight that was hit by turbulence on May 21, have been reported to have suffered spinal cord injuries while six have brain and skull injuries, in the wake of the incident. 20 passengers are still in intensive care.

titles: Actor Hema among 86 tested positive for drugs in rave party
descriptions: The blood samples of those who attended a rave party in Bengaluru have revealed that 86 people, including Telugu actor Hema, tested positive for narcotics, police said, adding she would be interrogated, besides adding her name to the FIR. Police searched a farmhouse on the city outskirts early on May 19 and seized drugs, sound and lighting equipment, and cars.

titles: Fatal accident between two-wheeler and lorry in Karnataka
descriptions: Tragedy struck in Bantwal as a two-wheeler rider lost his life while his son sustained severe injuries in a collision with a large lorry carrying a borewell drilling machine at Allipade on Wednesday night. As the community grapples with the aftermath of the accident, thoughts and prayers are with the victims and their families during this difficult time.

titles: Driver's bail denied in Pune car crash case
descriptions: A 17-year-old inebriated boy allegedly crashed his car into two persons on a bike, killing them on the spot in the wee hours of May 18, in Kalyan Nagar, Pune. The Juvenile Justice Board (JJB) cancelled the bail after outrage from the public and victims' families. The boy's father, a well-known real estate developer, has also been remanded.

titles: What is Phalodi's 'satta' market, that predicts election results?
descriptions: The satta (betting) market in Phalodi, a town near Rajasthan's Jodhpur, has gathered attention for predicting election results. While the term 'khana'- denotes a candidate with a slim chance of winning, 'lagana'- is used if a candidate has better chances. A bookie reportedly said they have people all over India who inform them about voter's mood, caste equations etc.

titles: Bhopal man served dead cockroach in special thali at famous hotel
descriptions: Dinner turned dreadful for a man who was served a dead cockroach with missi roti, paneer, and several other dishes in the special thali he ordered at Bhopal's famous hotel. Shocked, the customer and his friends created a ruckus and reached the kitchen of the hotel. They recorded the video of the thali and posted on social media.

titles: Man dies in hospital after being hit by minor on speeding bike
descriptions: A 32-year old man was killed after a minor in Mumbai's Mazgaon area allegedly hit him with his motorcycle. The deceased, Irfan Nawab Ali Shaikh was hit by a bike driven by a minor aged 15. According to police, the victim was rushed to JJ Hospital where he died while undergoing treatment.

titles: Elderly man crushed under reversing Fortuner SUV in Jhansi
descriptions: A 70-year-old man was run over by a Toyota Fortuner SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, while the driver was reversing the vehicle on a narrow street. A CCTV video from a camera in the locality captured the incident. The footage showed a white Toyota Fortuner reversing on the narrow street hitting the old man and running over him.

titles: Rajasthan couple apologises for obscene bike stunt
descriptions: A couple who was involved in obscene bike stunt on NH52 in Kota, Rajasthan were caught by the police and made to issue a sorry statement over their actions. "The obscene act we exhibited was life-threatening. We will not do such a mistake in future...We apologise to the administration and common people for the mistake we did," they said.

titles: UP man slits wife’s womb to check child’s sex, jailed for life
descriptions: In Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, a man brutally attacked his 8-month pregnant wife, Anita Devi, by slitting her womb to determine the gender of their unborn child. Driven by a misguided belief, he wanted a male child despite having five daughters. Anita survived but tragically lost her baby boy. The court found the accused guilty and sentenced him to life imprisonment.

titles: Athlete Preethi Pal secures her spot at Paralympics
descriptions: Preethi Pal, hailing from Uttar Pradesh, has soared to new heights at the ongoing World Para Athletics Championships in Kobe, Japan. Despite facing daunting challenges, the 23-year-old athlete clinched the bronze medal in the women's T35 200m event, etching her name in the history of sporting glory. With her stellar performance, she earned a coveted quota for the Paris Paralympics.

titles: HC respite for YSRCP MLA in EVM smashing case
descriptions: Andhra Pradesh High Court on Thursday ordered police not to act against YSRCP MLA Pinnelli Ramakrishna Reddy until June 5. Eight police teams were searching for the Macherla YSRCP candidate, who allegedly destroyed an EVM on May 13. The act was caught on camera. Pinnelli was told not to influence probe or witnesses. The next hearing is on June 6.

titles: Tragedy averted as cooking gas tanker develops leak in Kasaragod
descriptions: A potentially catastrophic situation was narrowly avoided when a cooking gas tanker experienced a leak near Chithari KSTP road in Kasaragod on May 23, Thursday. The prompt and coordinated response from emergency services averted a potential disaster from taking place.

titles: Video shows woman sitting in pothole to protest bad roads in Hyd
descriptions: A woman sat in a pothole filled with muddy water to protest against the poor condition of roads in her locality in Telangana's Hyderabad. A video has surfaced showing the woman sitting in the pothole, holding a placard that read, "We want safe roads, won't you?" The incident caused a partial halt to the movement of vehicles on the road.

titles: 7 dead, 20 injured as truck hits bus in Haryana
descriptions: At least seven people died and 20 were injured in a minibus-truck collision near Mohra village, close to Ambala Cantt, early Friday. The minibus, carrying around 30 pilgrims from Uttar Pradesh to the Vaishno Devi shrine in Jammu and Kashmir, was hit by a truck. The injured were taken to a nearby hospital.

titles: BJP worker’s 'murder' sparks protest in poll-bound Nandigram
descriptions: West Bengal’s Nandigram, which goes to polls on May 25, witnessed widespread protests by BJP workers on Thursday over the killing of a woman supporter of the party from the SC community. Calling it a 'state-government sponsored violence', Governor CV Ananda Bose has directed Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to submit an 'action taken' report on the incident to him.

titles: Women loco pilots demand safer postings during pregnancy
descriptions: A group of women train drivers, who suffered miscarriages, has said the Railways Board should frame guidelines to transfer expecting female frontline workers to lighter or stationary jobs in offices, in consonance with the Maternity Benefit (Amendment) Act, 2017. They said Act prohibits an employer from engaging a pregnant woman in arduous jobs as it can interfere with her pregnancy.

titles: Family, BRS hold Congress responsible for leader's murder
descriptions: A BRS leader was murdered in Telangana's Wanaparthy during the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday. His family and BRS alleged that it was "politically motivated". Sridhar Reddy was murdered in an open area where he slept every night. His father held some local Congress leaders responsible for the murder. However, the police suspected a property dispute as the motive.

titles: Biker dies after minor boy on dad's motorcycle hits him in Mumbai
descriptions: A 15-year-old boy riding a bike collided with a 32-year-old man on Nesbit Bridge in the Mazgaon area of Byculla, Mumbai. The man, a local garment businessman, sustained critical injuries and tragically passed away at the hospital. The minor was detained at the scene, while his father was arrested later for allowing him to ride the bike.

titles: After drought, Karnataka braces for above-normal monsoon
descriptions: With Karnataka expecting above-normal monsoon rains, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Thursday directed district administrations to take the necessary precautionary measures. The CM and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar held a meeting through video conferencing with Deputy Commissioners (DCs) and CEOs of Zilla Panchayats of all districts to review the monsoon preparations and drought relief activities.

titles: Teen's grandfather, friend, driver quizzed in Pune car crash
descriptions: Pune Police on Thursday questioned the grandfather of the teen who allegedly rammed his father’s Porsche into a motorbike killing two recently, while a forensic team examined the vehicle. Crime Branch officials also quizzed the friend of the accused and the driver employed by his family.

titles: Nitin Gadkari sends birthday wishes to Bachendri Pal
descriptions: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari extended birthday greetings to mountaineer and Padma Bhushan awardee Bachendri Pal. Taking to X (formerly Twitter), he wrote, "Birthday greeting to the great mountaineer Padma Bhushan Bachendri Pal ji. May you be blessed with good health and long life."

titles: Filmmaker Abhaya Simha addresses AI concerns in film industry
descriptions: Award-winning filmmaker Abhaya Simha highlighted the ethical implications of artificial intelligence (AI) and the need for sensitivity in portraying women and violence in films. He conducted a special session on ‘Film Aesthetics beyond Curriculum’ organized by the Gandhian Centre for Philosophical Arts and Sciences (GCPAS), Manipal.

titles: Teen's blood report on liquor level not important: Pune Police on Porsche crash
descriptions: Pune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said that the report of a test conducted to measure alcohol content in the blood of a 17-year-old teen, who drove a Porsche killing two people, was not important for the investigation. "Our case is that he...was in full senses and had knowledge that his actions...can cause deaths of people," he added.

titles: Remal: Know about first pre-monsoon cyclone of the season
descriptions: Cyclone Remal, the first pre-monsoon cyclone in the Bay of Bengal, is predicted to strengthen and become a severe cyclonic storm by Sunday evening (May 26). It originated from a low-pressure system over the Bay of Bengal. Cyclones may result in heavy rains and strong winds in the region.

titles: Fatal car accident claims life in Karnataka's Chikkamagaluru
descriptions: A tragic accident near Ambale village in Chikkamagaluru has resulted in the death of a car driver due to  drowning, identified as Dinesh (33). The vehicle, traveling from Chikkamagaluru to Ambale village, veered out of control and plunged into a nearby lake, leading to the unfortunate demise of Dinesh. Fortunately, the passenger, Santhosh, escaped the accident unscathed.

titles: LSR, Hansraj among 15 colleges to receive bomb threat
descriptions: Once again, institutions in Delhi received bomb threats via email, this time targeting 15 colleges on Thursday afternoon. The threats were later confirmed to be hoaxes. Notable institutions like Lady Shri Ram (LSR) College, Hansraj College, Ramjas College, Sri Venkateswara College, and IP College were on the list.

titles: Murdered Bangladesh MP Anwarul's skin was peeled & bones chopped in Kolkata
descriptions: Bangladeshi MP Anwarul Azim Anar, who was found dead in Kolkata, was skinned, his bones were cut into pieces and disposed of in several plastic packets, several reports said. West Bengal CID arrested an illegal immigrant from Bangladesh, Jihad Hawladar, who reportedly confessed to his involvement in the murder case. Police claimed he was strangled too.

titles: What's open and what's closed in Delhi on voting day tomorrow?
descriptions: All liquor stores in Delhi will remain closed till 6 PM on May 25 for the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections. Schools and educational institutes will also remain closed on the polling day. Essential services like hospitals and public transportation will function normally. Delhi Metro and DTC bus services will commence earlier than usual on Saturday to assist voters.

titles: Indian man dies after inhaling toxic fumes in Singapore
descriptions: A 40-year-old Indian national died on Thursday after inhaling poisonous gas while cleaning a tank in Singapore. The Indian, who has not been named, was one among three who had fallen unconscious at the waterworks agency’s Choa Chu Kang Waterworks. All three were taken to the hospital, where the worker died. The Indian was employed as a cleaning operations manager.

titles: Nitin Gadkari extends birthday wishes to Kerala CM Vijayan
descriptions: Union Minister of Road Transport & Highways, Nitin Gadkari extended birthday wishes to Pinarayi Vijayan, Kerala's Chief Minister.  Taking to X (formerly Twitter), Nitin Gadkari shared a video that read, "Birthday greetings to the Chief Minister of Kerala Shri Pinarayi Vijayan ji. May you be blessed with good health and long life."

titles: Locals express concern over lack of maintenance in Mangaluru ponds
descriptions: Several major ponds in Mangaluru are undergoing rejuvenation efforts led by MUDA and the Mangaluru Smart City initiative. However, despite significant investments, concerns have risen over the lack of proper maintenance, drawing criticism from locals and environmentalists.

titles: MLC Manjunath Bhandary calls for MLA Harish Poonja's resignation
descriptions: MLC Manjunath Bhandary and Congress district president Harish Kumar have called for the immediate resignation of MLA Harish Poonja over allegations of him supporting individuals associated with the sand mafia. Bhandary and Kumar said Poonja has disappointed and insulted residents of Dakshin Kannada.

titles: No one met Patnaik alone in 10 yrs, he says 'ok' in meet: Sarma
descriptions: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said none of his friends in BJD met Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik alone in the past 10 years. "Whenever someone meets the CM, it's in the presence of VK Pandian (Patnaik's close aide). Naveen only says 'ok, ok'," he stated. He added Naveen says whatever is given to him in writing by Pandian.

titles: Video shows moment of boiler blast at Maha factory that killed 11
descriptions: The death toll in a boiler explosion at a chemical factory in Maharashtra's Thane district increased to 11 on Friday after 3 more bodies were recovered. Besides 11 deaths, over 60 others have been injured in the incident that occurred in the Dombivli Industrial area on Thursday. A CCTV footage showing the moment when the incident occurred has also surfaced.

titles: Rameshwaram Cafe's Hyd branch raided, expired food items found
descriptions: Bengaluru-based Rameshwaram Cafe's branch in Hyderabad was raided by Telangana Food Safety Department officials on Thursday, who found multiple violations. According to them, 100-kg urad dal worth ₹16,000, 10-kg Nandini curd and eight litres of milk were found expired in eatery's kitchen. Additionally, 450-kg improperly labelled rice, 20-kg white lobia and 300-kg unlabelled jaggery were seized.

titles: Look at irony: Prashant's party as it dismisses Congress' rumours of him joining BJP
descriptions: Prashant Kishor's party, Jan Suraaj, has dismissed rumours that he is joining BJP as the National Chief Spokesperson. Jan Suraaj also criticised Congress after its senior leader Jairam Ramesh shared a document that claimed the same. "Look at the irony! Congress, Rahul Gandhi, you all talk about fake news...Now see...how...Jairam Ramesh...is personally circulating a fake document," it added.

titles: CCTV footage shows moment of Dombivali boiler blast
descriptions: A fresh CCTV footage has surfaced on the internet that shows the moment when the incident of the Dombivali boiler blast occurred yesterday. Visuals show footage from various areas where people can be seen running for life after the massive explosion. At least eight people were killed and many were critical among 64 injured in the blast.

titles: Indian student from Andhra Pradesh dies in bike accident in US
descriptions: An Indian student, Belem Atchyuth from Andhra Pradesh, who studied at The State University of New York, died in a bike accident in New York on Wednesday, the Consulate General of India confirmed on X. The Consulate extended condolences to his family, adding that they've called on local agencies to provide assistance to bring his mortal remains back to India.

titles: Mother of Pune Porsche case accused debunks fake viral videos
descriptions: A video of the Pune Porsche accused's mother, Shivani Agrawal, has surfaced online. In the video, she broke down while clarifying that a viral video being circulated with claims of featuring her son is fake. She requested Pune police to protect her son while clarifying that he is currently at a detention centre.

titles: Cyclone Remal expected to hit West Bengal by Sunday evening: IMD
descriptions: IMD has warned that Cyclone Remal is set to hit West Bengal and Bangladesh coasts by Sunday evening. With wind speeds predicted to reach 102 km/h, heavy rainfall warnings have been issued for coastal districts. Fishermen have been advised to stay ashore until May 27.

titles: Dombivli boiler blast near Mumbai kills 7 and injures 48
descriptions: A devastating boiler explosion at a chemical factory in Dombivli, near Mumbai, claimed seven lives and left 48 injured. Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis confirmed the tragedy stating that rescue teams are working tirelessly to contain the fire.

titles: Arunachal CM Pema Khandu mourns passing of Nabam Atum
descriptions: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu mourned the demise of Shri Nabam Atum Ji, lauding his contributions to Arunachal Pradesh's cultural and social spheres. Taking to X (formerly Twitter), he wrote, "Pained to hear about passing away of Shri Nabam Atum Ji...He contributed richly to society."

titles: My character assassination being done every day: Maliwal on case
descriptions: Rajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal said her character assassination is being done every day. Reacting to AAP denying her allegations, she stated, "I wrote exactly what happened to me, word to word." "I am ready to undergo a polygraph test," she added. Notably, Swati has alleged she was assaulted by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's close aide Bibhav Kumar.

titles: Pune teen's mother breaks down while dismissing fake video, tells police 'Protect him'
descriptions: Shivani Agarwal, mother of the 17-year-old boy who killed two with Porsche, clarified a rap video being circulated with claims of featuring her son boasting about how he got away with the accident is fake. In a video shared by her, Shivani is seen breaking down. Referring to Pune Police Commissioner, she said with folded hands, "Please protect my son."

titles: Who are key candidates as Delhi goes to polls tomorrow?
descriptions: Voting for all seven Lok Sabha seats in Delhi will take place tomorrow. BJP is contesting against an AAP-Congress alliance. Congress' Kanhaiya Kumar will face sitting MP Manoj Tiwari from North East Delhi. BJP's Bansuri Swaraj will face AAP's Somnath Bharti from New Delhi. BJP's Ramvir Singh Bidhuri will face AAP's Sahiram Pahalwan from South Delhi.

titles: 7 of a family killed, 20 hurt after bus rams into truck in H'yana
descriptions: Seven members of the same family were killed and more than 20 people were injured after a mini-bus rammed into a stationed truck in Haryana's Ambala on Friday. The incident reportedly took place on the Ambala-Delhi-Jammu National Highway. Around 30 people were aboard the bus and were going to the Vaishno Devi Temple in Jammu and Kashmir, according to reports.

titles: List of cities that recorded over 46°C on Thursday released
descriptions: Rajasthan's Barmer was the hottest Indian city on Thursday as it saw highest maximum temperature of 48.8°C, as per IMD. Other cities that crossed 46°C include Ganganagar (46.1°C), Bhilwara (46°C), Bikaner (46.5°C), Kota (47.2°C), Jodhpur (47.4°C), Churu (47°C), Phalodi (48.6°C) and Jaisalmer (47.5°C). The list also includes MP's Guna (46.6°C), Gujarat's Gandhinagar (46°C) and Ahmedabad (46.6°C).

titles: Pune teen was drunk but his father said 'let him drive' Porsche: Driver
descriptions: A driver of the family of a 17-year-old minor, who allegedly drove a Porsche and killed two people in Pune, told police that the teen was drunk at the time of the incident. "The driver called the 17-year-old's father, who said 'let him drive'...The driver sat beside the minor while he drove the Porsche," police said quoting the driver.

titles: Bengaluru police arrest five in rave party case
descriptions: Bengaluru police Thursday arrested five people for their involvement in the rave party case and seized numerous drugs like MDMA, cocaine and marijuana. The police also tested 98 party goers for drugs and narcotics. Reports said, of 98 party goers, 86 have tested positive for narcotic traces.

titles: 32-yr-old man dies after 15-yr-old hits him with his bike in Mumbai
descriptions: A 32-year-old was killed on Thursday after being hit by a bike allegedly ridden by a 15-year-old in the Mazgaon area of Mumbai. The minor has been sent to a juvenile home while his father has been detained by the police. This comes days after a 17-year-old crashed his Porsche into a bike, killing two engineers in Pune.

titles: Would have taken Kartarpur Sahib from Pak if I was in power in 1971: PM Modi
descriptions: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said he would have taken Kartarpur Sahib from Pakistan before freeing their troops had he been in power in 1971. The Partition left Kartarpur Sahib, where Guru Nanak Dev spent the last years of his life, in Pakistan's Punjab. "They (Congress) did not do that, but I did as much I could," PM Modi said.

titles: Couple kiss on camera & perform stunt on speeding bike in Rajasthan, detained
descriptions: A video in which a couple can be seen kissing and performing dangerous stunt on a moving bike in Rajasthan's Kota has surfaced on the internet. The video shows the girl sitting on the petrol tank of the bike and kissing the boy. The police identified and tracked down the couple and detained them after their video went viral.
